Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED not worth it”
Reviews.Author: babyboo69
Reviews.Content: As someone who stays in several hotels, I was really looking forward to staying at the W since it prides it's self on taking care of the customer, well it certainly did not!!! Firstly if you have a family then i really don't recommend it, this hotel is for young people. Secondly and most importantly is the air conditioner, it kept breaking down, and they tried fixing it 3 times!!!!! Thirdly there food is overpriced along with the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: dffey
Reviews.Content: i highly recommend the w san diego, they are currently undergoing refurbishment of their restaurant but apart from that my stay was perfect. the staff were very courteous and particularly william on the front desk. i would stay there again without a doubt !

Reviews.Title: “Stay at W Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W San Diego last weekend and we really enjoyed the experience. The room was clean, organized and well appointed. Had room service both Friday night and Saturday morning and both experieces were great! Try the Ceasar Salad with chicken... very good. Anyway, I would stay again. Great hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: Third time I have stayed here and it’s been pretty good each time. I have NEVER asked to change room and I did twice here. The first time I was in a room that had adjoining rooms on each side, the guy on one side decided to get on a conference call at midnight and I could hear every word for the next 30 minutes. I asked the front desk if he was staying again that night and he was so they offered to move me and handled it really well. As soon as I got to the next room I heard a scrapping sound from the lift (I guess it was from there). Every few minutes you could hear metal on metal. Once again I was down to the front desk, they seemed perplexed with what the noise could be and moved me again. I was a bit annoyed when I found out from someone I was travelling with the next morning that she also had to move rooms after a night because of the same metal noise, she happened to be staying on the floor above directly above me. They handled it very well hence the high rating though. Hopefully they have sorted out what the noise was and have it all fixed. All in all it’s a nice place and the staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: Malanamy
Reviews.Content: The service from door-person to cleaning-crew to room-service was excellent and extremely friendly. I would also like to single out Vinney Valentino - who without his assistance my trip would not have been possible. An extremely unusual set of circumstances nearly prevented my attendance at an important national meeting being held in San Diego; the only reason that I was able to attend as scheduled was that Vinney took the time to listen, research and fully understand my predicament. Vinney then ensured that my stay at the W in San Diego went flawlessly. Once again, THANK YOU Vinney. I am pretty certain that without Vinney's direct intervention I can confidently say that I would not have stayed at a W in the future.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 3Alwyngton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in San Diego in early March 2012. The staff was uniformly fantastic, particularly the front desk (ashley shepherd was wonderful), but also The Living Room and housekeeping. Unfortunately, the hotel is undergoing renovations and the restaurant was closed. Looking around, it appears that the renovations are overdue. The hotel is a bit shabby and the rooms could stand a little bit of perking up. Good value, though

Reviews.Title: “Our Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Landon T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the privilege to spend our Honeymoon in the beautiful San Diego, and the HONOR to stay at the W hotel in the downtown area. When we first arrived we were greeted by smiling front desk agents dressed very sharp and professional. They seemed so pleased to see us and our check-in was smooth and seamless. I was exhausted so it was a relief to see that our check-in was done in a matter of 5 minutes! The lobby was an amazing ambiance and had some huge TV's playing music videos and created such a club-like atmosphere. Once we got to our room (a Cool Corner room) we were delighted to see we were treated to a cheese plate, some chocolates, a bottle of wine, and a note congratulating us on our wedding. We loved the size of the room, and even the bathroom! The staff were so helpful too! We needed some help with working our DVD player and i assumed it was going to be a long difficult conversation, but the lady on the phone knew exactly what i was talking about and helped me so quickly. The next morning we needed some advice on a delicious breakfast spot, and the Valet person directed us to this amazing pancake house that had the BEST food! My wife and I felt like celebrities staying at the W. Any time we come back to San Diego we will ONLY be staying at the W Hotel! Do yourself a favor as well, If your in the downtown SD area for a weekend, stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: kanastasi
Reviews.Content: Ashley, at the front desk was great and had good suggestions for places to go, two block from the train station and comp. shuttle within 5 miles of the hotel, nice

Reviews.Title: “W hotels are better...than this one”
Reviews.Author: rcorrao
Reviews.Content: This is my second, and probably last trip to the W San Diego. I love W hotels. I'm a Platinum SPG (100+ nights a year) and for W prices, have high expectations. My last visit was good enough to come back, but this visit will have me stay at another SPG property on my next visit to SD. The rooms are small - very (although the W on Lexington in NYC is technically smaller) - and the service is "okay". At $35 per night the valet (especially in the area of town the hotel is located is ridiculous. No self-park options and street parking is not only limited...but only feet from the local jail, probably not wise either. The do have the signature Acura service, but this time I had my infant with me...they have infant seats....which is great, except, they won't pick you up (even before the 8:30 cut-off) so you can get your infant to the restaurant...just not back. As a platinum spg, one of the perks is a complimentary continental breakfast. At the Westin I stayed at two days ago in DC, I had a full breakfast buffet, including oatmeal, salmon, fruit, etc. The option here was a single bagel a banana and coffee (one of each). The WOW factor of the W is fading for this frequent traveler...especially at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty!”
Reviews.Author: rbyrne1809
Reviews.Content: I've been here for a week to support a conference and am less than satisfied. For a W Hotel this property is sorely lacking in basic cleanliness and maintenance. 1. Large Grease spot on the wall above my headboard from someone's previous romantic interlude. 2. Filthy carpets. Only the middle area of the carpets are vacuumed, there's a crease of dirt around the furniture...bluch! 3. Whoever designed the shower was obviously only thinking of design and not practicality, every shower ends up with a soaking wet bathroom. 4. Mildew all over the bathroom that has been caulked over. 5. Take your life in your hands when sitting in the lobby. Looks great at night with the parties going on and the dim lighting; the daylight hours show what a dirty property this is. Ewww...filthy carpets, past spilled drinks, worn upholstery. 6. This hotel is great for the young crowd that just looks at labels and lives to party. The more seasoned traveler sees through the smoke and mirrors. The good: 1. The Acura car service is great and definitely comes in handy although it only runs from 12:30 - 7:30pm 2. The valet team is so helpful and service oriented 3. The service overall is great, but really doesn't make up for the aesthetics. Bottom line: for the price paid (and I'm a Starwoods Gold Member), I'd pass and head elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: EarthGopher
Reviews.Content: Super modern but not pretentious. Staff genuinely friendly and professional. Beds are very comfortable and ammenities are modern and plentiful. What's with the carpet in the rooms though? It was super soiled. Do some wood flooring for aesthetics and cleanliness! Wi-fi isn't free - big negative!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: kqc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February 2012. Hotel was under construction and restaurant and rooftop bar were unavailable. Also, no spa, though one was advertised. Rooms were average -- a little underwhelming. Definitely not up to the standards of other W hotels that we have stayed at around the country. They had some nice amenities, including rice krispie treats in the lobby. Parking was on the pricey side, especially since cheaper garage parking was available a block or so away. Very much in a business district. Tried to give the hotel feedback (per their request), but never heard back from them. Not sure if they care about improving right now.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, but a few tweaks would make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Diego for three nights in February 2012. From the minute I pulled up to the valet, until I left, the staff and service was nothing but outstanding. I cannot complement them enough. Before arriving I called to ask a couple of questions, and upon arrival there was a personal note from the person I had spoken with along with a lovely fruit tray - outstanding! I needed a late check out, no problem. I needed my luggage in my car a little early, no problem. Room service was great and delivered with a smile and offer of additional help if needed. The rooms themselves were very well appointed. The design was modern and sophisticated, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice. The location is very nice for accessing downtown and the waterfront of San Diego. Many different restaurant options were within walking distance, and I was able to get great recommendations and help from the team working there. The only small tweaks I would recommend to make the W a perfect location are: 1. The carpet and baseboards of the room did show a little wear, perhaps a coat of paint and carpet would take the hotel over the top. 2. The coffee provided with room service was not very good. The food was great, but the coffee tasted like it had been boiled and burned. Overall, I highly recommend the W if you need to stay in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Too Short of a Stay”
Reviews.Author: CMG1984
Reviews.Content: If I only I had stayed at this hotel more than one night. I loved it! The staff were very friendly â€“ especially Jason. The room was immaculate, and, as usual for W hotels, the bathroom was a nice little slice of heaven. The decor was very contemporary, which I love. For a W hotel, the room was big. My room did not automatically come with a coffee machine, but once I asked for one, it was delivered to me in minutes. And, they also provided me with real cream. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting a little more...”
Reviews.Author: DavideKelley
Reviews.Content: I decided to â€œescapeâ€� to San Diego and splurge on a 4 Star hotel for two days and one night. I chose The W because of the branding and it looked like a great hotel with the pictures and reviews. From the moment I pulled up to the valet, the customer service was First Class. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The HR coordinator and hotel manager should be proud of the staff. I was impressed with the lobby, very Chic. The front desk was able to get me into my room about 3 hours early and gave me a great room (for my price range). That is where they fall short. When it was originally done, I could tell the room was very fresh. However, after a couple of years, it has taken its toll. The carpet had stains, the baseboards were coming away from the wall, the walls were scuffed and needed repainting, the blinds had torn cords and the built-in furniture and bed were basically white painted plywood that needed a fresh coat of paint. The location is a little off the beaten path, but if you donâ€™t have a car, they have a free service (nice touch). Also, if you are just up in your room for an hour, the valet will just leave your car out front so itâ€™s extremely convenient to get to when you go in and out. So, the only reason the W does not get a 5 star rating is for the price that I paid, I just expected the room to be almost perfect. I came to hotel to basically stay in the room and enjoy my time at the hotel, but found that I did go out more than I planned since I was a little disappointed. The nice thing is that my only critique is something that can be easily fixed with just some of the money that is brought in by the nightly charges. Oh, and make sure you bring your own snacks unless you want to pay $7 for Gummy Bearsâ€¦Just sayinâ€™. I was thinking about bringing my partner back for a weekend stay, but might wait till they freshen upâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Californian1
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a good experience and would consider staying here again. The staff were professional, helpful, and had a fun attitude. My room was clean and comfortable (Spectacular?). The room next door had a dog, which I could hear from the hallway, but there was no hint of noise once in my room. Loved the window seat. Overall I was well taken care of the entire time. A couple of things to note: The pool is remarkably diminutive. It was a little inconvenient meeting friends downstairs since the elevators require a key to operate above the first few floors, but I appreciate the security. Also the location downtown is relatively deserted, which is the only reason for fewer than five stars. Much is within walking distance, though, and I still recommend giving this hotel a try if you are downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gretchstars
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer after a Padres game and concert. I paid for the room with SPG points, which was nice. We got 2 beds and had 2 couples in the room. The room is small but nice, and very hip. We liked the ambiance. The pool is ridiculously tiny, but the rooftop bar was cool at night. I would stay here again. We also got a free ride to downtown with the Lexus people, so that was nice. Oh, dont talk at 3am though, or security will bang on your door. Walls must be thin, because we are not crazy partiers. I would say that there is a lack of service, but its a comfy and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the modern rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: kmrza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at some nice hotels before but I really like the modern look and feel of the hotel and our room. The service was great from the minute we pulled up. Felt like they were waiting for us. Steven was really friendly and put us in a room with a great view. The room was nice and clean. I was stoked about the iPhone charger/radio hookup. Dont need to bring ipod/iphone charget next time. Forgot my razor and concierge brought up a shaving kit quickly. Overall was a good stay. Would recommend and stay again at another W Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mee21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W last year but wanted to post about it since it was such a great hotel. The service was amazing and the hotel was fantastic. It's located in a great spot and there is plenty to do at the hotel to keep you busy. We really enjoyed the roof top beach style patio with real sand and a big fire pit. The stay wasn't cheap but if your gonna splurge this is a great hotel to do it with.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY UNTIL RENO'S ARE COMPLETE!!”
Reviews.Author: Shainabb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip for our Valentines romantic getaway and we have stayed at the W before in differen't cities so we expected only the best! So we booked too nights which were pricey. We get here and once settled in go down to check out the pool. The pool is suppose to be heated and its cold. So we call down to the front desk to ask if they can turn the temp up in the pool and they say they will. Then they call us back saying that there are reno's being done on the rooftop bar (which we were looking forward to going to but its closed cause of renos which no one told us about) so the electricity to the pool is currently not working because of the reno's. So we are here till tuesday and very disappointed that we can't use either of those things that the hotel has to offer. The reason we booked this hotel was for the heated pool so we could relax and enjoy ourselves! To spend the money on this getaway it would have been nice to have a heads up. We are very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: lizpani
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the W Hotel was pleasant. The fact that Taco Express is less than 2 blocks away is a real plus. AND Extraordinary Desserts RESTAURANT (not just bakery) was awesome! (It is only a three block walk). AND the USS Midway is close as well. Because of jet lag I kept waking up VERY early and went down to the lobby to read so as not to bother my husband. The nightclub music + music videos is really irritating and main reason I give the hotel 4 instead of 5. I even asked if they would just turn it down and they didn't. At 4:30AM - believe me - there were no young nightclubbers to enjoy the atmosphere, in fact, there was NO ONE else in the lobby except employees. But the rooms were good and the bed was very comfortable. All clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful San Diego”
Reviews.Author: rob s
Reviews.Content: We visit San Diego twice each year to visit our son and this was our first stay at the W. The location is walkable to most of the spots within the City that we like to hit; the Embarcadero, Gas Lamp, Little Italy and CBD. The hotel was undergoing some heavy renovations during our stay, but we were never disturbed by noise or inconvenienced in any way. Staff is courteous and pleasant and the doormen and valet staff were super, don't think I touched the handle of the front door the entire stay. Our room was nice and the bed very comfortable, but I can't say I get the open shower thing with water spilling out onto the floor every time.

Reviews.Title: “Dawn Evans rocks!”
Reviews.Author: ddunleavy
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at the W last week and had a great stay. Beyond the hotel being trendy and centrally located, the service was great - especially Dawn Evans. She was so warm and friendly. Both mornings at breakfast she checked in on me to ensure I had everything I needed. Her fun and welcoming demeanor made my stay that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff experience”
Reviews.Author: Filmguy7
Reviews.Content: I booked a table for a breakfast meeting, however when I got there the restaurant was under construction! The staff gave me a suite with the extra room for my meeting, they truly bent over backwards. i am going back there next week, the vibe is quite cool, but not quite the same as some of the other Ws I have stayed at. But then again its one of the best values Ws you will find.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: melbtraveller09
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice comfortable hotel, but it lacks the Wow factor that you usually expect from a W. Apart from the lobby music and quirky W collateral in the rooms, you could be staying at any hotel chain really. The rooms are nice but not spectacular, the bath towels are awful for a hotel of this standard. Most staff were pleasant and friendly, although you got the feeling there werenâ€™t enough reception staff so the service was a little hit and miss. The location is close to downtown, the gas lamp quarter etc, but itâ€™s a bit of a no manâ€™s land surrounded by vacant blocks and office buildings. Definitely not up to the W standard Iâ€™ve experienced before.

Reviews.Title: “W = Winning”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference about a month ago and was very impressed with the hotel and its service. This was my first time at the W downtown San Diego and never thought to stay there. I ended up talking to one of the banquet servers, Michelle, who recommended that I bring my girlfriend to stay at the hotel because of the great environment for couples. I ended up booking a room and loved every aspect of the hotel, service, and comfy beds! The hotel was clean and contemporary. The service was five star quality and the rooms with the extremely comfy beds will keep me coming back. Michelleâ€™s recommendation was greatly appreciated for the experience my girlfriend and I had. I will definitely put the W hotel at the top of my list next time I need to book a room for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: athensugadawg
Reviews.Content: Downtown in a rather isolated pocket with bailbond companies and buildings that close up at night. Facility itself is nice, there are charges for all services, so be prepared. Property was quite clean, techno in AM in lobby can be annoying. All in all, decent deal and works well for business traveler at a fair cost. Probably would repeat given the price that we got from Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Chic retreat in the city”
Reviews.Author: njhounds
Reviews.Content: What a great fun hotel! Very convenient to the airport (15 minutes in traffic), and walking distance to many attractions, restaurants and the famous gas lamp district. When the cab dropped us off and we entered the lobby, we thought we had stepped into an exclusive club. Lots of well-dressed couples having cocktails in the lobby, (which is also the cocktail lounge) listening to the live music that was provided free. The check-in process was fast and friendly and our room was incredible, with a nice big padded window seat to sit and enjoy the view of the city. Upstairs we found a small heated swimming pool with lounge chairs and an exercise room. On the upper level of the roof is a fabulous beach (complete with sand and comfortable seating areas) and an outdoor bar. In the evening there was a DJ and the whole "beach" took on a party atmosphere. This is a great place for the younger crowd, but we also noticed quite a few families with kids and also some business people staying there. The food in the restaurant was very good (unusual interesting breakfast menu) and friendly wait staff. This is certainly a hidden gem, and quite different to any other Starwood property we have stayed at. We really loved it's modern elegance and fun atmosphere, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent escape from reality”
Reviews.Author: Jacob Y
Reviews.Content: Flying in from Minneapolis, MN I had no idea what to expect as I usually find accommodations with Hilton or Marriott. I had never previously stayed with a Starwood property & thanks to the W San Diego, I have a preference change. I'm a very picky guest in my mind...the type who doesn't let go of errors easily and would rather just try another venue...however this property caught me off guard. From the "Good Morning" "Good Afternoon" "Good Evening" elevator mats to the modern elegance of the lobby to the staff and cleanliness of my room...I was impressed. There was no dust, hair, garbage, damages or anything else of the sort to be found in my room. Every time I was faced with a housekeeper, they smiled and asked if there was anything they could get for me and whether my room was satisfactory. The housekeeper which I saw most regularly was "Diana" and she is an excellent example of quality hospitality within the industry. Also must also extend a special thanks to Stephen at the Front Desk (Apologies should spelling be incorrect) who found me a cell charger, helped me with dinner recommendations and directions, and was courteous in our every other encounter. I also ordered room service which was delicious and arrived very quickly after I had placed my order. Lastly, when I couldnâ€™t find the gym, one of the ladies behind the Front Desk walked out and said it would be her pleasure to escort me as it may be a little confusing to explainâ€¦talk about going above and beyond. I was working 12 hour days and when I got back to the hotel, all I wanted was to shower and relax. Maybe take a nap without being disturbed and perhaps check my emails in the lobby while I had a drink. Thank you to everyone at the property who made my stay so pleasant. Next time I visit San Diego this property will be the first one I call.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorGirl75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W San Diego in May. The weather was still a bit chilly but it didn't effect our weekend at all! The W had fantastic service, a cool atmosphere and gorgeous rooms. We loved the rooftop beach bar and at night enjoyed drinks and a dj under the stars. We also enjoyed a dj inside with salsa dancing. During the day, we used the Acura service to go to the ocean and had some great food, drinks and shopping. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a fun getaway at a trendy fun hotel. Seems like the kind of place that even if you never left the hotel, you'd still have great food and fun. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Naguah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W during a recent business trip so San Diego. I found the hotel to be great value, and a good overall experience. The hotel is located within walking distance from the gas lamp district, with lots of shops and restaurants. There are several public parking options in the area, which is good, as the hotel only offers expensive valet parking. The rooms are great with a very clean and modern design. Thereâ€™s not much in terms of sound proofing, though, as I could hear everything that was going on out in the hall. And even on the 17th floor, it felt like trying to sleep in a fire station at times, with all the fire trucks going by day and night. Better quality windows would have helped a lot. I understand that the hotel has some cost associated with offering â€œbroadbandâ€� internet in the guest rooms, but 15 dollars per day is just silly. Yes, they do have free wireless in the lobby area, but that doesnâ€™t really help when your room is on the 17th floor. I did not expect or ask for anything in particular from the staff, but I got the impression that the service level was high. All the staff members that I talked to were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay We've Experienced”
Reviews.Author: lowietoady
Reviews.Content: Good morning, my fiancee and I stayed at your hotel from Friday January 20, 2012 to Sunday, January 22, 2012 and we would really like to say thank you for such excellent service. We have stayed in many hotels, but the hospitality there was supurb. When I had checked in the girl at the front desk was so friendly, I had told her that I was meeting my fiance for the first time in over a month since we're both in the military and when he arrived, it was so nice to get something so simple as a slice of cake and the strawberries. We truly appreciated that, we also loved the hospitality from the valet service, they were timely and so nice, ( I believe they were Lorenzo, and Darion?) Either way, they were so friendly. We enjoyed our experience so much that we look forward to staying with you guys again when I come in from Colorado and he comes in from Twentynine Palms March 2-4. Thank you so much for such a great time. Lauren Landeros & Jason Nungaray

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Fun”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I spent a full week at the W San Diego and had a great stay. I've stayed here a few times now and have always had great service. The W San Diego has a modern and hip atmosphere and the staff is great. The rooms are standard size and the beds are incredibly comfortable. The W caters towards a younger crowd which fits my taste perfectly. There are certain perks from being a Starwood Platinum member that include a room upgrade, free internet, free bottled water, etc. Without status you may feel nickel and dimed to death as this is a full service hotel. Valet parking is the only option at $35 per day unless you want to risk parking on the street. The hotel is located right in between the Gaslamp District and the Little Italy District of downtown San Diego. Both areas are walkable from the hotel, but just beware of the large homeless population that seem to hang near the government buildings a couple blocks away. I'm sure they are harmless, but their presence is noticeable. The fitness center is great and they also have a fun little rooftop pool on the 2nd level. I will be happy to return in the future if priced reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego -- typically great service”
Reviews.Author: wadebloggs
Reviews.Content: I won't lie: I'm a Starwood lifer, and I enjoy most stays at W's, Westins, etc. But I am moved to write about the W San Diego because the people who work there are exceptionally nice and helpful. On my last trip, I wanted to download some podcasts for the traffic-heavy drive to LA. The free wifi in the lobby is fine for normal websurfing, but too busy/slow to download biggish files quickly. I asked the Whatever/Whenever desk for help, and they could have shrugged and said "sorry" -- which would have been the easy thing to do. Instead, they let me into a conference room to use the Meeting room wifi and I was on the road in 5 minutes instead of 35 minutes. Is that a huge deal? No, not in the grand scheme, but it saved me a lot of time and agony -- and I really appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: 20pence
Reviews.Content: Liked the foyer, rooms are good, nice size and comfy beds. Reception staff were good, concierge desk was hit and miss. There were renovations going on but I didn't notice that too much. I think my only gripe was A. The fact you had to pay for Internet and B. It was $15 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mzda
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with a baby and the staff have given their best to make our stay as comfortable as possible. They have helped us to give us everything we needed. The room design is nice and we had a room at the 10th floor so we could have a nice view of the city. I would recommend this hotel and come back everytime Im in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: TerpyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed a place quite like this (this is my first stay at a W). The place is modern and chic while still being very comfortable, especially for couples. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and the service was top notch. The room was the highlight for me. The bed was very comfortable, the amenities were superb, the window sofa made it feel homey, and the chalkboard was fun. I would highly recommend for couples. One important note, they don't offer airport shuttles early in the morning (before 7am) but they called a taxi (already waiting for me when I stepped out the door) and it only took about 5 minutes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tal99
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference in SD, I skipped the conference hotel to stay at the W -- I'm glad I did! It was a typical W experience: hip lobby, wonderful rooms, great restaurant, and free Acura rides when going out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff, noisy room, and a restless night at the W”
Reviews.Author: l3r0wnEyedGurL
Reviews.Content: Similar to the reviewer below, I was unhappy with my recent stay at the W. I was invited to e-mail the General Manager, Suzie Yang, with any comments or issues experienced on my stay, and have since waited 15 days without a response. The following is the email that I sent her on Jan. 5th regarding my stay on Jan 1st and the issues that I experienced: "Hello Suzie, I just received your email regarding our recent stay at your hotel. Although we were only there for one night, we had a few unfortunate incidents while there. We were staying in room 1812. The shower was dripping all night long, and the room door was loose and would rattle loudly on it's hinges any time someone else in the hall opened or closed their door. Then in the morning, your housekeeping staff, disregarding the Do Not Disturb sign on our door, continued to knock several times at 9am. After a late night, this was the last thing that we wanted to deal with. When I opened the door, she said, "Oh, sorry. When are you checking out?" We replied that we would check out by the check out time. She persisted, asking, "When?". After she left our room, I then heard her do the same thing to a neighboring room, who also, incidentally, had their do not disturb sign posted. From what I heard, this man was also very displeased, and rightfully so. Is it normal practice for your staff to badger your guests out of the hotel? After paying $160 for a night, I would expect a much better experience than the one that I received. I will not be staying with W the next time I am in town from LA, but I felt that you should be aware of these issues. Regards"

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a renovation, but you wouldn't know it. From arrival to departure, I had a magnificent experience. The staff is extremely attentive and helpful. The rooms are very modern, clean and quiet. The workout room has the most up to date treadmills and is well appointed. Coffee service is available in the lobby and I had a great breakfast - very well prepared. In all, a great stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible noise, Unresponsive GM”
Reviews.Author: xchillaxinx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on 1/15/12 for 1 night. I arrived at the hotel late at night, and was exhausted from my long drive from LA. I was looking forward to washing up and getting some rest so that I could have a good day at work the following day. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. I washed up, changed clothes, and got into bed around midnight, hoping to get a good 6 hours of sleep. As soon as I was in bed and everything was quiet, I noticed this loud and annoying intermittent noise. The noise sounded like what you would hear when you are watching a tennis match and the ball is being hit by a tennis racket. This noise would start, go on at random intervals for a few minutes, then stop for a while, and then start up again. Unbelievably annoying when you're trying to sleep. Plus, being that it was midnight, I didn't want to deal with the hassle of packing up my stuff, going downstairs to complain, getting a different room, and having to acclimate myself to a new room. I got emails from the hotel asking me to email the General Manager if I had any concerns. I emailed her on Monday, but still haven't had any sort of response and it's now Thursday. What's the point of asking me to send my comments if there's no acknowledgement? An offer to refund me part of the cost of my room would've been nice, but not even an acknowledgement that my email was received? Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice dog friendly hotel, NOT so nice (& not so dog friendly) location”
Reviews.Author: babygoldfish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here one weekend recently with our 2 dogs. It's not the nicest of the W hotels out there, but definitely worth staying...if you get a good deal. We don't always travel with our dogs, but when we do it's nice to stay at a 4 star hotel that really caters to the canines. They brought dogs beds, bowls, treats, etc. to our room right after we checked in. And all the hotel staff were very nice to us and our dogs. The surrounding neighborhood is really not desirable though. Yes, it's close enough to walk to everything (downtown, gaslamp, convention center area, Petco), but only if you're wearing sneakers not heels...meaning it's not the most convenient location. ALSO, maybe you would not want to hike it at night either since it's right next to the courthouse, JAIL & various other attractive businesses such as bail bonds places. For the dog owners out there: One major issue was the lack of ANY grassy areas nearby. It was a bit scary to run the dogs out for a late night/early morning potty break and have to circle around the deserted block to find a nasty patch of dirt for the dogs to go potty.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Maureen L
Reviews.Content: Guests rooms do not have coffee pots or guest chairs. If you want coffee, you have to go to the lobby. There is a defect in the design of the showers; the opening to the walk in shower has a stationary piece of glass that covers only half of the opening - it may have been possible to use the shower without getting water all over the floor with a different shower head, but the low flow shower head was flat and sprayed water in all directions, guaranteeing a wet bathroom floor with every shower. The work desk was comfortable, but had only one outlet. There is a chalk board to use, but no chalk. There is a window seat, but no pillows if you want to use the window seat. Paid for a room with a "fabulous bay view" only the view was largely obstructed by another tall building. Internet service was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably poor experience at this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Barrieh
Reviews.Content: I need to gather my thoughts and compose myself before I describe how this hotel treated myself, my wife and my 3yo daughter during our stay. We are tired and about to step onto a 15h flight home to Sydney, so at this time I will just say "don't stay at the W in San Diego". I promise to provide complete details of what happened to us when we get home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: rileymacdonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days after a trip to Las Vegas. check in was easy. the staff were great. They printed off my boarding passes, gave me band aids and safety pins when needed. they had a shower cap brought to my room when I called down. The bed was a little piece of heaven. The rooms are really fun and funky. I love hopw even the elevator carpet is changed throughout the day!! They offer valet parking at 35 dollars per day. We parked half a block over for 3 dollars. We had breakfast at the bar, it was fine and not to expensive. I thought the staf was great and would love to stay here again! The only downfall was the water that sprayed all over the floor from the shower - not really my problem - I was on holidays! Quality bath products given.

Reviews.Title: “a nice W in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: jg325
Reviews.Content: This was a standard W that I would recommend with nice rooms, but the location is not too great. Like all W's, I have to comment on the lobby. When I walked in, the first thing I thought was, "the building was here before the hotel was." I said that because this W did not feel like a nightclub like other W's do, though there was trance music playing (of course!). The lobby is filled with surfing boards, and has a bar right there. The rooms themselves are pretty standard for a W, that is to say, a bit upscale. They like that modern look, and it was well-executed. Our standard room had a bay window to look out, which was nice. The location of this W is downtown, ostensibly within walking distance to the Gaslamp District (although though we drove). I donâ€™t really see the location as a positive, because I think staying in Gaslamp itself or closer to Balboa or Mission Beach would be nicer. The area around this W is kind of bare, with parking lots and places bail bonds. I did not feel â€œunsafeâ€� walking around or anything, but you canâ€™t just walk outside and feel like youâ€™re in San Diego. The staff was friendly, and attentive when we asked for help with finding gift-wrapping paper when the stores around the hotel were closed. The concierge was helpful, and they could recommend places around the area to see. Competent and professional. The hotel has valet parking, but itâ€™s something like $20 or $30 a day, whereas street parking is abundant and relatively inexpensive. We had a rental car and found parking right in front of the hotel most nights (except on weekend nights when the bar/club at the W was popping). Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the W and felt that for the cheap rate we got, I felt satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated for a "W"”
Reviews.Author: Jake Z
Reviews.Content: After experiencing a couple other W's, the one in San Diego was so-so in my book - mind you, it is a Category 4 hotel in Starwood's book. You can tell most of the furnishings in the lobby, rooms, pool and beach area needed a complete renovation to uphold the W status. The beach bar (3rd floor, open to the sky, views of downtown) was casual and relaxing. Prices at the bar were to be expected...though the $13 mojito wasn't all that impressive in size! The studio room was quaint and cozy. No issues with noise. Overall, this hotel would be a good one-nighter for you business folk or those wanting to explore the gaslamp district, seaport village, etc.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: curbarn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. Close to downtown and freeways. Close to little Italy dining. The hotel itself. Quite a bargain at 119 $ per nite. They make the rate up in parking fees though. Really 35$ per nite? I wasn't made aware of restaurant in the hotel so I can't say anything about it? The pool area was under construction. But the pool area isn't worth it as it seems quite small and tight.

Reviews.Title: “Wow is for Woah”
Reviews.Author: AARDVARKKILLER
Reviews.Content: Traveling through San Diego on our way home decided to stop and book the W in San Diego. We had recently had a great experience at the W in Austin TX. Well here goes. Try and get help with your bags Nope, Try to get a bucket with ice for a bottle of champagn ? You must make 3 calls and a personal request wait 5 hours and if your lucky it will eventually come. It did. Robe for your room, call and ask, reply you want two more, answer no there are none here we would just like 2 . have them upgrade you, we got an upgrade right next to the associate floor closet. Banging all the time night and early Sunday Morning, forget sleeping in. Worst attempt to sleep that night in my last 50 hotel stays The worst, Find somewhere else it has to be better. Check out look for a bellman, take your own cart and get your own things. I hate to say it, W this time is for Worst.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and attractive rooms, but uncomfortable surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: abcMass
Reviews.Content: This was a funny hotel. Very pretentious and "beautiful people" in the lobby bar...we felt underdressed and uncomfortable. The rooms were very nice, although they were unable to give us a room with two beds for our teenagers. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast and service was so-so. One server took our orders without writing them down and I smiled and asked if she got all that...she said yes, then messed up my order! The Wheels car service provided by Acura was very helpful, and the valet staff was pleasant and welcoming. The desk staff seemed cold and not very welcoming. The location was convenient when driving, but not for walking. The courthouse was not far and the hotel is surrounded by the Sheriff's intake location and bail bondsmen. My daughter and I walked back to the hotel from the Gaslamp District and did not feel very comfortable. I would try somewhere else the next time we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Oddly average”
Reviews.Author: Mvated
Reviews.Content: We checked in Friday night to a big party in the lobby. I like to party, however it was funny to scream back and forth with the front desk agent over house music. Room was REAL tight for 4 people (defiantly should have got 2 rooms) and I didn't feel like complaining as we were told room holds 4 comfortably. However, that's my fault and I can't knock the room at all as it was Magnificat. Clean, decent view, modern, and great bath n body products. A 5 in my eye. Outdoor bar was real cool with friendly staff, pool was tiny, and gym was ok. Restaurant looked odd and expensive so we headed a block down to Karl Strauss brewery chich was fantastic and a welcome retreat every afternoon. The location sucks for downtown San Diego it's inconveniently surrounded by bums and shady characters. Little Italy and the bay are close but walking at night made me uncomfortable. Cabs are super cheap so save your walk for later.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems, Unique albeit Average Property for W and the area”
Reviews.Author: mgeolina
Reviews.Content: Neat hotel tucked away at the edge of downtown. Minutes away from both the airport and the Gaslamp District (Bars, Restaurants, Entertainment). Sandy beach bar is more fun to look at than actually be a part of. (Dirty feet if you just want to go down and have a quick drink but then again there are indoor options as well). About halfway between those 2 most likely places in SD that you'll be needing to go if you're from out of town on business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A couple caveats, but still added to my short list of SD hotels”
Reviews.Author: AlikaAlex
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty good stay at this W which is located an extremely walkable two blocks from San Diego's main train station. There seems to bit of construction in progress on their second floor and their spa was either difficult for me to locate or temporarily out of service due to that construction (though I never got around to asking the front desk staff). Since my last visit to the area, it appears The Restaurant has slightly relocated and/or scaled down in size, leaving its former dining room as an odd open area with no clear use (and no direct connection to the outdoor patio). Hopefully that area of the hotel is in line for a future refurb/remodel, as it appeared to be a sort of dead space with no obvious function, other than possibly functioning as an overflow room of some sort. The family and I enjoyed our "Fantastic Suite" on the top floor of the hotel. Though the room did have a few problems, most were remedied quickly by staff: â€¢ The shower drain did not work. The front desk was notified and it was fixed promptly. â€¢ The bathtub's drain switch was stuck in the "drain" position and we were unable to switch it into the "closed" position. Again, staff addressed the issue very promptly. :-) â€¢ As this was the top floor of the hotel, I'm not sure what was directly above us, but the bedroom portion of the suite (Room 1905) suffered from the frequent sound of pipes banging overhead. The issue was reported to the front desk but was not remedied, though I did not ask to be relocated and in all fairness, it sounded to my untrained ear like a problem that could not be easily fixed. The sleep sounds programmed into the bedside iHome radio helped mask some of the noise, however. The suite itself appeared to be comprised of two standard rooms connected with a sliding door (though two never-removed doorstops imply that it used to be a swinging door or was simply two adjoining rooms) with one room converted into a parlor / living room. The 1 3/4 bath setup was great for our needs as my daughter bathed in the tub located off the living room while my wife and I liked the simplicity of the bedroom's glass-walled shower. (The pass-through hole in the glass was a convenient way to turn on the shower from the outside without getting wet in the process, and surprisingly let very little water out.) It's been a while since my last stay at a W, so I don't know if the guest information book that most hotels have in each room was missing in our room or the lack of such a book is part of their Whatever/Whenever service. Staff was very accommodating during our three-night stay, from addressing our repair requests, to answering questions about their complimentary car service, to simply holding open the front door. For a W property, I would have liked to see a little more polish on facility upkeep as the banging pipes issue could easily be a major concern for anyone who is not used to background noise when sleeping, and my family and I did notice little bits of litter (the errant gum wrapper, straw, etc.) in the various hallways of the hotel. Despite its little deficiencies, the W's very rail-friendly location and off-the-beaten-path vibe keep this hotel on my short list of places to stay next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff EVER!”
Reviews.Author: heathersuzanne
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Cool lobby, cool rooms, delicious room service, exceptional staff! Everyone that worked there was SO nice. Good job, W!

Reviews.Title: “Here I come again”
Reviews.Author: Brett H
Reviews.Content: The W has become my favorite hotel in San Diego. I am in SPG guy when I travel for business but otherwise I will stay anywhere. Many time when i travel for pleasure i will find a boutique spot as I feel that si the way to tap into culture. The W in San Diego is my spot no matter business or pleasure whenever I can. Hard Rock is great, Se is fantastic, but the location of the W just outside of the gaslamp madness and conveniently located next to Karl Strauss brewery it does not get much better. The bar is never too crowded, "the beach" is an amazing place to grab a healthy (or not so healthy) snack. and most importantly the rooms feel so comfortable. The quiet nights sleep with a large window for an easy wakeup is perfect. I am headed tomorrow and as long as the service remains the same I will keep coming back. Check it out when you come through So Cal. Also take advantage of the car service they have if you need a ride anywhere just put in a request early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BMIFlyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for a two day meeting at the hotel. The hotel has been well described here. It is very trendy - aiming for the young / hip crowd. The lobby bar and lobby are in general are very nice. All of the staff was very pleasant. The valet's hold the door when you go in, front desk and concierge greet you. Housekeeping is very pleasant. Being a relatively cold December week (mid 50's), the rooftop bar and lobby bar were not all that busy, and noise was not a problem. The rooms are interesting. I really liked the window seat even if my view was of the parking lot and the occasional trolley going by. The bed was very comfortable. I do agree that the somewhat strange shower, while very nice, ends up soaking the whole bathroom. Also, other than the window seat and a desk chair, there was no other seating in my room. I did have a minor problem with my remote not working, but it was quickly replaced even around 10 o'clock at night. Others things I wasn't a big fan of was the $14.95 internet charge ($10 or so is ok, but $15), and the $2.00 charge to make an 800 call. These were both minor issues, but irritating. On the plus side, this hotel is in a great location near the gaslight district, the train station, harbor, and trolley lines.

Reviews.Title: “W hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronald D
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average size,didnt change sheets when we told them to please change everyday! Very loud at night had bar basically in hotel lobby. Overall the W in san diego was average unlike other W hotels i stay in like in new york city were i feel the W in the city is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View!”
Reviews.Author: 619Chris
Reviews.Content: Another great experience at this destination hotel. I needed a little "Honey Lets get away for the night" stay in the city vacation. My husband and I hopped on the trolley and began our relaxing adventure to the city. A quick 1 1/2 block walk to the W Hotel and we were officially on vacation. The lobby was "Living Room" was great with cool artwork and then to the room. 1408 - This urban view room was fun.... Chalk board to play with, large window seating to enjoy a view I wasn't familiar with, and the most comfortable bed. We got dressed and headed to the bar. Their signature drinks sounded great so we asked them to line them up and sampled. My thoughts below. *House Sangria w/cinnamon - Nice, juicy & refreshing. Tastes like Christmas. *Grand Marnier Cooler (grand marnier, canton ginger liqueur, fresh orange) - Very refreshing and dangerous. You forget it has alcohol. *Pink Ryno (bulleit rye, sweet tea vodka, fresh orange, fresh strawberry, stirrings blood orange bitters) - Sweet & carmely. Almost like an Arnold Palmer. *Stargazer (Svedka cherry vodka,, stirrings peach liqueur, fresh limes, cranberry juice, soda water) - Tart wake up drink. *Cucumber Mojito (Effen cucumber vanilla vodka, elderflower liqueur, fresh muddled cucumbers & lemons, mint, soda, spirits) - Refreshing and aromatic. I would say this is a salad in a glass. lol *Ginger Mojito (Bacardi limon, ginger beer, mint, lime, simple syrup) - A more traditional Majito with ginger spice. *Starburst (Svedka vanilla, watermelon pucker, sweet & sour) - This drink takes me back. Tastes exactly like a pink starburst candy. Amazing! *Berry Delicious (Svedka raspberry, muddled fresh blackberries, soda, sprite) - Similar to a flat cherry rum & coke. *Nobletini (Smirnoff strawberry, orange liqueur, raspberry liqueur, lemonade) - Tart and ritzy! *Hibiscus Royale (Chandon rose champagne, sweet Australian hibiscus flower, syrup essence) - Lovely if you LOVE champagne! Which I do! The edible hibiscus flower is amazing!! We hung out at the beach. This is a rooftop beach in the city. Fun to take your shoes off and walk in the sand while enjoying an amazing San Diego sunset. For dinner we ate early and enjoyed a romantic meal. Risotto was perfect, deconstructed Potato Soup, a delicious Filet, and a beautiful chocolate cake called Chocolate Delight. YUM! Relaxing with a touch of High-end was our goal and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jdellheim31
Reviews.Content: This review is a coule months tardy but warranted for the excellent time thatwe had there at the W San Diego. Located minutes away from the heralded "Gas Lamp Quarter" the W San Diego is an asset to the Downtown San Diego area. The W hotel brand "refreshes" itself every 5-7 years to keep its progression as a brand, and the W San Diego appears to be on the beginning stages of the "refresh", so an improvement on a great property should be expected in the near future hopefully. The staff here was attentive and hospitable at all hours [we used their gym at 6:00am before our flight, and the Welcome Desk Agent was pleasantly attentive given the hour] and thier refreshment station had rice crispy squares for the season in the afternoon. The W Bar is busy at night, be prepared to show your key on busier nights so security knows that you are a guest. Their outdoor patio Beach is a great spot for before dinner drinks or a outdoor night cap, the bartender Todd was excellent and busy given it was just after 6:00pm. Major kudos to the W San Diego's concierge Joseph. We had emailed back and forth before our arrival and he had set up our dinner and activites prior to make things seamless. He gave us a great reccomendation at Candella's on Coronado Island [try their Pollo al Chipolte and the Tres Leche Cake for dessert] and he had also set us up for a solid day in La Jolla too. He was a true professional and an asset to the W San Diego. Overall expereince was great and it didnt hurt that San Diego's annual beer festival was happening the first night we arrived!

Reviews.Title: “Urban and beach atmosphere combined”
Reviews.Author: Biernacki
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers an escape into another world, due to its unusual accents from every angle. It features a sand-filled, beachy upper-level terrace surrounded by downtown glitz. Rooms are bright white, combining high-tech with Cape Cod warmth like inviting soft window benches. The room furniture is holding up well, but will be due for replacement soon. My bath featured only a high-tech shower, perfect for me but not for those who prefer a soak in the tub (not sure what is available on request). Public areas are filled with pop art and small pillow corners for hanging out. Part of the vibe is a lobby, partly a living room, that includes a sophisticated collection of books on art and architecture. I did not arrive by auto, but it appears there is no dedicated parking garage, only valet service to nearby garages.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: arough
Reviews.Content: Have to say this was quite a cool hotel. The W was in a central location and easy to walk to most downtown attractions. Rooms were really comfortable and decorated to a high standard with interesting additions i.e. chalkboard. Unique additions to the hotel include a pool and beach bar on the roof. Will def stay at the hotel again on my next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: Kaylab1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a few W Hotels and are never disappointed with the quality and service. This hotel was in a good location, easily walkable to most of the tourist destinations and in a quiet area. The rooms were comfortable, with the W's signature modern furnishings and touches. The only disappointment at this hotel was the pool. It's very small and shoved in the middle of this mirrored courtyard, which was a little weird. However the staff was very friendly, and gave some good recommendations. We'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matthew K
Reviews.Content: Todd from the bar at the Beach was awesome. Def reccomend going and hanging out at the bar with him. We pointed us in the right direction of where we wanted to eat and hang out. It was my girlfriends birthday and you made it special for her. You had champagne and cake sent up to our room and it was amazing. It gave her a smile on her face. The room was nice and needed a little updating and fixing the bathroom. Paint and shower handle. The whenever whereever service needs to be updated too. Lady was rude. Would stay again if in the area. Def would go back to the bar and visit Todd.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with a capital W”
Reviews.Author: BinxyBox
Reviews.Content: At last minute, a decent room with a view was available to me. The decor and design of the room was different from other hotels - instead of an armchair and coffee table, there was a sunbed near the window that warmly welcomed me to lounge in. The burger I ordered was delicious and worth the room service price. I appreciated the chalkboard on which to leave my creative dispatches and the complimentary internet access. I wish I had more time to check out the rooftop bar and soak in the SD warmth!

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: ittybittyboo
Reviews.Content: Downtown you will enjoy the room and the view. Great comfy bed and fine toiletries. Friendly service. You enter from sidewalk small area to park and unload, not expecting that. Good restaurant and room service.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amie O
Reviews.Content: Well worth the money. Very nice, very clean, amazing bathrooms! Awesome pool area, super friendly, attentive service! Beds were comfy, rooms big enough. When we checked in, they brought my children little kid backpacks full of goodies, and at night when we returned, the kids had "turn-down" service where chocolate chip cookies and milk were waiting in the room for them. No charge for this, just a considerate, fun extra for my children! Great location! Great view. Prepare to pay for valet parking, and definitely take the trolley around town - fun! BUT...ask for a room facing the water. The rest of my family was facing the Gas Lamp district and could hear noise all night - even from 11 floors up! My room was water side, and silent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: NjyD
Reviews.Content: Nice room, comfy bed, loved the walk in shower and great location. On the down side - the air conditioning was very noisy and you can hear the trains running through the night. The roof top bar was great and the service at both bars was fine. Unfortunately - the service in the restaurant, for both dinner and breakfast was awful! Both mornings we went down for breakfast we were asked to wait outside the restaurant whilst a table was prepared for us, despite the fact that there were only 3 or 4 other tables occupied. I saw another couple seat themselves in the half empty restaurant, only to be asked to leave and wait in the foyer until the server was ready for them! One morning I ordered the granola with a side order of mixed berries. When they arrived, half the raspberries were mouldy! We ate in the restaurant for Thanksgiving dinner, and made the mistake of ordering from the a la carte menu, rather than special set menu. It was the worst dinner we had during our trip to San Diego, it took ages for our plates to be cleared, we had to wait a long time between courses, we had to ask to hear the dessert options and the food was average at best. I probably wouldn't stay in this hotel again, despite the great location, because I hate starting my holiday mornings grumpy due to the rubbish breakfast service! I really hope the hotel takes this feedback on board and sorts out their restaurant staffing levels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KidTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Diego on 11/19 -20 for 1 night and received a corner suite (RM 614) and absolutely loved the hotel! From the moment I checked in, I was greeted on property by the very helpful valet staff and a bellman ready to assist. The front desk was able to check me in very quickly which helped tremendously because I had an engagement within the hour. The bellman that assisted me escorted me from the second I valet my car all the way until he placed my luggage in the closet for me. I had not anticipated arriving and being completely settled in within 10 minutes so I had plenty of time to relax and enjoy the room. The room as very clean and had a great location. I would have liked to have an ocean view on a higher floor but I was satisfied with where I was put. The hotel house car drove me to my engagement in a timely manner that saved me even more time. I wish they would offer pick-ups but a ride there was enough. On my way out, I did spend some time at the lobby bar, which was very nice and had a cozy feel to it. I enjoyed the modern feel to the hotel because it was tasteful modern. I liked the feel and people seemed nice. I ordered breakfast in the morning and it was delivered very quickly by a very nice server who addressed me by name every single time. I ordered the "Benni" with crabmeat and it was simply amazing! It was so amazing that I went downstairs and ordered a second! I recommend this hotel for anyone looking to relax and get away. I was reading other reviews and donâ€™t agree with the location being horrible because if you are not nickel and diming everything there are plenty of taxies to drive you. To end my trip I texted the number to valet and my car was waiting for to depart. I will definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was hoping for.”
Reviews.Author: vacation_mom_7
Reviews.Content: It's not that this hotel is bad. It is not. It's just not what we were hoping for in our San Diego anniversary get away. We were disappointed at the small pool area with no jacuzzi. The room was pleasant, with a large window seat. Because of the downtown location, the view is not exciting, mostly parking lots and other large buildings. The room, bed and bathroom were all excellent. Parking was very expensive if using valet (there is no free self parking onsite). It seemed like this hotel was aiming at a younger audience than a 40 something couple, with the modern art, large projected videos in the lobby and the rooftop sand floor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not near convention center”
Reviews.Author: BordeauxBaby
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice; not really near anything, but not too far either. If you are going to a conference at the convention center it is at least 1 1/2 miles away! Never ate at the restaurant because NO ONE was ever there and I was afraid the food would be bad. All in all, if I went back to San Diego, I would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: gwen c
Reviews.Content: Went for buisness so happy i didnt pay out of pocket. Relatively clean and food is good. However all rooms have paper thin walls and and plumbing is quite noisy. Reception/bar is often busy with people making it noisy as well. Really annoying, the way to the restaurant through hotel is blockef off so hotel guests are forced to go outside in the cold and take street entrance to have breakfast... Not cool. Internet is 14.00 dollars for 24hrs which i personally find to be a ripoff.. The SPA was closed down, the so-called pool is more like a tub, and the "beach" bar on roof was maybe cool a long time ago, but now resembles an adult sandbox.... Anyway, think there are enough choice of hotels in San Diego to avoid this one.....

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Even better than the online reviews”
Reviews.Author: Sherifwww
Reviews.Content: We could not of asked for anything better!! We greatly appreciate the bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and card that they had ready for our anniversary. Clean room, great atmosphere in the lobby and all the employees greeted us with a smile. Thank you! Will definitely be staying with you guys in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay at W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Silvioflies
Reviews.Content: It was my very first stay at any W hotel, but staying in at least three different hotels a month because of my job, I think I have enough material to compare. I can truly say that the W San Diego is a wonderful place to stay, either on business or just for pleasure as this was the case for me this time. The rooms have a perfect mix of modern style and coziness, lots of amenities and humor. All the toiletries in the bathroom were from Bliss, and just as an example: you don't only get a body wash but also a face wash. One of the best beds I ever slept on! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff is impeccable, thumbs up. The only things that could have been better are 1. the seize of the pool (rather small, but at least there is one) and 2. plenty of cardio equipment in the gym, but little for weight lifting. But back to the plusses. Did you ever stay in a hotel where they change the rugs in the elevator into good morning, good afternoon and good evening? They do here! One more word about the location: there's almost nothing in the direct environment of the hotel, but just a few blocks away, you'll find everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: consuela j
Reviews.Content: We had a quick check in and got straight up to the room. The bed is the first thing I jump on to see how it feels......these beds did not dissapoint. We got ready and went downstairs to the bar where the staff was great. The food was great as was the service. The bartenders were always attentive and knew when I was ready for another drink. I never left the hotel that night due to the fun I was having both downstairs in the main bar and upstairs at the beach bar.

Reviews.Title: “Room 1014, room with a view and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CoronaFallsChurchVA
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so accommodating and friendly. The Acura desk whisks you anywhere for free (within a certain radius but remember to tip). The lobby was packed with Green Bay Packers fans this weekend and everyone was in a great mood, drinking, eating some killer apps and hanging out like the living room atmosphere the W is so well known for. I LOVED my room - great corner room, big, fabulous cool blue/grey colors and you can't beat the Bliss products. Special treat: The Restaurant at the W. Ate here for 2 of my 3 dinners. The Ahi Tuna Tartare was everything i wanted. one of the fish specials was halibut with Yukon gold potatoes in a lemon thyme au jus...beet salad, churros, tomato soup...kim is a fantastic bartender AND person. Make sure you eat there. The Beach on 3 wasn't open but I want to come back and drink up there! Sand and all that matters - they have it there. This W is what I have come to expect from this hotel group; however, this W is easily one of my top hotels - not too large and not too trendy. Still need a good night's sleep and was pleased the soundproofing is strong, so even though this was a busy weekend with some crazy Packers fans (even crazier since they beat the Chargers) i was quitely ensconced in my fabulous room!

Reviews.Title: “W gets an A”
Reviews.Author: JHDX
Reviews.Content: In terms of service and staff helpfulness, this is without question this the best hotel we've ever stayed in. The public areas are interesting and welcoming and the rooftop lounge, with full bar, is a bonus. We liked our room in terms of decor, facilities and comfort. The view (two parking lots and some boring high rise buildings) was not great, but that's to be expected in a downtown hotel. On the negative side we felt the room needed a little fresh paint and a a bit of a refurb (chipped, scratched woodwork; worn door sliders; clumsy DIY window stop made from rough timber etc). And while the room was serviced daily to a reasonable standard, some things obviously hadn't seen a duster for some time (bathroom door glass panel and surround for example). The W is in a good location â€“ the waterfront, a couple of galleries and Little Italy all within easy walking distance. There's a micro brewery pub/diner just around the corner and easy access to public transport. If we visit San Diego again we'd probably stay at the W, but in an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Delvin123
Reviews.Content: The service and accommodations at the W are top notch - I have stayed at this hotel since June and every visit has been an incredible experience - kudos goes out to Spiro, Susie, and the rest of their staff - in particular These are just a few of the great people that work there - Patrick, Mia, Adriana, and Goleta - that's just to mention a few - they know what it takes to go the extra mile - again, excellent people excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, convenient & sexy”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmarts
Reviews.Content: I'm probably the last person on earth who would ever call a hotel "sexy", but the W San Diego is just that. The high-ceiling lobby is filled with beautiful artwork, chic furniture, a full size bar, and an alarmingly attractive staff. Checking in and out was effortless and the valet's attentiveness was unbelievable. At any given time they had at least 3 valet workers running to your car to open doors and help you with your stuff. On the way out they offered directions and free bottles of water for our trip. I really felt like I was living the high life for a modest nightly price, though the parking fee ($35 a night I believe) is a little steep. The actual room was clean and aesthetically pleasing -- nice bedding, modern design, novelty clocks and other doodads, a long bay window with cushioning for people who like to curl up with a book, great Bliss toiletries, a large flat screen and, my personal favorite, a full size chalk board for the kid in all of us. The location was pretty good, although very close to the prison which was a bit unsettling. I think this hotel is perfect for anyone interested in nightlife because the lobby is hot spot at night for partygoers. My only gripes were the fact that you had to pay a pricey daily fee for wireless (free in the lobby, but the lobby gets busy at times as I mentioned above, and also that I could hear a lot of the street noise at night (created by the partiers from the lobby) even though I was on the 5th floor. Overall, a great place that I would stay at again...preferably with a room on a higher floor. OH, and how could I forget the FREE citrus water and RICE KRISPIE TREATS (!!) in the lobby?! I would probably stay in a slum for free Rice Krispie treats, but a great hotel and free treats? Winning.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: My first impression was that this was a funky place... but it grows on you. We were here for a convention in the area. It is centrally located and has great access to public transportation. But you may not need it if you use the courtesy Accura for rides. The room is comfortable and the spa products were refreshed each day. The pool and sand beach combination is certainly not typical for an urban hotel stay. BUT it was the personal attention of the staff that blew me away. They were knowledgeable about the area and what to do and how to get there. Ashley S. at the front desk was esp. helpful when we had friends that left items behind and we required extra attention because we were waiting for a package that wasn't delivered on time. She tracked the item and made us comfortable while we waited. Starwood should be pleased to have her on board. All the staff were pleasant but she went above expectations. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “W = Would stay again - Love San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GrahamC1979
Reviews.Content: The W was great in many ways but slightly lacked the wow factor. The lobby and surrounding paintings are very cool, the staff super friendly and the rooms very comfy but the pool was very disappointing as it's about the size of a bath tub and only has room for about five people to lie next to it. I found this a rather strange design as the rooftop Sand Bar would have made a great location for a slightly larger pool. Sand Bar is good for chilling out during the day but due to surrounding skyscrapers doesn't get much sun past around 3:30pm (in October) and the bar didn't appear to open until around 1pm.. I was also slightly disappointed that during a one week stay there were at least two nights when we couldn't use sand Bar in the evening as they had been reserved for corporate functions. Location wise you couldn't ask for a better hotel as it is a 15 minute drive from the airport, an enjoyable 15 minute walk from 5th and 6th Street where all the bars, restaurants, clubs, and shopping are and I have to admit I fell in love with San Diego. Everyone I met was lovely and also beautiful, it's one of the cleanest cities I've ever been to, the architecture is great, and it's generally a very cool environment. If I could pack my bags and leave London for San Diego I would. Make sure you take a trip to Ocean Beach too - Amazing waves and a very funky, surfer, backpacker type of vibe..

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel San Diego, New fave for my friends and I”
Reviews.Author: SiSand
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The W Hotel was a wonderful experience. We checked in to celebrate two birthdays and enjoy San Diego, we came in from the East County. We were searching for a happy hour that would not be too loud or rowdy. The Concierge, a gentleman by the name of Joseph informed us about the W's own happy hour, we enjoyed a great time in the Living Room and did not even venture from there. The Living Room does need a bit of a face lift, don't get me wrong, it's still a pleasant place for Happy Hour and Joseph informed us that there are renovations planned for the hotel. Our rooms were nice although a bit smaller than I expected yet much larger then the W Hotel's in New York. Another wonderful experience was breakfast in The Restaurant. As we planned to venture out for a late breakfast, we checked in with Joseph the Concierge. He recommended The Restaurant and described the "Benny", we tried The Restaurant and enjoyed delicious meals, I also must recommend the "Benny", it's an amazing presentation of the standard Eggs Benedict. All in all I must rate the W Hotel as one of the best in San Diego. From the Front Desk Staff at check-in, to the informative and friendly Concierge Joseph, to the cleaning staff and Restaurant. This will be our new "ladies" getaway and I will certainly also bring my husband into this hotel to spend a few days away from the East County.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overcharged”
Reviews.Content: This W hotel does not deserve a four-star hotel. Small room, smell not good, noisy lobby..It is a three-star hotel, and weird decoration ..And, it charged my wife's credit card for 16.48 dollars for cashews we did not eat, how ridiculous mistake. I called them and they said they would rebate. We stayed there in October 9th and they charged us on October 12th.... Will never stay in W any more.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: IrishShe
Reviews.Content: In October 2011, my husband and I visited The W San Diego for a short, romantic evening away from home. Our room was perfect, the bar/lounge was cozy and welcoming, the restaurant was fantastic (my husband had Lamb Chops and I, New York steak. Both meals were absolutely delcious!) but it really was the staff that made our experience so enjoyable. We had the wonderful pleasure of meeting Robert Carney, a Manager of the W Hotels. Not only was he very kind and personable with us, we noticed the same interaction amoung the other guests...effortless kindness to every single person. The entire staff made it clear that no matter what you needed, they were there to make your stay perfect. We really couldn't have had a more fabulous time! We look forward to our next visit to the W San Diego, and hope to visti many more W Hotels in the future!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only!”
Reviews.Author: AltaMischa
Reviews.Content: But it was a good night indeed! Will definitely keep The W on my top 5 list for the SanDie area!! Absolutely loved the rooftop beach. Met a beautiful couple who were vacationing from Long Beach for the hubbies birthday and had witty chit chat with the bartender who served great drinks. Very very easy, check-in and even easier check-out! Loved it! See you again next time :-)

Reviews.Title: “Westin Bartender Patrick”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to drop a quick line and rate the experience. I was on a business trip and stopped into the Westin (W San Diego) for a quick cocktail. The space was clean and modern...as are most Westins. The bartenders name was Patrick Howard and he facilitated a very relaxing break from the grind of the day. A couple from out of town and myself enjoyed a couple of drinks and chatted while Patrick was every bit a professional bartender as I would expect. His attention to detail, casual conversation, and attitude was exactly what I was looking for. Thank you Patrick and Westin W San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SeaWorld17
Reviews.Content: W San Diego was so nice! The staff are polite like unbelievable polite!! There rooms were so nice and clean! I loved it! Down Side it's expensive! $35 each day for PARKING! But hey it's california! Right? I recommend staying there! ONLY if you have money! Final Word: it's super nice GO! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - - average quality”
Reviews.Author: nmd76
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is a Chic Style hotel with a great location but you can tell that it's a little worn down in the quality.
