It took them an eternity to unpack all their china-town LV luggage. I walked into the night club of a lobby and waited in line only to be given a key that didn't work for the elevator. After standing in line again i was given a live tutorial on how to use a room key at which time the gentleman realized the key really didn't work. I finally made it to my room. Cute. There was a window bench, fun decor (I agree with the poor cleaning mentioned in other posts though). Then I decided I wanted to go somewhere, so I dialed "Whatever Whenever". Well apparently the highly proclaimed Acura works fewer hours than the average Scottsdale housewife. Oh, and whenever (wherever) I tried to arrange for the car during business hours it was always booked. Then there was the Valet staff. When there was more than one task, eg assisting a Coolio wannabe out of his C class and hailing a cab for a hotel guest (who would have preferred an Acura) they couldn't handle the pressure. Overall I thought this hotel was overly consumed with making as many words as possible start with "W" and having the elevator mats greet according to the current time of day (they were changed for morning afternoon and evening) that they lose sight of old fashioned customer service and hospitality. Oh and the hotel is located within 1 block of 4 separate bail bonds options, for those interested.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..Wonderful...wunderbar....best ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Starwood properties worldwide and at every Starwood property in San Diego. I have not stayed at the W in months and found it refreshing. The W is down the street from the W San Diego (former Wyndham). The lobby has been updated and is much more light and friendly. It used to be very techno-modern with subdued lighting. The concierge is right inside the doorway which was confusing for the front desk. Luckily, I knew where the front desk was. The property still has a basket of green apples at the checking and Ashley was extremely friendly and welcomed me back as if I were a close family member returning from Iraq. Wow! This was followed by delightful whatever/whenever service from Katrina. It is Katrina's pleasant and wonderful voice you hear when you contact the whatever/whenever agent. Too often I take for granted the numerous customer service operators but Katrina was very friendly and helpful and most accommodating making sure I was welcomed. Jessica, guest relations, did an outstanding job in surprising me wi my favorite candy and beverage. I guess the survey I filled out a long time ago really paid off. Thank you for the fruit basket, beverage and gummy bears. Thank you for researching another Starwood property whom may have annotated my record with the suggestion on favorite beverage. You can tell Umit Corut, Sheraton Suites, that he is quickly becoming my second if not bird favorite property. WOW!!!!! Jessica took time inr esearching me prior to staying and I appreciate it and a sign of true hospitality. The W is next door to Karl Strauss which has good beer. Their happy hour is packed so get there eArly. There is a 7-11 convenience store about a block away and you are a short walk to little Italy. I recommend Buon Appetito and Il Sogno di Vino. Reservations are encouraged. Lots of places to eat on India st. At nit, e area is deserted but still safe for walking. The area is well lit and there are lots of folks out. GelAto is a short walk. The W has an outdoor Beach Bar with heated sand and coming from DC, I look forwArd to a Jan/feb visit to the beach bar to stick my toes I. The warm sand. The rooms are fantastic. Bathrooms have subway tile walls and great water pressure. My wife loves the olive oil soap and shower gel/shampoo. The water pressure is great also. All rooms are wired with DVD, flat panel TV, CD stero and iPod alarm clock. The ipod alarm clock does not work with the iPhone. Thank you Jessica, Ashley and Katrina for a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Truly exquisite and beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: BethN42
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to San Diego so I cannot comment on the quality of location...but, it was one of several stays at W Hotels and this was, by far, the very best experience. Clearly, W is known for its uniqueness across all of its US locations, and fortunately, I could expense the bill! But, I was never so overwhelmed by the sincerity and superiority of its service demonstrated by each and every one of its employees - from the moment I entered and checked in at the Front Desk, to the friendliness, interest and engagement of the bartenders, the servers, the in-room service...to the desire to provide the very best value for its price. Amazing. I woke up on my second morning with a terrible cold and just couldn't make it down for the 'complimentary coffee service' in the lobby. All I wanted was some tea with honey and lemon! And, the Front Desk immediately offered to bring me a pot of tea with 'all the trimmings' - to my room, free of charge. When I 'thought' my room charges were a bit 'off', they immediately adjusted my bill to reflect what I presumed was the correct estimation - no questions asked. When I arrived later than expected after a delayed flight from New York, the bartender had no problem in offering to go to the kitchen to 'whip me up a salad' so I could eat something beyond bread with my wine that first night. Manhattan has no shortage of 'expensive' hotels at any level, but we take for granted we're paying for the geography versus optimal service. The W San Diego has no such philosophy in its desire to genuinely 'serve' their guests. I'm very much looking forward to my next business trip to the city....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location Inside and Out”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlier2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in a perfect location. Walking distance to gaslamp and to the harbor where we took a short ferry to Coronado. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms and decor are welcoming, comfortable and fresh. Our suite was full of ammenities to make the stay enjoyable when we weren't out exploring the area. The rooms were generous - - a rare find in a large, established city setting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rodneylee2417
Reviews.Content: The hospitality and service at The W Hotel in San Diego was incomparable. The staff was always willing to help and they truly wanted to make my stay as relaxing and stress free as possible. The location was decent however they did give complementary rides in an Acura wherever in the city you needed to go. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Buzipadilla21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W San Diego 8 times in the last year and have always had a great experience. I am most impressed by the hotel staff, their friendliness and attitude to make my stay an enjoyable experience. The scene is always lively at night, either in the lobby or at The Beach. The food is also very good and they have a very creative menu that constantly changes and stays interesting. While some complain the location is not great, I cannot complain. It is very close to the train (and trolley) station. I always go to Petco Park when I stay and use the Acura Experience to get there. The drivers are friendly and I've never had to wait long (it's like a personal limo to the game everytime). The gaslamp is a 5 or 10 minutes walk away, which is not bad. I refuse to stay anywhere else in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Not that Great”
Reviews.Author: chipmarks10
Reviews.Content: Trendiness of the hotel is decent, they have blacklights in the elevators. However, for all the hype around the hotel, just didn't like it that much- here's why: - The pool has 4 chairs, and is the size of a large bathtub. Get there early, because it's also in a recessed cave that blocks out the sun at certain times of the day. - The rooftop beach is not at the top of the hotel on the 20th floor, it's on the 2nd floor. Rooftop sounds way cooler than "outdoor 2nd floor pool", but might be considered a little misleading. - There was black hair in my sink. - The ipod dock didn't work- I could hear music when I had my ear pressed to the speakers, but cranking the volume all the way up didn't get the volume to reach the other side of my room. - Windows in my room were filthy. - There was a waterfall when you walked up the stairs to the beach- at first I thought this was really cool. The I realized it was from the crew washing soot off the building from a fire they had last year. The W didn't cover the area where the water came streaming down.... the did put towels on the floor so people didn't track water into the ulta-hip lobby. Hopefully they don't reuse those towels... - The Acura free ride anywhere you want is not usually available anytime you really want to use it. - The treadmill that I used in the morning to work out was already warmed up. There was sweat everywhere on it. You might find this appealing... I did not. - I checked in for a meeting and they remembered to tell me that I had a welcome packet waiting for me, but forgot to give it to me. I assumed they meant it was waiting in my room, but they actually meant it was waiting with them. When I called and asked, they did bring it up to my room. So that's pretty overwhelmingly "Not that Great" in my book. The bartender at the beach bar was really friendly, as were the people at the desk. And the decor is really cool. They also have good music, but I've stayed at Holiday Inn Expresses that were cleaner, had bigger pools, and decent amentities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - friendly staff, great rooms and fun vibe”
Reviews.Author: bizdevsue
Reviews.Content: Good central location, and easy to get to off the I-5 freeway. I got upgraded to a high floor and a bigger room due to Starwood status. (Thank you!) I loved the beach bar upstairs, and the modern contemporary feel of this hotel. My only gripe is the low shower pressure in my room (which was on the 17th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by the homeless”
Reviews.Author: rockerchilkd
Reviews.Content: Do not walk home from a night game at Petco the W is in a homeless area of downtown. We were accosted more than once and surrounded just a block from the hotel in the dark at 10:30 pm. I wish the staff would have warned us! I will never saty there again. Hotel was fine but never again.

Reviews.Title: “W san diego is ok”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBobbymcgee
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is not bad but I enjoyed the W Dallas much better. Its very trendy and meets the W standards. Its a good place if you want to walk around downtown and little italy or drive to sea world or the zoo, although get ready to pay a pretty price on parking... Its more of a place for a younger trendy crowd who want to go clubbing and get drunk, you will hear the traffic and police sirens at night as well as drunken youths making noise and running down the hallway at 3am. If you're looking to hang at the beach, you're better off staying in mission beach or Coronado. Over all it's not that bad place for downtown...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for a mom and daughter getaway”
Reviews.Author: Akjones35
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great....staff was friendly, especially the in suite dining staff, Deena in particular. The only thing was the windows in the room needed to be cleaned on the outside. Its in a great location as we were there to run the Rock & Roll Marathon, very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay if you want trendy and modern...”
Reviews.Author: DallasStephanie
Reviews.Content: Everything in the W was modern, trendy, and clean. Plenty of places to grab a drink and socialize. Pool was nice but very small, kinda strange that the pool and beach area were on different levels. If you plan on pool time make sure to check the weather first because San Diego in June is typically overcast and even a little chilly for the pool. The rooms were very unique with features such as a chalkboard and a big window seat overlooking the city. Reminded me of an upscale dorm room that you would see featured in a magazine. Good place for young people (singles or couples), wouldn't recommend for families. The location was OK depending on where you had to go, the more populare areas are a good 15 min walk, but a nice walk if you don't mind.

Reviews.Title: “WOW is Right!”
Reviews.Author: flyboyden
Reviews.Content: The W went over the top on our recent stop. A midweek fashion show was being held right at check in time in the main lobby. Young boys and girls were striping down to underwear which left little to the imagination. That was followed by a topless woman painted in pink promoting the show. All the W hotel staff was clapping along as some of us were attempting to check in. This was one of the worse things I have seen in a long time. Come on W!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a memorable, positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: longbeachmama
Reviews.Content: We arrived thinking we only had one option to park which was valet for $35/night except, Damon, our valet service man, greeted us with a huge smile on his face and told us before we left our car with him that we had 3 options for overnight parking: 1) $35 overnight valet, 2) find non-metered parking around the corner or 3) park in metered parking that ends @ 6pm which becomes free until the next morning and since we arrived around 5pm it was worth parking metered...we got lucky and got a spot right across the street where Damon proceeded to stand there until we unloaded our bags, got into our car, and turned around to park. If that's not perfect customer service, I don't know what is!!!! Then, we got automatically upgraded to the penthouse floor (Starwood Gold Member) but was a bit disappointed that it was still a standard size room. The only downer was that there was no jacuzzi. Other than that, I LOVE staying at this hotel for its casual, hip atmosphere, nice concierge service, and helpful young valet men!!! BTW, we used the free Acura car service (driver Jerry is such a cutie!) that dropped us off at a nearby Thai restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great until the bill came . . .”
Reviews.Author: winnie6992648
Reviews.Content: Because I reserved the room under two names (mine and my roommates) they double charged me for the deposit - $400.00. I found out the day after we stayed when I received a notice from my bank that my account was overdrawn. I called and spoke with the front desk manager and he reversed the one $200 deposit. The next day, they collected their money and not only did they NOT release the remaining $200, they charged another $200. So, now they have their money for the stay and incidentals and IN ADDITION have $400 of MY money on hold. I called and spoke with their accounting office and they informed me they would have to call my bank to have them release the money . . . the bank (as I had just told the hotel) is not responsible for releasing holds - it is the merchant's responsibility. I still don't understand how they were able to reverse it the first time and now they can't . . . I am still fighting for my $400!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessper17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to come to San Diego kind of on a whim and so picking a hotel was sort of a last minute thing. We've had some problems when we've waited until the last minute before but not this time. The W San Diego is a lovely hotel with everything we needed to have a wonderful vacation. We arrived very early but our room was ready so we were able to check in. Considering we left home to catch our flight at 4 a.m. that was greatly appreciated. We stayed in a standard room with a king bed - it was very clean and comfortable and I don't recall having a better nights' sleep than here. I was a little worried when we first came in and saw the lounge area - a couple of reviews I'd read had said it got loud but it was never an issue for us. The pool is heated and open 24 hours, which was nice, and it seems well maintained but it was fairly small. For the two of us, that really wasn't a problem and we only encountered other guests there once. The concierge and desk staff were all very friendly and we got some really good dinner recommendations in the area - definitely appreciated. The only minus, which really isn't that much of a minus, is that the hotel is a little out of the way for someone who might want to be closer to the action, such as in the Gaslamp Quarter. That said, it is a very quick walk to the trolley station as well as to a number of bus stops and Little Italy is only a quick walk away. Of course, the best part is the Karl Strauss Brewery that is right around the corner so a big thumbs up for that. In general, there are plenty of places close by for a meal and any kind of food one might be looking for. We did have to walk to get places once in a while but it was worth it. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the W San Diego and I think we definitely got our money's worth. I would gladly return and stay there again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Meets Personable with Service Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: Notlegallyblonde
Reviews.Content: From the minute we pulled up to the curb to the moment we checked out five days later, everyone at the W made us feel welcomed and special. The W team was friendly, outgoing and incredibly supportive during our stay. The hotel is fun, fresh and funky in it's decor and ambiance. The "beach" bar is a great way to spend an evening relaxing and hanging out with the cool kids.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: trevelyon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W San Diego, May-21-23. Got the room on Spg website for $132 a night. Location was just ok as we were a short $6 dollar cab ride to the Gas Lamp. The lobby was full and lively, which I like about W's. The 2nd floor outdoor bar called the Beach was great also. Drinks were a little pricey though. The room was clean and a typical W room. What I hated about the room was the sliding bathroom door with the glass on it. That is not cool when your trying to use the restroom (esp a #2) and people are in the room. That is the only complaint I have. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally hip”
Reviews.Author: lcatlin
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We were there during the week so it was quite and calm but still had a lot going on. The Beach on the second floor was so awesome! Everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly and helpful (and were always looking sharp). Brett the bartender was very helpful with suggestions on what to do as was Phillip at the front desk. The decore of the hotel was current and tasteful - very pleasing to relax in. We are definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiSun_10
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the W from Miami on May 15 for 2 nights, and returned again on May 18 for 1night. I found an "unmentionable" item in my room that the housekeeper had overlooked. I called and the housekeeping manager was there immediately and removed the item. From that point forward I received a nice amenity with a follow up note and more than one follow up phone call from management. Also, upon my return, I was upgraded as a courtesy because of my former inconvenience. I'm not a high maintenance traveler and did not expect anything more than the removal of the item, but the W went above and beyond to make my stays enjoyable. The service was impeccable throughout both stays and hats off to the staff, who always had a smile and were willing to assist in any matter. Rooms were great (I had the best nights sleep on their mattress than I've had in long time) and the location served me well. Thank you W. I'll be back this summer and will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Times are bad and the W shows it”
Reviews.Author: Marikochan
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about posting this review. I know times are tough in CA and so feel some ambivalence about offering bad reviews. I also know this hotel - among many in San Diego- went bankrupt last year. So this review is directed to the Starwood upper management of W and not necessarily to the W San Diego staff. I have stayed in a number of Ws and try to choose one when on travel. This is my perspective. The W SD already had a number of things going against it. Not located in Little Italy, GSL or waterfront but in an area next to the Jail, Bailbondsmen and office bldgs so not walk-friendly or pleasant. They also seem to be undergoing renovations as one side of the bldg is covered over in plastic with wndows on the west side shrouded in plastic. The "beach" is not pleasant as this deck level has a perfect view of all of the plasic. Also, their supplies of appliances for the room seem to be limited since they can't supply functioning coffee makers in the rooms ('ve now waited two days for one) and the iron is malfunctioning. Oh, and the room is surprisingly small (though fairly well appointed). The staff are pleasant enough. But the overall experience so far is not W quality. Word of advice to W management: you no longer corner the market on hip hotels so a W property poorly maiintained even under bankruptcy has long term consequences for guests thinking about hotels in the future. Unfortunately, I will now think twice about booking a W. I'm staying for the week so we will see how this goes.

Reviews.Title: “The W, Pay more Get Less”
Reviews.Author: San_Deigo_is_Great
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a business conference that was based out of the W. I originally was attending alone, but later a female colleague was added. I called the hotel to added a room to the reservation which I thought was handled quickly and efficiently. During the phone call I specifically told the hotel that it was for a second room and even joked about that my colleague's husband would not be happy if we shared a room. I did not receive an email with the new reservation information. My big mistake for not following up on this. When I arrived the hotel (you guessed it) the hotel had the two of us booked in the same room. They did provide a room after a discussion with the current manager, but at the upgraded price of the 19th floor penthouse room; being on the 5th floor, not upgraded (at least as far as I can tell by the room itself). The room was OK, but not a 200 USD quality. The carpet was stained (though it did not seem to be a undefined type of stain). The shower curtain had the pinkish hue at the bottom seam; you know, the type you get when a object in a humid environment is not clean regularly. There was a 'cat kibble' on the floor next to the entrance to the bathroom. I did not see a sign stating that 'to save water and the environment, please place this placard on the bed to show that the sheets do not need to be changed'; they were not changed. Finally, the electronic lock on the door had to worried to get it to accept my key. To summarize, the W in San Diego was an adequate 120 USD hotel at a higher price. Not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but Cozy”
Reviews.Author: violetzero
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the W hotel when the cabana caught on fire and the hotel had to evacuate. The breakfast the next morning was a nice gesture, but the food itself (fruit aside) was gross. While the lobby area downstairs gets loud and packed at night, my room on the 13th floor was nice and quite. I enjoyed the cozy layout and comfy bed, but was dissappointed to discover that there was no HBO at this location in particular. If you are a stickler for nice pools, exercise rooms and peaceful lobby's this isn't the place for you. But if you are simply looking for a welcoming room to lounge in at the end of a hard day, and you get a discount, I would say book it. The chef at this location recently changed and I had the pleasure of sampling much of what was on the menu. If you are too tired to go out, get the sea bass. The martini's while overpriced, are a great night cap too. The hotel isn't too far from Balboa Park and the harbor, so you can burn it all off the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ark53
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego on a long business trip and needed a lot of help with logistics, advice and scheduling. This hotel became my home away from home, for a variety of reasons, but chief among them was the hospitality and helpfulness of the staff. They went the extra mile for every request, and solved every problem before it happened. A special shout out to their welcome desk agent Melissa H. - She was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: nesbitevans
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the fabulous W Istanbul, I chose the W again for my recent stay in San Diego. The W is a little on the fringe of the city and not in the most salubrious location (one block away from the jail) but still only 10 minutes walk to the Gaslamp district with its many shops (Horton Plaza), restaurants etc. It is also very near to Little Italy with several nice restaurants. The America Plaza trolley bus station is a few minutes walk away from where you can get to the Old Town and Fashion Valley. The W is sleek and fresh with its modern "living room" aka reception and bar area where complimentary Wi-fi can be found. The bedrooms are spacious and well decorated with very good quality beds, duvets and pillows. I found the hotel (10th floor) to be very quiet and slep extremely well. The bathroom was nice and I loved the "hole" in the shower surround enabling me to check the temperature was correct before stepping in. However, water pressure was extremely low and the show disappointing, despite the lovely Bliss toileteries. Another minor grumble is that it would have been nice to have had tea and coffee making facilities in the bedrooms. The Rice restaurant made good breakfasts and I particularly enjoyed the Hot n Frisky Mexican breakfast. The hotel's complimentary Acura service was a real highlight and my colleagues and I used this several times to get to our conference or to go to the Old Town. The bar was good with an impressive list of wines by the glass and some tasty nibbles. However, the second floor beach bar was rather sad - looking quite run down and rather full of people smoking. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the W San Diego and would definitely return again. I like the fact that the W Hotels are not afraid to be different and I much prefer this sort of accommodation to the usual corporate hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Jackal1a2201
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular. Especially the service. Whenever in doubt talk to Melissa Humble at the front desk. Always with a smile and remembers my name every time I walk into the hotel. I always have many other options within San Diego, but I would not trade them for the W Hotel. Also, checkout the bar at Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Second to none in service and attention (specifically Melissa)”
Reviews.Author: canofer
Reviews.Content: Location is great next to the Glp district, Coaster and Little Italy. Rooms were clean; Service second to none. Melissa always made us feel at home and had a friendly smile. Would recommend the facility for business or leisure travels. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient, Easy, and Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: jem92
Reviews.Content: Service was really friendly, and really accomodating. Was out there on business and had a last few minute changes, but the staff at the hotel was really helpful in helping me print and directing me to great restaurants as well. Super nice rooms, really comfortable- had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “W Won My Team”
Reviews.Author: AmberHEventCoord
Reviews.Content: I would like to rave about the stay that I had, along with that of my coworkers. We stayed for the evening of February 24th, and stayed for a seminar that we held on the evening of the 25th. For myself, Iâ€™ve stayed at your hotel before, and fell in love, which is why I insisted that we have our San Diego seminar at this particular location. Luckily, with the help of Jarrod Williams, I was able to make that happen. My experience with Jarrod has been absolutely nothing but wonderful. While remaining a true professional, he was also warm and friendly. He took my budget and ran with it, giving us a truly unique menu and experience. I wish I could clone him and take him to each hotel that we will deal with through the next year. The entire staff that we had the opportunity to work with on the day of the seminarâ€¦ They were so accommodating. The AV was one top of it, the â€œwaitersâ€� were awesome, even bringing me a plate of reception food since I was busy tearing down and packing up from the seminar. Karalyn and Brie set me at ease immediately, and I knew I was in good hands. The fact that I, as the event coordinator, was given a standing ovation as I walked into the reception, just blew me away. And it was most definitely because of your hotel and awesome staff. I have heard nothing but rave reviews about the rooms that we all had, and everyone loved the seminar room, as well as the Wet location that we had for our reception. This event was what we want for all that we hold. It was truly a beautiful, peaceful experience, which is rare in what I do.

Reviews.Title: “An average "W" experience”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Staff = very friendly and helpful without that "W" attitude Acura shuttle service was a plus Location = very close to everything, easy access Beach/Bar = roof top beach/bar was cute and fun Lobby = turns into a club/lounge on Saturday nights. Music was quite loud. AVERAGE: WET = It's more for looks, way too small for swimming SHOWER PRESSURE = on Level 6, not very strong BAD: Our room's windows were very dirty (see pic), did not expect this from this level of hotel. Parking must be done by valet each time, all courteous, but a bit annoying to have to wait for them to drive the car around the block. Furniture, Decor - were a bit beat up.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: No7500
Reviews.Content: The W is a modern hotel with interesting but nice quirks such as chalkboards and kaleidoscopes in the guest rooms. My room was on the 18th floor and I did not hear a sound all night long. It was one of the most restful nights I have had in downtown San Diego and I have stayed in that area quite often. The hotel is easily within walking distance to Little Italy and the Gaslamp. The trolley station is only two blocks away. A manager, Gabrielle K., was extremely helpful when I had a little problem with a complimentary (NOT! :) ) bottle of water in my room. The customer service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and matching customer Service”
Reviews.Author: QE2STAR
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and amenities! Exceptional service: accommodated our special room request for our anniversary and retrieved my phone charger from car and bought it to our room. Nice gift basket awaiting. GO back in a second! Stefan, the manager on duty, was remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Best San Diego Hotel Experience in the Gaslamp...”
Reviews.Author: CaboWabo66
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is great. Perfect location, great outdoor pool and bar in the sand and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Also, my experience with the Front Desk, Melissa Humble specifically, was excellent. I will be a repeat customer anytime my travels take me to the San Diego area!

Reviews.Title: “The staff treated us like we were VIPs - awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: CherieChandler_AZ
Reviews.Content: I would like to say how pleasant our stay was at the W in San Diego. Everyone was super friendly and accommodating. We were treated with respect and made to feel extremely welcome. Kudos to their staff! Though we have family in San Diego, and certainly many other lodging options, we will not hesitate to stay at the W again. Thanks to them for making our stay great.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Frank21961
Reviews.Content: The room was well furnished with a cool design. It was located a little out of the center but everything could be easily reached with a short walk. The rooftop beach patio was a fun place to spend a lazy afternoon. Service was without reproach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic staff and very trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBlade22
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up and checked in the service was excellent, the atmosphere in the Hotel was always buzzing and the staff always friendly and happy to help with a small matter, a special mention for Melissa Humble whom was a complete star helping me in a happy and professional manner always.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sciphi
Reviews.Content: I always have a great stay at this hotel. The hotel quality and atmosphere is excellent. This last time was exceptional made so by the staff, especially Melissa Humble. i was amazed she remembered me from a stay a couple of months before. She again went above and beyond to make my experience special.

Reviews.Title: “They took better care of me than my momma”
Reviews.Author: Skydlimit
Reviews.Content: I show up, ask for a humidifier, 'cause I was flying out to San Diego and my nose starts bleeding like I had gotten my [--] whooped by Manny Pacquiao in the ring. I don't mean a trickle, I mean I had gone to the ER a couple days before bleeding. I go up to the room, and they didn't have one. So, Melissa Humble in the front desk tells me to give them a few minutes. Next thing I know, Lupe in housekeeping went out to buy me a humidifier, AND brings me back some Vicks Vaporub!!!! I LOVE that stuff!!!! It cures EVERYTHING. I grew up on that, and even had it for dinner on some nights when we were that broke back in the 80's! As I went to pick up some medication, Melissa offered to have someone on staff pick it up for me! The only reason I declined was 'cause I wanted to feel the warm breeze. Anyway, the location in great, the room is very nice, plus there's free WIFI if you're platinum. I have never had a hotel take care of me like this before! THANKS W!!!!

Reviews.Title: “my home away from home- staff takes care of me”
Reviews.Author: AAlyeshmerni
Reviews.Content: I stay at the W every time I travel to San Diego- for me its perfectly located a little out of the mess of the gaslamp but walking distance to everything- little Italy, the convention stairs (for exercise) and restaurants and convenience stores. The staff at the hotel (my favorite friendlies are Melissa at the front desk and Eric at the front door/valet) is exceedingly friendly and accomodating. They remember your name, and your preferences and continually make me feel welcome- they genuinely seem happy to see me. It seems there is a club of us that is addicted to their hospitality... so much that we overlook the fact that the rooms are due for a "refresh"... That's really my only complaint- while the hotel is stylish, well appointed, and comfortable- it just feels like some of the rooms are "beat" and need new carpet- but i'm fussier than most on this aspect of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service..all the time..”
Reviews.Author: CinciD
Reviews.Content: Wow! I travel about 25 nights per month and rarely, if ever, do I encounter the level of service and enthusiasm presented nightly by the staff at the W in San Diego. The fantastic service begins at the front door where the valet and bell staff are always smiling and willing to lend a hand or open the door. Melissa Humble is the consumate hostess, greeting my colleagues and me by name as we arrive in the lobby each night. Melissa is always ready with suggestions for restaurants, activities, and consistently finds ways to improve my stay each and every visit. The rooms are always clean, fresh, and fully stocked. I'm continually impressed with the housekeeping staff and their attention to detail in the rooms. It's the attitude of staff and their enthusiam for providing First Class Service for every guest, new or returning, that make the W San Diego feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: NYCVoyageuse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Diego from the East Coast for Labor Day. We are familiar with the Ws in New York and when we got a good rate at the San Diego W, we decide to make a reservation. It has the same feel as the Ws in New York, same hip boutique hotel feel which is great when you consider how large it actually is. There is a fun outdoor bar where there is music on the weekends. They also have a DJ in the lobby area and the indoor music was more house than Top 40. Both were nice and apparently a lot of locals come to dance there too. Parking is a little annoying but if you don't want to bother with valet, they are happy to give you a roll of quarters at the reception so that you can feed the meter (right across from the hotel entrance) every few hours. We didn't eat any meals at the hotel so I cannot comment on the restaurant. They do have some lemon infused water at the entrance which is nice in the hot weather. Generally, exactly the trendy atmosphere and good service I would expect from a W.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GEtravel10
Reviews.Content: I travel for business, so I see a lot of hotels. The W Hotel was upbeat and the accommodations were excellent. The staff was friendly and attentive. Melissa at the Front Desk was the best part of the stay

Reviews.Title: “Trendy without trying too hard”
Reviews.Author: squishlefonke
Reviews.Content: I got a 20% discount to stay at the W through orbitz for my conference in December. The W is a reasonable walk (~15 minutes) from the convention center, closer than some of the discount chain motels I was looking at. The neighborhood is not as chic as the hotel itself, mostly office buildings and parking lots (reminds me of downtown Hartford) but it's not far from the Horton Plaza and beyond that is the Gaslamp. This was my first time in a W hotel, it's basically targeted to younger travelers, typically in the elevators were groups of twentysomethings in town for a wedding or bachelor/ette party. This could have made for poor sleeping, fortunately I didn't hear any wild parties or anything aside from the TV next door (though I should note I am a heavy sleeper). My room was on the 17th floor - very comfortable bed, one of the nicer hotel bathrooms I've seen, everything was clean and the furniture and decor had a modern chic to it (even if upon closer examination you could tell they were closer to the level of Ikea than something you'd see advertised in the New Yorker). Downstairs by the reception is a bar and seating area that are good for meeting friends. I didn't try the (small) pool but did use the gym, which was more or less your typical gym for business travelers. Next door is a brew pub to grab a pint, and if you're hungry for some cheap but tasty Mexican grub, I recommend Taco express which is one block north on State Street. The staff was very helpful and friendly, but the one drawback I would point out is the $12.95 daily charge for wireless access, and the wireless speed was not up to par for the purposes of VPN use or video streaming. Since I stayed five nights, I skipped the hotel wireless after the second day and managed to limit my wi-fi use to the conference and coffee shops. Overall, I had a comfortable stay, and would book again - as long as I could expense it. If I were paying out of my own pocket for more than a night or two I might be more inclined to bargain hunt more aggressively. On the other hand, if I ever had the occasion to organize a guys night out in San Diego the W would be the first place I'd look - and that's more or less what this hotel is aiming for.

Reviews.Title: “W is for Wow”
Reviews.Author: Dpqt83
Reviews.Content: loved it amazing, service, ambience and would love to live at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “California the way it should be, a perfect hotel for San Diego Sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: solohobo
Reviews.Content: I just returned for a 3 night weekend stay here with a 45 person family wedding party from Midwest and Eastcoast, and it was really nice, relaxing, hip, trendy and well managed. The rooms are really cool, very Cali in feel, and the bars, pool, and beach lounge great to hangout. Its 3 blocks to the train, and easy walk or taxi to everywhere, or walk, or rent a bike. You can stay in the convention hotels, or the typical sterile ones by the Gaslamp district, which they all looked nice, even the Courtyard and Embassy Suites, but those are cookie cutter hotels that you may as well be in Minneapolis or Atlanta. The W nails it again, with a nice value property thats unique in decor, feel, mood and ambiance, and everyone in the wedding party loved it, from age 65 to 18. Rent a car, and take in the sights of Del Mar, La Jolla, and even LA is 2.5 hours north for a day trip. I stay 4-5 star everywhere, travel 120 days a year, domestic and international, and this hotel at $150 is a delight.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Mr_T_10
Reviews.Content: Great stay for a business trip. Nice bar and restaurant with attentive staff. Close to nearby Gas Lamp district for dining and entertainment. Free car service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: soekotjo
Reviews.Content: The W is probably a little too "hip" for my taste, the decor is modern, no art on the wall, light blue color paint, but it's nice, and the bed is really comfortable. We arrived and got the room in two minutes flat. The staff are all cheerful and curteous. The elevators require cardkey to go up, so I had to fumble around in there a bit every time, but it's fine. Parking is what it is. We knew from other reviews here that valet parking in downtown SD is upward of $30 no matter which hotel you stay in, so we just factored it in. In general it was a great pleasant hotel to sleep in. We did not explore any other part of the hotel as we were just there to go to the Zoo, Seaworld and the USS Midway. But I'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice perks”
Reviews.Author: deerinbrosbbq
Reviews.Content: We booked through Amex directly and they charged my card as soon as I booked but when we checked in the hotel didn't see our payment. It took about 30 mins standing at the front desk which was annoying but the mgr did keep saying sorry and sent up 2 bottles of wine once we got into the room so that made up for it. The room itself was a little on the small side but nice enough. The window seat thing was cool and the bed was great. The beach bar thing they have on the 2nd fl was pretty cool though a tad on the expensive side ($40 with tip for 1 burger and fries, glass of wine and vodka tonic.) parking as everyone says is way expensive but what do ya do. They have other public Lots in the area but they are $20 for 24 hr so I figured it was worth the extra $12 to be able to get my car when I wanted it. Another nice feature about this hotel is that they give you a free ride in an Acura if you know where your going and at what time you just call down and let them know and the car will be waiting for you

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor; ok location; comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: mountain_girl6345
Reviews.Content: At first we were apprehensive about the downtown location-near the courthouse, bondsmen etc. However, we found it to be a 6 block walk to little Italy for dinner, an easy walk to the Coronado ferry to head to the beach, and not to far from the gas lamp district. We found the service to be OK. The beds were very comfortable and the room and bathroom clean. Nice down pillows and duvet. The lobby decor seemed to be striving for a trendy nightclub look.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay downtown with friendly efficient staff who remember your name”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastBrit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located and modern. The beach bar is a great place to relax outside and a little different from the usual hotel bar. Brewpub is next door with good beer and food. Staff remembered my name after check in and Melissa was really helpful. Nice touch is the free Accura car service to downtown restaurants and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: mooresy2
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the W Chicago a couple times and really enjoyed it so was looking forward to W San Diego. Right downtown, great location near Littly Italy and the Embarcadero. Nice spacious rooms, great service as always. Great rooftop sand bar which was a scene on a Friday night...nice looking crowd. Also the music in the lobby and elevator was not as loud as it is at W Chicago ..so it is a relaxed party atmosphere rather than in your face.

Reviews.Title: “One of my better stays at The W ever.”
Reviews.Author: slwilkessr
Reviews.Content: This stay rates at the top of my list at The W. I encountered a young lady by the name of Melissa Humble who was exactly that "HUMBLE" in every since of the word.. I found her too be very professional, knowledgeable and attentive to my every need. Her mission was to make sure my experience was on to remember, which is rare. Kudos to Melissa to a job well done. Mr. Stanley Wilkes Home Box Office Inc.

Reviews.Title: “W, San Diego, Sunshine, and great coffee in your room ... A - OK”
Reviews.Author: zantosh
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is, as with other W Hotels in the world, totally cool. But let's not get ahead of ourselves. I've had good, great and mediocre experiences with the W brand, so I was careful in making my decision on how I felt about this location. Arriving at night into San Diego, I found that the hotel was easy to locate, housed in an attractive older building close to the Little Italy area of town. Attached to the older building is a tower that houses all the rooms. Once I was checked in, I eagerly headed up to my room to see what they had in store for me, as I've grown accustomed to the uniqueness of each W. Sure enough, this W had a distinct blue and white color scheme, with a blackboard and chalk on the wall, and a wonderful lounging couch that was embedded into the wall right by the window. Also, I was happy to find that this W provided each room with a really cool coffee maker, with pods of coffee, decaf and tea. In addition to the cool factor, this was Diedrich coffee. For those who don't know, there are other coffee companies out there beyond Starbucks, and Diedrich is one of them. So I was a happy camper at this point. I wandered on down to the old building section to explore, and found Rice - a restaurant, which seemed to be very good looking, but also very empty - and it seemed to stay empty through out the week, so I never ate there. I'm not big into empty restaurants. Going on up to the second floor, I found a well equipped gym, a spa, and on the other side, a beach - complete with sand and a bar, but without any water or waves. But that was alright because the feel was better than anything that other hotels offer - open rooftop, sand in your toes, a fire pit, loungy chaises, and a bar. Since I was here on work, I couldn't hang out a lot, but I did have to stay an additional week. Much to my disappointment, a convention had descended into town and all the hotel rates were in Mars or Jupiter, and there'd be no way I could expense that. So, sadly, I prepared to stay in some other part of town, and I told this to Melissa, at the front desk. I didn't really bother to look into hotels, as I felt that anything besides the W in San Diego would be just another hotel. Suddenly, on Friday, after I'd left for my weekend, I got a call from someone at the hotel, and they had me back the following week at the same rate as I'd had on the first week, so I didn't have to stay at any other hotel. This was, thanks to Melissa, AWESOME. So next time you're there, be sure to let Melissa know that she's awesome, and maybe she'll share some of that awesomeness with you too. To balance out my review, I have to point out a few things that irked me about the hotel. To be clear, nothing was wrong with the hotel, but as is the case with people, when something's really nice, it surely could be nicer ... The bed, which is always awesome, wasn't as awesome as I'd have expected. They must've got these beds from a different supplier or something. They didn't have drinking glasses in the room. They did have plastic cups. Which wasn't cool. I'd have expected a nice glass ... if I'd decided to get a scotch from the mini bar, I'd have had to drink it in a plastic cup. How un-W! So that's really not a complaint at all. This is, hands down, a great W to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “You can never go wrong here at the W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Eyewear_1
Reviews.Content: Over the last three years I've stayed almost 500 nights in hotels, travled 400,000 miles on a plane and have been to so many cities across our great country that I've lost track of what time zone I'm in on a week to week basis. 60 plus of those nights have been at the W Hotel San Diego and everytime I leave, I can't wait to go back! I've been a Starwood fan and loyal customer (in cities where available) and the W in San Diego soars far above the rest.! From the valet guys to the check in staff, you can't ask for better service. There's always someone from the check in staff that knows me by name when I arrive, the Acura vehicle serivce is always available, the beds are always way beyond comfortable, the rooms are always clean, the sheets are amazing and the entire staff is ALWAYS available to make your stay comfortable. The Beach is a great place to be at on the weekend. Happy hour specials are solid, you're walking distance to Little Italy (amazing) and you're close to the Gas Lamp night life. Let's face it, it's a W Hotel, how can you go wrong? The entire chain is built on being "cool". If you're in town for business or to simply enjoy America's Finest City, take it from someone that spends the majority of their life in hotels, relys on them for comfort, a good nights sleep and a "home away from home" , the W San Diego is the place to stay! Enjoy your trip to San Diego and try out the W, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wow'd by Melissa”
Reviews.Author: hwa3706b
Reviews.Content: Melissa's (welcome desk agent) professional disposition and welcoming graciousness makes the San Diego W a home away from home. Helmer W. Arizmendy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a bad location...”
Reviews.Author: OutInTheStreet
Reviews.Content: Went down to San Diego for the Jets vs Chargers playoff game and made a reservation at the W. We called ahead to let the hotel know that we would be arriving very late. They said it would not be a problem. Well, when we arrived there was no one to be found at the front desk. The gentleman at the bar a few feet away said he could not help us. We stayed at the front desk trying to find someone to help us for at least 7-8 minutes until finally someone came out of the back room, looking like we just woke him up from a deep sleep. After that, check in was fine, and we went to our room. The room was pretty standard, except for the chalk board on the wall. I know then W is trendy, but a chalkboard on the wall? We spent most of the 2 days outside the room. Valet parking is extremely expensive and street parking there is horrible. There is metered parking but you have to get up at 8am to feed the meter the next morning, and then every 2 hours after that. Also, it seems this area is a main hangout for the homeless population in San Diego. One of the nights we literally had to walk through bodies to get to the hotel. Another pet peeve of mine was that the door man was too busy talking to one of his coworkers to open the door when we went out. He had his hand on it, but was not paying attention to those going in and out, so we pushed the other door open. We are not high maintenance(we were going to see a football game after all), but it's the little things like that that make you want to go back and stay somewhere. I definitely would not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Was'nt wowed...”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: got to the W a bit before 2 and figured we could drop off our stuff and go get lunch. it seemed we were going to be allowed to check in, but room type wasnt available. we were asked to leave a phone number and we would be reached when a room was ready. guess what? we never got that call. The room is fairly nice, little smaller than what I am used to over at the Solamar. We were able to take advantage of san diego's free street parking due to holiday*(New Year) and also free parking sundays, so all we had to do was wake up early on saturday and feed the meter. Beat having to pay $35 a day for valet! We were able to park right across the street from the hotel, it wasnt difficult. You would think the Chernobyl radioactive plan was next door, as it seems like the area surrounding the hotel has been evacuated. The Acura drivers and the ambassador at the front David were great! Getting a free ride down into the vibrant and busy gaslamp was nice as we skipped on having to pay for a cab or walk. Getting back to the hotel was easy on foot, or if near the convention center you can take the trolley. I saw a great deal for this hotel and that's why i booked it. It cost about a Benjamin per night so the price was right, but I would have felt taken advantage of paying anymore. Wireless internet is another $13 a night, which seems to be included with the room rate at most other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego is simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: poptarte
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing staff. They are extremely accommodating to whatever, whenever you need it. The moment I arrived Ms. Humble was extremely warm and inviting, which made checking in a pleasure. The rooms are hip, clean and modern with sufficient space. As a business traveler, I love the intimate feel of this hotels environment. The restaurants breakfast was tasty and moderately priced. I would recommend this hotel to all in need of a stress free business or personal stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay just close enough to the action”
Reviews.Author: spetron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a place that I imagine people either love or hate. It's very modern and as soon as you walk in, you feel like you're entering a night club. The main lobby is decked out with loads of comfy couches and chairs and has a great bar. Up a few flights of stairs is the roof bar which can get packed at night. So it's definitely a place where you can have fun. If you're not looking for that atmosphere, I wouldn't recommend it. The rooms are a great size and quite comfortable. My room had a window seat, however, it was overlooking a parking lot. The area the hotel is in is a bit odd. A block away you'll find bail bondsmen and pawn shops so it's probably best not to stray too far alone. However, you can walk to the Gaslamp Quarter from here in about 10-15 minutes depending on your pace. But if you're lucky enough, you can take the courtesy car from the hotel and have a much more pleasant trip. The hotel is at most ten minutes from the airport. This was my first time at this hotel and I'd certainly stay there again. However, not if I were traveling with my family. Overall, a great experience with very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place.... very unique”
Reviews.Author: granths
Reviews.Content: Very unique hotel. Definately not a hotel for the older crowd. My parents (who are quite hip) would have hated it. I liked it. I did think that the hotel lobby was really unique and cool but I found it very unnerving to walk in there around 6 pm after being out all day and I felt underdressed. I almost wish there was a bit of a different entrace to escape to when you dont want to be overwhelmed. Here is the good and the bad: Good: modern hotel, unique setting, great staff, access to beach night club, younger crowd, nice rooms (although I did feel like I was in an Ikea bedroom), the lounge lobby, you can walk all over the hotel with your drink, great concierge and valet staff, Bad: our room only had a shower, the cleaning staff for our room wasn't the greatest, I didnt like walking in off the street into the lounge directly , the parking (VERY expensive - and the hotel didnt advertise it), very small pool (we didnt use it and it didnt look like it got a lot of sun), the hotel restaurant food - wasnt memorable. VERY EXPENSIVE INTERNET!

Reviews.Title: “It was Absolutely Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: XiomaraNoir
Reviews.Content: I will say right now I will stay at the W again and again. I love everything about the W. My fiance' and myself had an amazing time. We only stayed for a day but it was amazing and so very relaxing. The service there was timely and also we also felt truly catered to. We went to do a short day-cation... to test out the hotel and we found a very pleasant surprise: beautiful decor, delicious entrees/drinks and breakfast. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. The ambiance enhanced our time together. I cannot wait to go back and enjoy the spa and other amentities. We went to get a break and celebrate each other... and we were able to get that and more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, now lets give a face lift to the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I returned to the W San Diego after staying at this hotel in 2008. The lobby looks great! Starwood has done a nice job with giving the lobby an updated look. The lobby has free internet service on the first and second floor. The internet speed in the room was VERY slow. The room was average. The carpet looks a bit worn and has seen better days. The size of the room was nice as was the comfort of the bed. I had some trouble getting warm water out of the shower. It took several minutes to get warm water to come out and the water pressure was low. I did not say anything as I was only at the hotel for three nights. The gym was average. The room, while not horrible, was not fresh or a reflection of what I think a W should offer. I will not stay at this hotel again until I hear they have given the rooms a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “My top choice after trying several high end hotels in town”
Reviews.Author: Aficiando
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at W San Diego 4 nights a week for the last several months, home away from home. I've been working in San Diego for the last year and half and W is my top pick. Pretty much, I've stayed in all the high end hotels, Hilton Gaslamp, Marriott Marina, etc... I find W to be warm and comfortable . The hotel offers all the amenities but the hotel staff is what seperates them from the pack. Melissa Humble at the front desk is always attentive to my needs. Sure, I am a loyal SPG member but there are half a dozen Starwood Properties in town and no hotel comes close to W. The only negative that I could think of is the location; however the hotel offers free transportation around town.

Reviews.Title: “Park with the bums or PAY UP”
Reviews.Author: TheToddLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this place is very strange. Nice hotel, but it tries to open it's lobby as a nightclub on the weekends--there was like 12 people in there. AND THEY HAD A BOUNCER THAT ALMOST WOULDN'T LET US IN, until we produced the room key. If that guy would have been at the elevators to prevent unwanted people from getting to the room tower I wouldn't have ahd a problem with it, but he was there to make sure that the non-guests paid their cover. I digress. To the parking thing. I know parking is a premium in downtown SD. Been there, done that....but you know what I think?--$35 per night for "valet" parking is kinda steep. I wouldn't have minded so much if they had advertised the charge on the website when I made the reservation, but NO, they couldn't do that. After telling the front desk staff that the amount doesn't appear on their web page they could have cared less. The girl told me that I can park on the street (just so I move my car by a certain time each day except for Sunday etc...) Well I looked for a parking spot the second night I was there and the closest thing I could find had homeless people (and a lot of them) sleeping 5 feet away. I didn't even want to get out of the car. Now, if I would have booked a hotel for say $45 a night, I might expect something like that, but no, this was not that type of hotel. Now, where I come from (Las Vegas born and raised), we don't let a hotel build unless there is enough parking ON SITE to accommodate EVERYONE. It may be a parking garage, but you WILL find parking. How can a hotel build without enough parking? If that is the problem of course. I think they just want to earn just a bit more per night than they advertise. The manager was summoned when I told him the fee was not advertised on the Hotel's website and he told me basically take-it-or-leave-it. When we checked into our room, we found that about an hour later, he sent some sort of gift basket up with a note stating that he had spoken to his congressional representative and miraculously had his boss call the "parking company's" boss and they worked it out where I only had to pay one night parking. Now I would expect this fee if in NY or SF or someplace with a huge amount of high density, but SD? If you're gonna do this, put it on your website. And, 7 months later, guess what, it's still not on their "announcements" page. The fees for pets and smoking and late check out are there, but nothing about parking. Sooo, as you can tell, this tainted our stay from the beginning and unfortunately made for a bad stay in a beautiful hotel. I felt extorted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Blackswan100
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by Melissa H. at the front desk and she made sure that my stay was perfect, including providing good restaurant recommendations. The rooms were clean and the W offers a free cocktail hour in the lounge. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The W San Diego is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: remnyc
Reviews.Content: Love the W in SanDiego ... I had a very quick stay but the staff was fantastic from check in, where I recieved great service from the lovely Melissa Humble ... rooms were very cool and comfortable ... the lobby and common areas are welcoming -- was an oasis of calm in an otherwise frenetic trip

Reviews.Title: “Wowed at W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Awakening2Zen
Reviews.Content: As a devotee of boutique hotels, I have actively sought out W whenever and where I travel. While W San Diego didn't have the most spectacular lobby and the chicst among all of the W's, I was so impressed by its friendly staff, particularly the welcome desk agent Melissa Humble, that I'm posting here my first ever travel review. She upgraded my room to the penthouse level with free concierge services, including in-room wifi, wheeled-in morning coffee and shirt pressing, and continued to provide me with the attentive service in the professional manner until I checked out. If you are staying there in the future, ask for Melissa and hopefully you will receive the same perks. I did encounter one problem. When I lifted the toilet seat lid upon checking in to my room, there was a giant turd in it, which instantly stank up the sexy bathroom. I had to flush the toilet a few times to get rid of the floaties. Normally, I'd have called and asked for a different room, but I was in such a good mood that day I just sprayed some cologne and headed out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: MMARCUM
Reviews.Content: Lets just say as a Regional Service Manager myself, Melissa H., front desk attendent is over the top! The level of service she provides with her warm welcome makes for an amazing "WOW" experience... Thanks - Michael...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Treatment & Service”
Reviews.Author: Reef2121
Reviews.Content: I was visiting San Diego for the for time for business and pleasure. From the moment I checked in until check out 4 days later I received the best treatment ever. Even though I arrived late due to travel delays my room was readily available to me. Upon check in I requested an upgrade to a suite, unfortunately that night there was nothing available but they asked me to check in the morning. Surely enough the next morning I was able to upgrade to their Fantastic Suite. I want to personally express my gratitude to Nadya, Melissa, AJ and Hector for making my stay at the W memorable. I have stayed at other W location (San Fran, DC and Chicago) and you guys by far exceed in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Bliss”
Reviews.Author: OCTiger
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 19th at the W San Diego...talked to the Wlecome Office (Ross) and he fixed me up with a sweet corner room and champagne and chocolate cake were in our room upon check in...ate at Rice...great wine and great food...great Night!!! Thanks Ross!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kick back at the W”
Reviews.Author: JesperJ
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Laid back feel to the place but also a very stylish place with great service.

Reviews.Title: “fun destination, boring hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDMoneyLA
Reviews.Content: San Diego was great, the hotel had a lot of problems. First checking in... the hotel receptionist had such a thick english accent I couldn't understand a word she said. Who has that thick an accent. The one thing I did hear her say, was that it was going to cost me $70 (not including tip) to park my car at the hotel for 2 days. She gave me a key to the mini bar that was literally ripped broken in the middle so of course it didn't work. The pool and sand beach they advertised were ridiculous. First they weren't even on the same floor. The pool was about a 10' square. Not really big enough for one person. Then upstairs was the "sand beach" Basically, cement with sand poured on it and a closed bar. Maybe at some point it gets busy, but with no pool, I doubt it. Then lastly the disappointing room. It was literally like a dorm room complete with mini blinds on the windows and a sliding (very heavy) door on the bathroom, bean bags and a chalkboard. It was decorated like a cramped, college, Target inspired room. This is an expensive hotel and I expected it to be tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: denealio
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay at W San Diego, but the most recent stay reaffirmed my opinion that the team running this hotel really has their act together. In this economy, I've seen other hotels cut back on service and little details that make a difference, but not this one, and for that I give them huge props. Shout out to Melissa H at the front desk and Michael O in the Spa, but really everyone we talked to was great. Not sure where some people get the idea that W hotels have snobby attitude? If you are elite in the SPG program, this hotel again shines in terms of recognizing and treating Gold and Platinum members. There are few suites in this hotel, but an upgrade to a Kool Corner is appreciated. These are great rooms, with a good set-up of space, views and a cool bathroom, complete with seperate tub. The white wood blinds are a nice touch, and give the hotel a modern yet comfortable feel. So does the stuffed beach ball pillow on the bed. Late check-out as SPG elite was happily given, unlike some SPG properties that grumble or ask you to "check back day of departure". I felt the desk staff were genuine in terms of offering help & suggestions, rather than going through the motions of standard check-in. The Acura guy was always available, and seemed almost dissapointed that we never used the service as we had rides from friends or were going to places within walking distance. It's a great service that helps set the W apart from generic hotels. If I had to quibble about anything it's the pool is a bit small, and set-in among parts of the hotel walls so it's not all sunny, nor lots of room to sit. The "beach" is kind of adjacent upstairs from the pool and does have more room to catch some sun, but too bad they can't combine that with the pool. For those taking Amtrak or other trains, this hotel is 3 easy blocks walking distance to the train station. TIP: This is also the area of the closest Starbucks to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is chill.”
Reviews.Author: JRJ311
Reviews.Content: Typical of the W Hotel ambience -- the hotel is meant to be cool. This one is, too. Hotel was great and check-in was great with Melissa who provided info about the hotel without being too informative. Hotel was very clean. Ordered room service once and the food was good and priced well. Location is not the best for a traveler -- a walk back late at night from the gaslamp area or convention center can be desolate.

Reviews.Title: “The W gets a WOW”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter2thow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W in downtown San Diego at the beginning of the month. The place was immaculate and our room was off the hook! If you go you need to talk to a guy that works there named Greg Brebner. He told us all the cool places to go at night, best places for happy hour, and seemed like he was there whenever we needed anything. The restaurant has some incredible cuisine as well. The pool is fun, seemed very private, and the outdoor bar The Beach was a great place to sit by the fire and enjoy a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “fun modern hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: ivydturtle
Reviews.Content: pros: great design, very good customer service, loved the room, comfortable bed, _great_ Bliss products, nice gym cons: wimpy travel size dryer, no tea in the room (only coffee), could not turn off music in gym

Reviews.Title: “Doode, every hotel stay should be like this.”
Reviews.Author: SfKstar
Reviews.Content: I am blown away at the competency, courtesy, and value of the W. I literally feel like the rock star I aspire to be. Friendly staff and good coffee round out the business. I am staying here again because of my last stay. Kstar

Reviews.Title: “It's true; you really do want to go where everybody knows your name!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer05
Reviews.Content: I travel for work every week. and, because of that, I get the opportunity to stay at some pretty nice hotels. Even better...hotels of my choice! I am sure that I am not out of the ordinary, but when I choose a hotel I consider several things: a super comfortable bed, a room that is clean and up-to-date (renovated or current furnishings), nice amenities (gym, pool, lobby), and excellent customer service. So, for anyone who has been to the W San Diego, it should come as no suprise that I always choose the W San Diego as my home away from home. The W San Diego is consistently excellent every time that I stay there. I always have a great room with a comfortable bed, the amenities are modern and chic ( I love the lobby vibe, fresh candles, board games...),and the customer service is first rate all the time. For example, when walked in to the lobby last week, Melissa Humble, the front desk associate, warmly greeted me by name. She noticed earlier in the day that I was checking in that afternoon so she had set aside a beautiful upgraded room. This is not an uncommon occurence at the W. Each and every time I am personally greeted and they always go above and beyond. It is my first choice regardless if I am in town for business or pleasure. I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in the San Diego area!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: vinodavid
Reviews.Content: Good right from the start. A lovely young lady named Melissa Humble assisted me at the front desk, secured me an upgrade, and got me on my way on short order. The rooms are classic "W", very modern and trendy. The outdoor bar is crazy cool, great views, sand, yes sand, and lots of pretty people. Cool pool also with great views. I love this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: djduane1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W in San Diego as we were attending the NAR convention. We were greeted by Mellissa H who was so pleasant and saw my consternation over the possiblity of NOT having a coffee maker in our room. As we are Starwood Preferred Group Gold members, she upgraded us to a Penthouse room with a great view and gave us in-room complimentary coffee and tea service, free wi-fi, and some other perks! Thanks to Melissa, my whole attitude quickly improved and we had a great time while we were there. Melissa is a real tribute to the service oriented W chain and we really appreciate all she did for us!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: The4Monkeys
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughters aged 6, 7 just returned home from a 2 day stay here while we enjoyed time with friends who live downtown and enjoyed the Sea World park. The valet parking folks were extremely polite and friendly. I had no trouble with them and they were wickedly efficient. Just awesome. Never had to wait for my car when we needed it. Tip them well, they deserve it! The front desk staff was wonderful and our bellman offered excellent advice. The lobby had music playing and this is really a hip hotel with their style from the lobby to the elevator to the interesting touches in the room. My kids liked the pillow shaped like a beach ball! We wanted some coffee and milk one morning, and of course you are going to have to pay a premium for that, but it was in our room in about 15 minutes when they said it was going to be 30. It took someone less than 5 minutes to get to our room when we moved all our stuff back down to the car. It really shouldn't be amazing to get this type of service, what with the economy and all (people want to keep their jobs, etc), but unfortunately you still run into people who just don't get it. Not so at the W. If you have pets, this is the place for them. They have pet friendly meals on the room service list and a water dish out front just for them. We didn't have a pet, but will bring ours if we have one in the future. Nice touch, but don't worry, you won't be stumbing over a bunch of animals there. They had a game or two set up in the lobby for the kids to play, and so it was a bit more kid friendly than we originally thought. The music in the lobby was a bit loud when we arrived with our kids in their jammies at 9 PM, but all in all had a fun stay at the W. Highly recommend and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: itsjl
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and very accommodating. The room was quite comfy and the hotel restaurant and bar were top notch. Melissa Humble, the W representative at the front desk, was a pleasure and helped get me set up with a great room. Would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: shelleynjack
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the W Hotel. We were in town for a wedding and the hotel was in a great location. Fresh water with cucumber was avalable when you walk in and was a wonderful treat.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Randy37
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the W last week. The hotel staff was spectacular, extremely efficient, friendly. Melissa Humble, the registration clerk was incredible. She was most friendly, cheerful, and provided me with just the right room for when my wife joined me later in the week. It makes life that much more enjoyable when traveling away from home, which is why I would definately stay here again on my next visit to San Diego. The bellman, and the free car service to restaurants was wonderful, and the staff always went the extra mile, I was most impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, absoultely world class hotel”
Reviews.Author: aquagreen1
Reviews.Content: I reserved the room from online the same day, when I got there the reservation didn't show up in the system. The check in gal Melissa Humble immediately took initiative, she asked me to forward my email confirmation, and within minutes she had me checked in. She was very professional and courteous, so was the entire hotel staff. When I was carrying my luggage walking to the elevator, a hotel staff was walking towards me from the opposite direction, she gently moved to the side, and let me pass first. The room was very clean, I stayed at the W in Mid-Town Atlanta few months ago, and they both had that unique "W chic" atmosphere you couldn't get at any other hotel. Overall my experience was one to remember that will definitely bring me back to the W again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, needs a spring cleaning and touch up”
Reviews.Author: dgart
Reviews.Content: All staff were great! I needed a car for a day. They arranged for me to be picked up and taken to a car rental place nearby - no charge. I brought the car back the next day, handed them the key, and was done - so very easy and convenient!! All other interactions with the staff were very positive,pleasant, and easy. My only complaint is that they really need to do a deep cleaning - especially on the carpets. Our room's carpet was stained and discolored from not being cleaned. You could see where the foot traffic occurred. While everything else seemed clean enough, this made a negative impression on me. Also, the computer room is very isolated, which I didn't really like. Bring your lap top - this was $7 for 15 minutes! Carpet there needed to be cleaned as well. We don't usually eat dinner in the hotels we stay in, but one night we were really tired and did eat in the restaurant. It was very good, but a bit pricey - esp the glass of wine. Still, I would recommend it. Service was great. Overall, the hotel was fine. Good location, comfortable bed, nice bathroom, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely WOWed!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeff_D_37
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that **Melissa Humble is Best in the West**!!! I am a regular traveler to San Diego for business and now exclusively stay at the W San Diego because of their outstanding service and amenities! During my last stay, I was completely surprised with an unbelievable upgrade to the Extreme WOW suite on the top floor. The room was incredible and enormous! Melissa really went above and beyond by providing me with a truly unforgettable experience! l really enjoy every night spent at the W San Diego and will keep coming back. Thanks again Melissa!

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: the_d_duo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in the W chain, and were disappointed. The hotel is well located, but the decor is a little tired and I must say the service was not up to par. Although it was fine - it just always seemed that they were understaffed or had too much to do. The lobby bar is very nice - but I would pop by for the bar and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The W was excellent and the service was even better.”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel99
Reviews.Content: Melissa Humble at the front desk is excellent and always went out of her way to assist and the concierge was extrememly knowledgeable and helpful. The W San Diego is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: HRLMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W San Diego during a recent business trip. I have stayed at other W hotels in the past and always look forward to stay again but when it comes to San Diego, W lives up to the name with superb service and a 100% customer service driven atmosphere.
