As for the Cool Corner Rooms (beyond the bathroom), there is a well-stocked minibar, LCD TV with a decent channel selection and quite the expansive PPV selection, good workspace/desk, DVD player, iPod docking station (which also comes in handy for charging your iPhone!), a lounger and ottoman, and very comfy bed with pillows I can't help but want to steal everytime I stay at a W. I do wish the chair at the desk was more comfy than stylish as the lack of wireless in the room (though there is wired high speed internet for about $13/day) confines you to the desk when working and the chair gets old fast. There is plenty of space to spread out and let all your stuff spread out, as well (a few more drawers would help, though, as I like to unpack everything when I check in to a room rather than live out of my suitcase. There are a number of drawers around, but spread out and in the nightstands or bottom of the closet, rather than a single, well-placed dresser). Valet service was decently prompt when I'd call down ahead of time to have my car brought up (though one time, the call didn't do much good and I had to remind the valet once downstairs). Room service was prompt and tasty. Maid service was good, as well. Very helpful staff, from check-in to check-out and at all times in between. I guess I'm old at heart because, though well within the W's target age demographic, I like my hotel to be relaxed and chill rather than rowdy and crazy. W's are known for lively bar scenes in the lobby and I usually just put up with that because I'm fond of the other aspects of the hotels. So this trip was particularly nice for me on account of the lack of the lobby bar due to the remodel. Though there is still the bar on the 2nd floor and you can expect, if getting in to the elevator at night, to have to put up with a few seconds of drunk and annoying people sharing the elevator with you as they go to and from the bar. Can't win em all :) All in all, though, a nice property and very convenient to airport and good parts of town (though this can be said for most places in SD proper). I appreciate the fact that, though the staff certainly leans towards being young and hip, I've always had good, friendly and professional service here (as opposed to some similar hotels where the staff is more pretty than professional and more cool than competent).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed but needs some work elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at W Hotel after seeing one in Seattle. Unfortunately, the one is Seattle is much better than the one in San Diego. The pool in San Diego is pretty disappointing....much too small. It is more the size of a Jacuzzi. The gym facility was seriously lacking any decent cardiovascular machines. I guess the hotel managment must believe that since you are in sunny weather, it is better to exercise or run outside. The best part of the hotel was the comfortable bed that is very much like Westin hotels. The lobby tries to be hip and cool but the rattan furnitures were rather cheap in my opinion. The "sandy" bar on the top floor was occupied by some barely legal drinking age kids who also wanted to be hip I suppose. Hotel corridors were rather dusty and needs some attention.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Impressive for W Standard”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a weekend getaway. Was noted the hotel lobby will be due for renovation beforehand. Thats fine. However, Once I arrived to the hotel, I realized this hotel is lack of the W feel, except the attitude. This property is situated in the edge of downtown San Diego, close to the Little Italy, but is also adjacent to the city jail so at various times of time, you'll hear sirens no matter if you are on a high floor or not. The valet staffs are rude and still trying to ask for tips because they think they deserve it for the type of service delivered? The front desk staff seems very rude and rigid. They do not follow the SPG rules so if you are a Plat member, make sure to "ASK" them for ur platinum amendities. It usually takes more than one calls to the "Whenever, Whatever" service to get things right (i.e. to fix light bulbs, to get your shoes shined). It also took them couple hours for a security to came up to quiet the neighbor down at 3am (they were playing trance music all night long, if you know what I meant), and yes, the walls are thin, very thin so you can literrally hear everything. The swimming pool and the gym is very small. In fact I was talking to a couple over the pool and they were telling me the similiar issues that they encountered - someone just throws cig buds onto the hallway carpet! and you'll see leftover drinks inside the elevators at night too! They reported and also, it took them couple attempts to have someone come up to fix the problem. However, you should know that this hotel is W, so you will except/should tolerate the noises up to 2am. The DJ in the lobby play nice music to make the hotel very interesting and the sands bar on the 2nd floor are also unique for this property. However, it just doesn't matches the staff's attitude very well, maybe its time for the staffs to get serious retrain. The W bed is what keeps me coming back to stay at the W and also the bliss products are also nice. However, if you want to relax, you should try different properties in SD, if you want to close to the scene, I would recommend Westin Gaslamp Quarter for better SPG treatment and better location!

Reviews.Title: “Not so cool”
Reviews.Author: Peewee68
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms. I assume that is it. I am not sure if someone within Starwood realizes that this property has nothing that makes a W hotel a W hotel. Nothing: nothing cool, nothing special. This doesn't make it a bad property, only no W ambience. Staff also doesn't seem to realize this: they are acting to be cool. This is rather hilarious, people trying to make that W face, trying to strike that W pose. But they fail.... Not bad staff, certainly not, but just not W. Although valet parking is bad and arrogant, especially the dude with the long hair with head band and very unhip little beard. At all times my car was much too late (with not many guest in the hotel) or didn't show up at all. This didn't hold them back begging for tips via body language. With no excuse (mind you, regular W staff have an attitude but always are polite). Anyway, choose this hotel if you want a nice comfortable hotel in SD, but ignore if you are in for something special.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fijalclarkski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W for a weekend vacation. The room is well appointed with softer-than-usual carpeting, a very plush bed, and the inviting window seat. The flat screen TV was nice, but the picture was fuzzy, as if it was receiving the signal from rabbit ears. The shower was attractive, but not very practical. A single, unmovable glass pane divides off the shower, but a hole in the glass (so that you can turn on the water without entering the shower first) allows water to go everywhere in the bathroom when you're in the shower. The pool area is nice, but tiny. The pool itself is roughly 15 feet by 25 feet. There is room for only 5 or so lounge chairs, and the open-air fitness area is nearby. All in all, though, it was a nice place to relax for an hour. The location is very convenient to the trolley and bus to the airport. While we like the location of the Omni hotel better, if we hadn't stayed at the W, we wouldn't have found St. Tropez, a french bistro (highly recommended for breakfast and lunch). Overall, we were very happy with the W, and even happier with our rate from Priceline (I don't think you can go wrong with any 4-star hotel in downtown San Diego)!

Reviews.Title: “Had to sleep on window seat”
Reviews.Author: atltravel
Reviews.Content: Booked room for 2 adults and 2 children through Hotwire. Was told that the hotel was sold out and any third party reservations are not guaranteed. Gave us a one bed room and was told a rollaway will be provided. After we arrived at the room, they told us that the room was too small for extra bed and there was nothing they could do. Our teenager had to sleep on the window seat which was barely 2 ft wide and over 4 ft tall (the other child slept with us). She fell out of the seat in the middle of the night and hurt herself. Luckily we had put extra pillows and clothing under it so it did not result in a serious accident. At this point I don't really know whether this is Hotwire or W 's fault. If we had had the 2 bed room, we would have liked this hotel. There wasn't any noise on the Saturday as I had feared (maybe because the lobby was in renovation). The bed was nice and lots of little cool things. The location is great for Little Italy dinning but away from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes”
Reviews.Author: travellotabunch
Reviews.Content: Room booked not available and so were to be upgraded...NOT! Waited 2 hours to get this "upgraded" room. Room reminded us of school - blackboard and all. Very CHEAP and Cheesy decor. Obviously an old hotel trying to be hip, didn't work. Lobby was relocated while being remodeled. Seemed more like chaos than relaxing weekend. One nice thing...comfy bed...but still would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great - IF you know what to expect from the W”
Reviews.Author: mooshai
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a W before and know what to expect, this is a perfect one. But if you want simple things, like a well lit room, a door on your shower, an absence of techno music in all the public spaces, or guests over the age of 30, keep looking. Beds are incredibly comfortable, desk/work space is huge, furnishings/toiletries are great, and the bar scene is top notch. It is NOT, however, suitable for families or hard core business travelers over the age of say 50. Painfully trendy/chic staff and an omni-present feeling of "oh, you just don't get it do you?" among people working there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel - can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumMember
Reviews.Content: The W is quite possibly the coolest hotel I have ever stayed in. I've stayed at many W Hotels - Chicago City Center, Chicago Lakeshore, NYC The Court to name a few. This is by far the best W I've stayed in. It has a beach theme, so everything is in blues and purples - very soothing. We were in a slightly upgraded room - one of the corner rooms and it was amazing. Not a suite, but plenty of room. Loved the window seats with cushions and pillows. The window even opened a bit. The bed was great - plenty of closet and drawer space. There were these great huge mirrors all over, and we had a beautiful view of the city from our curved glass wall (if you look at a picture of the exterior and see curved glass running up the front, these were some windows to our room). The bathroom was huge, had a huge soaking tub and had perfectly white tile and grout. This is a feat for a hotel...trust me. The shower had some crazy water pressure - I thought my hair would be washed right off my head...but the shower was great - enclosed in glass but I could look out the huge windows in our bathroom while showering. The location was pretty good - within walking distance of the downtown area and little Italy, but not in the thick of it. One of my favorite things was the outdoor beach bar - the floor was of heated sand! It had a fire pit and heat lamps to keep you warm on those cool CA nights. The workout room is right next to the pool, and though it is a covered area, the room is actually outside. Nice. The only downside was the valet service. It was total confusion out there and I don't think they did a very good job. Also, I hate how all Ws make you pay for internet...seems like that should be free these days.

Reviews.Title: “Unique - but good”
Reviews.Author: bluelighthouseblue
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the W for a three day meeting -- what a unique experience. I've never stayed at the hotel, but I had heard it was like a European hotel -- never going to Europe, I didn't quite know what that meant but was somewhat eager to find out. Upon arriving on a Friday evening at 11pm at night, I was very disappointed and ready to turn around to find another hotel. The 'living room' = lobby was blaring with music and filled with people. I couldn't hear the front counter person when I was checking in, but with my name on my credit card and them writing down the room number on the key jacket, it all worked out. After I fought my way through the people to get to the elevators and finally figured out that I needed to use my key card to access any floor above 3, my frustration continued because I could hear the music up the entire elevator ride through floor 13. I was very relieved when I got out of the elevator and the music had finally faded. The size of my room wasn't anything spectacular, but the beds were wonderful!!! I hadn't had that nice of a sleep in months! My most favoriate part of the hotel, though, were the unique decorations and sundries. As I unpacked my bags and checked out the room, my mood quickly shifted from frustration and wanting to run to happiness and wanting to see what other cute things they could think of. The lighting was a bit to get used to, but every where you looked, the W thought of some cute way to "tag" items. An example was the little pencil on the night stand -- it said something like, 'Write down your idea.' Kind of corny, but different which made me smile constantly. The staff were also incredible! One of the ladies in our meeting rode up the elevator with one of the staff; they had a small conversation about the lady's recent cold still lingering; and the staff member sent her up some soup on the house. What an awesome touch! That's the Ritz example of empowerment for the customer!!! All the small unique touches turned me into a huge fan of this hotel!! As for the lobby, we stayed away on Saturday evening but ventured down during the days and other evenings. Surprisingly, we found some scrumptuous sweet/tart green apples and normal evenings. That just sweetened the ending - I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “After Hours Cinemax Movie Scene”
Reviews.Author: HobokenFrank
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you want to be a part of a the a trendy scene, with plenty of people-watching, and access to lobby-area bar, and rooftop sandbar (solid scene on weekends). However, don't stay here if you have a family with kids (nor sure what one reviewer was talking about, this is so not a fam/kid friendly place), or want great service. The staff is nice, but totally So Cal, so there is no sense of urgency in efforts, or over-the-top personal service(except for valet parking guys). The pool deck is embarrassing; you are practically on top of each other, especially if there are more than 3 people sun-bathing. Your bath-tub at home is larger than the pool, while the building blocks the sun most of the day. And unless you are on fire, you might never see a poolside attendant. Not sure who the engineers/architects/geniuses were for this hotel, but how can you build a higher-end hotel in San Diego with such a under-whelming pool deck, along with really limited sun exposure? Rooms are typical "W", tight and trendy, but comfortable and clean. Limit how much luggage you bring, otherwise you might want to sleep with your suitcase to ensure walking space. The restaurant is ok, but nothing special. For $300+ (including tax) a night, you would expect more, and in a much better location. You are way better off hiiting the new IVY Hotel or Hotel Salomar, or the Omni by the ballpark, as they are centrally located in the virbarnt, historic, Gaslamp district for bars/eats/scene.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego - Not As Hot As It Wants To Be”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: W San Diego was my 5th W experience (after W Los Angeles, W New York Union Square, W Silicon Valley, W Seattle), so I have a pretty firm grasp on what the W experience is supposed to be about. W's have always been high-end boutique, though not quite as 5-star as they want to be. And W San Diego continues that trend. Its "beachy" theme, complimented by blues and whites and lots of use of seashells as design pieces, perfectly capture the feel of Southern California. It's a crisp, clean property that really has few, if any, misses from an aesthetic standpoint. However, the service continues the subpar trend of the other W hotels. While the employees at this particular property are friendly, they don't have the polish of the high-end level hotels. And on our first full day at the hotel, housekeeping never came by to make-up the room. However, on check-out day, they were banging the door down to come in. And the front desk, while engaging, never gave the true welcoming experience they probably should for such a well-known, pricey hotel. There are not any huge gripes. It was a pleasant stay, in a clean, plesant room. The bed was fluffy and comfy. The staff was pleasant. And everything was pretty, well, pleasant. I guess the problem with W is that they are losing some of their luster. With other, newer boutique hotels opening up, W is not as hot as it once was - kind of like a nice-looking 50 year old lady who still thinks she's a hot, young babe. I would do W San Diego again. But I would probably chose something a little newer first.

Reviews.Title: “W is for WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: CabLam
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to tell you about my wonderful experience at the W Hotel. My girlfriend from the Bay Area decided to come down to San Diego (where I live) and surprise me for my 30th birthday. She thought it would be a great idea to book a room at the W as this is the place where we met nearly a year ago and have been together since. She explained this to the host at the front desk and they immediately upgraded her to the "Cool Corner" room at no extra charge! The room was extremely clean and extremely spacious. The rainfall shower and deep bathtub were also amazing. The best part of this experience was the Whatever/Whenever service. I was craving some chicken wings one night and decided to go to the local grocery store to buy a bag of microwaveable wings. We called the Whatever/Whenever service at about 2:00am and asked them if they could heat up the wings. The gentleman came and picked up the bag and returned to the room in no time. BUT... instead of bringing up my wings microwaved, he took the time to deep fry them!!! He told me he thought I probably wouldn't have enjoyed them nuked, and deep frying them was the way to go. Good call. He even added a side of ranch and carrots! The Whatever/Whenever service went well above and beyond the call of duty!! My girlfriend and I are going to try to stay at all the W Hotels around the nation, and hopefully around the world. It's one of the best hotels we've stayed at so far. It's hard to stay at other hotels that treat you merely as guests. The W Hotel is an establishment that provides hospitality like you were family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay~Great Location”
Reviews.Author: like2cruise
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the W San Diego for 2 nights prior to going on the Dawn Princess in January 2008. We were thrilled with our Priceline win, saving $160.00 per night. We arrived at about 10pm on a Friday night. From reading reviews we knew it would be a busy place with lots of people utilizing the bar. It was noisy on the first level, but the staff was very accommodating upon our arrival and honored our request for a room that was on an upper floor facing the cruise ship pier, even though we were in a discounted room. Our room 1813 was the best room for cruise passengers. The beds are great and the pillows even better. Extra pillows, towels and robes were provided. Washcloths were nice and thick. Throw pillows were fun, especially the beach ball. Room was very soundproof. The room had plenty of space. We never heard any hall or other room noises. We enjoyed seeing all the young adults having fun in the lounge area. We really loved the funky and eclectic dÃ©cor of the W. The location was awesome. We could and did walk to great restaurants (CafÃ© 222, The Yard, The Field and Central Cafe) and also to Seaport Village, Gaslamp area, and we even walked to the cruise ship pier when we were ready to board. The only negatives, which were minima, was that the air conditioning really wasnâ€™t very cool and there were no drinking glasses in the room for taking medicine etc. We just used the wine glasses provided. Snack bar and mini bar items were high priced as is typical. We do miss the ice buckets and ice availability that does not seem to be a common amenity anymore. We would stay here again and really loved San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one.........”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinKarene
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Saturday night on a business trip because the place I ordinarily stay was booked up. Very "foo-foo" place with a constant techno beat from the moment you walkin the door. The lobby is essentially a long skinny bar. Got to the room which wasn't bad. A little small. But the worst part was trying to get a good nights sleep here is impossible. That constant techno beat goes all the way through the hotel I swear. And there were train horns, yes I mean train horns going all hours. And the best part......... There is some sort of party area they call "The Beach" that is literally right under the windows where you can hear dozens of people partying like it's 1999 until 2:00 AM!! Oh ya, did I mention the sirens going by too? I have become spoiled by getting a coffee pot in the room of every hotel I have stayed in for the past 10 years, but not here! I went downstairs and asked if I could get a coffee in the lobby and guess what! NO!! there is a Starbucks about 5 blocks away though. Great. I'm an airline pilot and I told them I had a ride arranged in 8 minutes and they started giving me grief about how airlines are the worst businesses in the the country. Like I need a business lesson from the midnight shift at the W Hotel. Very unprofessional. Take a big pass on this one guys. It sucks!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Holbywan
Reviews.Content: The W is perfect for singles, families and pet owners. The W is perfect for business and personal trips. The W is perfect for people young, middle aged and older. From the moment you arrive you are greated with the Whatever, Whenever attitude, smiles and flawless service. The rooms are modern, clean and the bars and restarants are a blast. I have stayed here 15 times and have NEVER had a bad experience. This is a MUST STAY resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good!”
Reviews.Author: IHeartTrips82
Reviews.Content: I stayed the W San Diego and was most mostly pleased. I booked their standard room and requested an upgrade (I'm also a Starwood Preferred Guest - Gold Level). Upon check in I was told we received an upgrade to the Cool Corner Room which made me happy. I found the room to be spacious with nicely appointed. My favorite was the separate bath and oversized towels. At night the hotel lobby turned into a "club." While it wasn't the hottest scene, it was pretty good. It was also convenient as it was raining that night. The negatives. The sink had dried up toothpaste which was unsightly. Also, someone charged drinks from the hotel bar to our room. The manager took care of it promptly, but it was annoying that someone charged over $90.00 worth of drinks and got away with it. I suggest checking your bill when departing. Also, while some of the staff were genuinely friendly, others exhibited fake friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but a little Bizarre”
Reviews.Author: T-Brock
Reviews.Content: 1. Great rooms. Very clean, crisp, and different. Nouveau. Not necessarily our first choice, but we liked it. Different. I could have lived without the techno-dance club music looping through the CD system upon entrance to our Room. Club music pumped in elevators, everywhere but floor hallways. 2. Beach was great (except late-night on weekends). Different and fun. 3. NOT FOR KIDS. I saw children there â€“ not good hotel for both kids, at least the 0-17 yr old type. 18-23 yr old would probably love it. Also, not for older cocktail crowd. 4. Weekend scene. Bizarre, and more than a little cheesy. Lobby turns into nightclub. We did not find it as hip as other reviews have said. I guess, if you think hip means a lot of â€œearlyâ€� twenty-somethings. We did not get it. To us it just came across as a bad Club. A Lobby with chairs pushed to side for the local post high-school San Diego crowd. In fairness, the Hotel does a great job in clean-up; by morning, never knew it was there. But I agree with many posters here that it seems that when weekend comes, guests are secondary. 5. Location not bad. We like to walk, so not a problem for us. In daytime, can walk to places â€“ good 4-5 blocks to Gaslamp or Bay. Little Italy close (but we did not go). At night, not really unsafe, but pretty dead in area. We cabbed it at night. Hillcrest is good area, and Gaslamp not far. House car was not â€œfreeâ€� as some posters here state. We were told would be the same price as Cab. In fact, it was more. 6. Did not eat at Rice, not that impressed by looks but really cannot say. Had drinks at Magnet. Fine. Bottom line, W San Diego trying really really hard to be the "In, Hip" place. Seemed, at least to us, it was trying a little too hard. Would we go back? No. But all-in-all, not a terrible experience. Pretty memorable. I am glad we went.

Reviews.Title: “"Stay Classy, W Hotel San Diego"”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: Reservations: made through the booking agent for the conference I was attending. Price: pretty good because it was a conference rate. Check-in: fast efficient and very friendly. None of the "attitude" I have encountered at other W Hotels. Room: large modern well-furnished, with a great TV and DVD player, large comfortable bed, modern sparkling bathroom, excellent linens and towels, superb Bliss bath products. Amenities: excellent scene in the lobby although the music was a bit loud for my taste, typical W Hotel bar scene, great restaurant in the hotel (Rice), small but nicely appointed gym, small pool, and a spa (which I did not use so I cannot comment about it). Check-out: accurate and friendly. Parking: valet only; pricey but prompt and responsive. Down-side: $12.95 per day for in room internet is ridiculous; this should be free/part of the basic room price. It is 2007, not 1999. This is like a surcharge for electricital lites!!! Come on W, get with it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Hope-and-Dreams
Reviews.Content: Room was very small and uncomfortable. Biggest complaint: No place to sit and read and relax. Even airport motels have armchairs! Bathroom sink plumbing leaked, needing a repair and mop and clean towels. Air conditioning couldn't be figured out even by the engineering staff, who came three times to try and adjust it. Lighting in the elevators was pretty much non-existent. If you didn't trip in the halls or elevators, it was due to your own efforts not the hotel's. Staff smug. Couldn't imagine why. Noise from next door room easy to hear. Breakfast OK. Valet service OK. TV and bed OK. Lobby attractive. Definitely not worth the money. Not the place to stay if you want a comfortable, inviting room, with a place to relax and enjoy a vacation or down time during a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, cool... but not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: CTYankee06820
Reviews.Content: Attending a convention I was booked by our Corp. Travel Dept. into this oh-so-hip and cool downtown hotel. Yes, they have a sand beach on the third floor and the lobby feels like a disco, but the cool looking staff that looks like models desperately needs more training. Clients calling the hotel told me they couldn't get an operator to answer for five minutes. The hotel's tiny business center (aka "Wired") was way over priced and didn't have a copier. High speed internet was great (100 MB/sec) if you were hard-wired in, but the wireless signal was anemic and undependable. The restaurant "Rice" was very chic but very expensive ($15 for a breakfast of three eggs and potatoes... and $5 for a cup of coffee?). Go around the corner to the many local eateries and you'll be much happier. There's an espresso stand right outside the main door. Rooms are about $300 and for that kind of money you expect and deserve real service. Yes, the staff is friendly... just not that prepared for business people. To their credit, when I complained to management in a business-like tone, they were apologetic and did what they could to appease me. But next time, it's the Marriott for me! One good point... only 2 blocks to the Trolley and the Amtrak / Coaster RR Station. Leave the car at home (or airport) because you won't need it.

Reviews.Title: “The Raging Party that is the W”
Reviews.Author: JRockwood
Reviews.Content: During the week this is a respectable business hotel, HOWEVER, on the weekend this place turns into a PARTY! Went out for dinner Saturday night in the Gaslamp district. Upon our arrival back at the hotel, around 10:30pm, there was a lineup out front of the hotel, the lobby furniture gets cleared out and the ENTIRE lobby is a dance floor. Go up to the rooftop beach bar and its more insanity! Young, hip crowd and lots of fun. Room was clean and confortable. There is a great padded ledge in the king rooms that you can lounge on and read or just look out the window. Bathroom was good, although the sliding door doesn't add too much privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be lured to this hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: MUNJASanDiego
Reviews.Content: Staff not experienced or well trained. Bartenders on main floor were not friendly or service oriented. We had to ask the bar back to serve us. Left my new blouse behind in the closet by mistake. Called 2 days later when realized ~ it's gone. Room was okay but overpriced. We were given 2 sets of keys for the minibar ~ neither worked. We asked room service for their least expensive bottle of champagne and were charge $80. (By the way there is no information in the room as to how to reach room service). I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to check your credit card statement for unknown charges from W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: asiancactus
Reviews.Content: While the stay was very pleasant, i got much unpleasant to see unknow charges from this hotel appeared on my credit card statement. I had spent 2 days to try to get a hold off the hotel staff to find out what were those charges for. Finally, after 2 days with many phone calls and voice messages to them, i was able to speak to a hotel manager. She promised to revise the charges. I will have to check the next statement. Hopefully, i will not have to call them again. To make it short, if you decide to stay with this hotel, make sure you keep hotel folio and make sure to reconcile it with your credit statement. You might have some unknown charges from W- San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service”
Reviews.Author: ShaKara
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent her birthday in San Diego, at the W Hotel. I had never stayed at a "W", although I have enjoyed their lobby bar in Seattle from time to time. Anyway- here are the pros and cons: Pros- Service: I am still almost speechless. I have never been treated like such a rock star! From the check in and the conceirge to the bartenders and doormen, everyone made sure that we were taken care of. Rooms: SUCH comfy beds, great music (a free CD that you get to keep is a nice touch), and excellent products by Bliss. I also like that you have to use your hotel key to access the hotel floors. Very clean all around. Windows open just a bit for a nice breeze at night. Very quiet. Food: We sat at the pool and ordered food from the downstairs bar/restaurant. Veggie quesadillas and mint julips! Sounds like a gross combination, but separetly, they were wonderful. Scene: Beach Bar is super fun, as is the lobby bar area. You don't need to leave the hotel for nightlife. Great brew pub right around the corner- I think it's called Carl Strauss- if you like sports and beers. Cons- No auxilary i pod connection to the clock radios. Also, if you want to hit the gas lamp district, you have to take a cab. TIP- if you go out prior to 8PM, there is a possibility that you will be able to take the "house" towncar. It's free, but give Tim (the driver) a big tip! He is wonderful. Email if you'd like more information! Kara

Reviews.Title: “A nice, leisurely stay @ the W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tarepanda07
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & i celebrated our 18 months in a 1-night stay @ the W San Diego Hotel. It sparked my interest after seeing the hotel being featured on the Travel Channel's 'Great Hotels'. I was drawn by the beachy theme & fun, bright colors watching the show, & the real thing was just as great! The hotel itself was a little obscure to find as the building itself isn't too tall, & parking is hard to find (there is valet parking @ the hotel entrance, & parking for a fixed daily fee in the periphery of the building). The check-in was easy, and a bellman helped us with our bags as we entered the disco mirrored elevator, that can only be used with a hotel room key. We had a Wonderful Room on the hotel's top floor, so our views were lovely. I thought the most interesting parts of the room included the chalkboard on the wall area (my bf & i wrote love notes to each other in) & the modern design of the restroom. The shower had a clear glass partition that was engiously designed to be just open enough not to spill water everywhere. But the absolute BEST thing about the room was the BED!!! It was one of the most comfortable beds you could ever sleep on! In fact, the day after, my bf & i even overslept past our already late checkout @ 2 pm (we had the 'Feel the Wuv' package), just because the bed eases you to sleep in a matter of seconds! We also explored other aspects of the hotel. We ate dinner @ Rice, their restaurant. And since it was a weekday (Wednesday), we were one of the first to be seated, and for a long while, were the only customers in the place! The food was great though!!! I would definitely recommend the Braised Kobe Short Ribs for you meat eaters out there!!! And the pricing wasn't too bad at all for a 4 star hotel, at less than $30 per entree. And the most awesome part of dinner were our free desserts from our super nice waitress. I had mentioned on our reservation that it was our 2 year anniversary, so they made our desserts complimentary!!! We decided to try 2 things (try the Really Good Freakin' Chocolate Cake <- that's what it's actually called!), & were happily surprised to see that BOTH were free!!! We then checked out the rooftop bar, Beach, the same night, & had fun listening to good contemporary pop music while sitting next to the bonfire, or cuddling in your very own cabana. Our romance package came with champagne, & it was delivered to our room with chocolate covered strawberries & 2 bottles of champagne on ice! The following day, we had a run in their treadmills equipped with mini tvs & headsets while you exercise (with complimentary water & towels), & this gym overlooked the very cute pool (that was only 4 1/2" at its deepest, but that didn't stop us from swimming in it : ). Then we had a couple of treatments at their Away Spa at a very special half-off rate (Feel the Wuv), & we both had a fantastic, very relaxing time. My boyfriend had the Muscle Massage metro man service, as i had the Sweet Temptation body treatment. They even offer you a private room with tea & magazines while waiting for your appointment. Both 60 treatments cost less than 1 regular spa treatment at less than $130! The front desk was also very helpful. We got extra toiletries (their Bliss products are awesome!), & they suggested a cute French cafe for lunch just a short couple blocks away from the hotel that also had a nice bakery. Overall, our stay at the W San Diego was very pleasant. Just make sure to check-in with a credit card that has a high balance (over $700 for a less than $400 room), & prepare to pay outrageous fees for valet parking ($28 for an overnight stay), but besides those negatives, this boutique hotel is an overall nice stay for a short getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A Cool, Fun, Hip and Young Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thekld
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of Starwoods because I think they have one of the best rewards programs. So I decided to try the W San Diego. This hotel was fun, energetic, hip and very cool. POSITIVES: 1. The bed. This is a given in all Ws which, I believe, all use the "Hevenly Bed." I love this bed, it is pillowed topped and has nice linens and a huge (and heavy) down comforter. It is so comfortable. I was so impressed with this bed the first time I stayed at a W in 2002 that I actually bought one. So its nice to have the same bed in the hotel that I enjoy every night at home. 2. The room. My room was bright and airry with beatiful blue-and-tan color scheme. Very beachy in apparence. It had a beautiful widndow seat covered in cool and funky pillows with wooden shutters and a great view of the city. I especially liked the pillow that looked like a beach ball but complimented the color scheme of the room. 3. The lobby and bar. Its huge and very inviting. Its also very fun, lots of cozy couch and seats to sit in and enjoy the music, and the whole club-like bar scene that goes on in this lobby. Very fun, enegetic and young but also very loud. The second floor overlooking the lobby also has cool places to sit and hang out and people-watch the entire lobby while enjoying a cocktail. 4. The bar on the second floor. Its outside, it has a beach theme with sand, fire pits and cabanas. Very cool evening scene. Lots of fun, friendly wait staff and a really nice place to hang and enjoy a drink or three. NEUTRALS: 1. The bell staff and front desk was average, no one really stood out they kind of just did their job. 2. Location. If your going to stay in San Diego to visit the Gaslamp District at night this hotel is a bit of a walk to the main drag of bars and restaurants. 3. Price. I believe I paid $229/night booked through spg.com. While this is a little on the high side I felt it was worth it. NEGATIVES: 1. The elevators. Extremely SLOW! Maybe I'm impatient but waiting two or three minutes for an elevator to show up on your floor is excessive. 2. The valet at the hotel often takes too long to get you car each time (sometimes as long as 20 minutes when they are busy) and parking at the hotel is over $20/ night which I feel is robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Service literally "whatever, whenever"”
Reviews.Author: TiggerBear
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel's slogan is "whatever, whenever." I guess the hotel really does take that literally. We got a "whatever," don't care nonchalant attitude, and requests were given "whenever" hotel employees feel like it. Stayed at the W Hotel for 1 night on Sunday, 9/2/07 (Labor Day weekend). One of the worst experiences ever, especially considering this is supposed to be a renowned, botique hotel. First discovered that you can't self-park; good thing is that there is valet, which is free. Arrived at the hotel at 2:30pm, told our 2 rooms were not available yet, would only be a "few" minutes & that they would call us when they were ready. A "few" minutes turned into 3 hours!! Every half hour, we would check in at the front desk (we spent our time waiting at the bar) and were told that the rooms were not ready yet. After much prodding, first we were told that that the hotel was overbooked because of rooms booked thru Expedia & that the people who had booked for 2 nights (Saturday thru Monday) were only supposed to be there 1 night, while the hotel itself booked those "available rooms" to people who called the hotel directly. Then, we were told the rooms were not ready yet because they were still being cleaned. We were offered a couple of "free drink" tickets for the bar to compensate for the wait. They finally gave us $50 off per room. I also found it odd that since the W hotel is part of the Starwood chain hotels, that they did not offer to check with another Starwood hotel, like the Westin to see if they could accomodate us. After talking with a few people, I also found out that the people in the hotel lobby which was literally crowded (could barely find an empty seat) was filled with people because they were also waiting for their rooms. While at the bar, we also ordered some appetizers, which arrived 45 minutes later because 30 minutes after we first ordered, the bartender told us that the kitchen "accidentally" did not put in the order; our compensation...a free drink. The rooms themselves were so small; dorm room-style, actually. Floors in both rooms were smelly & damp, like they just steam-cleaned the carpets or something. The windowsill couch had stains on them. When we called for 4 extra towels and a white bedsheet (not the itchy beige blanket), it took 1 hour to arrive and we only got 2 towels and the itchy blanket of course. Apparently the hotel did not have "any runners" available that day and the manager was doing all the runs, which I find extremely ridiculous because 1) this is supposed to be a high-end hotel where you expect excellent customer service; 2) I find it odd that a hotel does not have anyone working in the housekeeping department at that time; 3) it was a weekend and especially Labor Day weekend, a holiday weekend, where you expect hotels are usually busy especially in a popular city like San Diego. So, more excuses there. We did receive complimentary cookies and milk with a note apologizing us for not being able to book the 2 rooms next to each other or at least on the same floor (1 room was on the 13th floor, the other on the 12th), unfortunately only 1 room got these cookies, the other room "lucked out." I will definitely warn people to stay away from the W unless there are no other nice hotels to stay at and they don't mind waiting for hours to get something.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 11Alexander
Reviews.Content: PLUS: Ask for Matthew the Concierge, he is the main reason I would return to this hotel. His recommendations are vital for a nice evening or date. Nice design and tidy rooms, trendy lobby. The rooftop bar is a nice chillout place. MINUS: Staff is nice but not well trained. Forget about the pool (12x18 feet) . Regarding the service just one story; I went there during labor day weekend for our short honeymoon. Although agreed prior to arrival that they would prepare the room with rose petals and champaign nothing was ready upon arrival. I rang the W/W desk before leaving for dinner on Saturday and they said they will take care of it. We returned to the room. Nothing. Same thing on Sunday. Later we were back in the room chilling and around 10.30pm a guy shows up with champaign and asks where to put the rose petals... hmm.. If this was a 5star hotel I would refuse to pay for the stay and to be honest I am still considering to send a letter to the management. Luckily we were pretty relaxed and read some of the reviews already earlier expecting crappy service Nothing more than an average hotel pretending to be a top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love/Hate Relationship with the W”
Reviews.Author: nicocb
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the W was good. The place is very stylish and hip. The staff is friendly, although I was not convinced that the left hand knew what the right hand was doing the whole time. I had asked when I booked when check-in was, and was told 3:00. We showed up at 4:30 and they told us our room was going through "last-minute inspections" and that we would have to wait. Fortunately, they gave us drink tickets and we went up to the ever-so-hip outdoor bar on the 2nd floor, complete with sand and plenty of silicone enhancements ;). I got a call 15 minutes later saying the room was ready. I got a corner room (highly recommend for the extra $$) and it was lovely. The stereo was playing the same "chillout" genre music that we had heard at the bar. Place was very clean. It was our 1-year anniversary, so they had a bottle of champagne and strawberries waiting for us. Nice touch! So where's the "hate" side of the love/hate relationship, you ask? Ok, here goes: the W Hotel slaps a big smile on their face while they GOUGE you. The mini-bar is a JOKE. Want to have a Snickers bar to hold you til dinner? $7 please. Care to watch a flick? That'll be $20. Now, I know that all hotels do this to an extent, but the W is by far the worst I have seen. We had 2 drinks at the bar, and this cost us $25 with tip. I woke up the next morning and looked at the breakfast menu, and I could not BELIEVE the prices they were charging. Now of course I know that it makes sense to charge a little more than, say, the grocery store because of convenience, but it has gone too far! I guess I just grew very tired of the feeling that I was trying to buy water in the desert everywhere I looked at this hotel, especially after paying the room rate that I did! Will I be staying at the W again? No. Will I find a hotel in San Diego that DOESN'T make me feel this way? Who knows-but I will continue to look until I do, and when I do you''ll definitely hear back from me!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: desjo
Reviews.Content: Pleasant greeting & check-in. Unfortunately it all slid downhill from there. For the price of a room at this hotel, you should expect gracious and efficient staff, clean rooms and accessability. The inteior design is refreshing but very poorly executed. All the upholstery, including in the restaurant Rice, is soiled, the carpets need cleaning, the casegoods are chipped and cheap looking. Pillows from Pottery Barn replaced some of the faded and worn back pillows at the Sand Bar banquette but the seat cushions were awful, dirty and looked like they were used for overnight sleeping for the local street people. Server delivering ONLY coffee in the am forgot the coffee! A huge disappointment for the us considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “so cool, but so way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: I did a two day leisure stay at the W San Diego in July. One of the first things you're likely to notice as you drive over from the airport is that you're only a block away from the courthouse and county jail. Some of the streets along the way to the Gaslamp district are lined with Bail Bond shops (and drunk / cracked out homeless people). The safest way to get to Gaslamp is to walk down the street from the W is on State Street and then make a left at Broadway. As many of the other reviews have noted, the W is absolutely not for everyone (specifically, families with kids of any age, people over 40, etc.). The average age of the staff appears to be in the mid-20's, and I believe this is the clientele the W is catering to: young people with massive disposable incomes. If you fit in the demographic though, you're very likely to love the stylish decor. The lobby has a 2 - 3 story atrium overlooking a bar area that gets cleared out weekend nights for DJ's to spin music. The "Beach" rooftop bar is accessible from the 2nd floor. The elevators are surprisingly dark, lit only by some dim LED lights. We were given a room on the 13th floor (nope, we weren't superstitious). No room upgrade or anything extra for having a Starwood Preferred Guest Gold card (and we arrived at 1 or 2 p.m.; maybe this W doesn't care about loyal SPG customers?). We were able to get a slightly later checkout set for 2:30 p.m., though. The room itself was very stylish. A huge king bed with soft (350-thread count) sheets. A ledge in front of the window has a day bed/cushion where one can lounge there and read or do whatever. The downside to our room was that the carpet appears to have seen better days (definite stains and wear & tear), and the in-room air conditioning unit was really good at keeping one wall cool, but the rest of the room felt stuffy or warmer. The bathroom shower has a European-style window covering half the shower area, with a porthole in the middle so water can still spew out onto the floor depending on how close you are to the shower nozzle. The shower knob controls only the temperature, not the flow of the water. As another review noted, the toilet paper holder is not next to you, it'll be a twist and a reach behind you. Instead of some art or print, I liked the chalk board in the room. Perhaps this room was designed to host weddings and bachelorette parties. Combined internet / local and long distance calls are $25... a rip off, when compared to Marriott's typical $10 all inclusive rate at their resorts and hotels. Internet access (by itself) is $13 for 24 hours. Parking is $28 per day now. If everything you're doing is within San Diego, forget the car and take a cab to & from the airport and around town (or bicycle cab, they hang out in front of the entrance, too). You'll save quite a bit of dollars that way. The attached restaurant, Rice, serves very delicious dinners, but just as in the hotel lobby, there's ubiquitous stylish music in the restaurant as well. We were seated right underneath a speaker so that was a wee bit distracting. Overall, I thought this was a very unique & stylish place to stay, I'm glad I did it this one time, but I don't think I would stay here again. but if you're not doing Priceline or some other super deal, hold onto your wallet, this place is likely to drain a lot of cash. For our two day stay, plus parking and one night's dinner at RICE, my bottom line bill was just over $750.

Reviews.Title: “Cold" not "Cool”
Reviews.Author: TravelforFun28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the W properties in the US and I have to say that the W San Diego was by far the most disapointing. From arrival, the valet, door and front desk staff, they were so uninspired and acted as if they were doing us a favor to be staying there. Are these people really that unhappy with their jobs? The overall tone was as far removed from your "Cool,Chic Connected" campaign on the website as you can get. I strongly suggest that you remind your staff that your paying guests are your most important asset. And that being "cool" is very different than being "cold". It just comes off as being poorly trained and unexperienced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: NikkoL
Reviews.Content: Warning - Don't stay at the W If you are into the club scene and are under 25 and don't mind being eyed up and down everywhere you go, and are into strange porn. channels (this place is not for children). If you don't mind getting back to your room the next day at 4:00 pm and finding it still not made up (I had to call and ask for the service - only to be told they needed to fix the new arrival rooms first) so after a full morning I had to leave again for room service to come. If you like paper thin walls - enabling us to hear neighbors dog crying for hours, and then upon their return laughing and screaming at 2:30 am. If getting charged twice for the room, and then being told to wait in room for 3 hours while they figured out "What was Wrong" - only to find out it had been resolved, but they forgot to call, is not a problem for you. Oh, and did I forget to mention the rude front desk upon check-in, and the daily parking charges??? If you can overlook all of this, then you might like the W. I didn't. On the plus side, the parking guys and the whatever concierge were very helpful with directions, the room service was prompt and friendly, but the glass of water had wet paper (nasty dirt) on the bottom. Please don't Waste your time and more importantly your money at the W...

Reviews.Title: “Unworthy of a Category 5 Starwood Designation”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodMember
Reviews.Content: We had the choice between the US Grant and the W. We made a bad choice. We asked well in advance for an early check-in and a room with a view. We got the early check-in for a room on the topmost floor. Our view was of the San Diego Jail. At least we were high enough to not see the homeless sleeping on the streets all around the hotel. 1. Our room was tiny. 2. The swimming pool was EVEN TINIER than our room. 3. The "bath" towels were also tiny. 4. The walls between the rooms were so thin that we heard our neighbor and I was constantly being awakened Sat evening to 3:30 am Sunday morning, at which time I called the front desk and I suppose someone finally got the errant guests to settle down. 5. There was no free Internet service to check our email. 6. There was no complimentary coffee service in the morning lobby. 7. The car valets took excessive time in attending to us, both on arrivals and departures. 8. While we have stayed in hotels with no Jacuzzi or air tubs in the room, I can't remember staying in a hotel with NO BATH TUB WHATSOEVER. There was no tub in the (tiny) bathroom that we had. 9. The elevators were lit by violet LEDs which made them dark and disconcerting. The W is pre-occupied with being hip and cute with its ever-present "W" theme; e.g., call "Wheels" when you want the valet and call "Whatever/Whenever" if you want room service. For the prices charged, W is woefuilly inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back...to sleep at least”
Reviews.Author: tinkrbe1l3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at W's frequently so I'm use to certain things...and expect certain things: 1) the DJ in the lobby 2) the awesome, modern, hip decor that changes for every W 3) Whatever/Whenever service. I know what the W is known for and won't comment on that. Unfortunately, the W San Diego did not meet my expectations of a hotel in general. These were my problems: ROOM I didn't receive my comp upgrade because I'm an SPG Gold member...but i didn't really expect it since I arrived at 7pm. We arrived in our non-smoking room only to find it reeking of smoke. Yes I'm one of those sensitive people who get instant headaches from smoke smell. After a long drive in traffic form LA, the migraine started. We were told the smoking rooms are only on level 5. That's nce and all but I'm not imagining this. The Whatever/Whenever girl came upstairs and said she thought it was ridiculous and she's a smoker. The offered to ionize the room to get rid of the smell (30minutes) or wait for a clean room. We tried the ionize first since they couldn't give us a time frame for a clean room. it didn't work. They had also cleaned a room I suppoe in that 30 minutes because we were moved to another room. Smelled great. We go out to the club, come back, ROOM REEKS OF SMOKE. We thought we were going crazy. The W couldn't move us at 2am and we didn't want to since we had unpacked everything. They could only offer us a candle. So my morning was miserable because I had the headache from smoke, the fragrant candle, and the wine I drank the night before. They didn't have any tylenol on hand but they would get it for a $12 fee plus the tylenol cost. i decided to let it heal naturally. They finally moved us the next day to another room. This one was good to go and we remained there for the rest of the weekend. The shower drained clogged as well but we were tired or the issues. we could not be in the room until 3pm. which leads me to what we did during the late morning and afternoon. POOL I foolishly booked a hotel with intentions to bask in the sun by the pool when the hotel website never showed a direct image of the pool area. The pool is ridiculously small. There were only 7 lounge chairs. We took sick pleasure in watching guests come into the pool area and look puzzled...bewildered. it was really funny because we did the same thing. Of course all the chairs were taken because there are only 7. They try and trick you too by putting tall mirrors on the adjacent wall so it looks like there are 2 mini pools. It was also funny to see people walk that way and realize the people they see were themselves. This was all funny because we did the same thing :) The poolside service was slow and we needed to remind the server that we wanted menus, that we ordered food, that we needed water. I don't know why she just didn't right stuff down. There were some annoying kids in the pool too...it was extra annoying since you couldn't slink away to a corner of the ppol and be to yourself. The pool was too small. Annoying kids....not hotels fault...small pool...hotel's fault. So we left the pool to go get a quickie massage. SPA Very small as well...don't expect a great spa experience. My girl Jennifer/Jessica was very relaxing...which was good since I needed it. But again...don't expect more than a nice treatment...no real amenities here. Did we eat at the W? yes we did FOOD 1) Rice was great on decor. we had breakfast. It was pricey but that's typical of a hotel. I enjoyed it but my order was messed up the first go round. I don't know why waiters like to test themselves by not writing things down. But i really did like my breakfast. 2) poolside food was good. we had the kobe mini burgers and they were great. the sexy fries...not so much...skip those unless you need the kill a fry urge. the chicken wings were ok...but im not a big fan of sweet flavors...but my friends liked them. we had an issue getting our dessert. it wasn't on the pool menu but they said we could have whatever whenever from the regular menu...guess that's not really true. the pool girl kept coming back and saying "let me check on it" an hour later when we needed to leave for our massages, she said the cook never started it. ????? very strange...i don't know how she didn't realize this. 3) in room dining was ok. the best thing was teh banana creme brulee. the grilled cheese with tomato and basil wasn't melted. the crab snadwich was good. too much bread though. 4) bar drinks were good. they carry Effen black cherry vodka which is a good vodka. I mix it with diet coke. We tried the Kiss N Fly and Porn Star...both pleasant. I preferred the Kiss N Fly. The GOODS All this being said...this is how the W compensated for their shortcomings: 1) sweet bellman (Welcome Ambassador) Eric. He was there for all our room changes, check in, and check out. He might have requested that so we saw a friendly face. But I'm glad he got our tip money. 2) they W comped us one night (as they should have). we didn't ask for it. they gave it when we needed to change rooms for the 3rd time. but if they didn't, i was gonna ask. 3) the pool girl gave us 2 free drinks for the dessert issue 4) the W gave us 3 free drinks the first night while we waited to have our room ionized. 5) they smiled through every issue even though it felt like they wanted us to go back home. Sorry! i'm paying you. alot. the W isn't one of the cheaper Starwood properties. 6) the fun atmosphere in the lobby, the decor...but that is expected of all W hotels.

Reviews.Title: “consistent and good service”
Reviews.Author: Trover
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this W three times now and each time has been similar. This is a hotel for certain types of travelers - and I can see how you could be disappointed if you had different expectations. This is not a beach or view hotel. Although it is close to the harbor, the rooms don't have balcony's and most don't have views of the water. The hotel is in a part of downtown that is being redeveloped. It is not in the middle of really anything else, although it is convenient walking distance to Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp District. It is also minutes away from the freeway (5). Although the motif is perhaps getting a little dated, it is a trendy hotel, like the other W's. It is well done and not simply an old Holiday Inn that has been fixed up with some funky linens and lighting. Starwood has a whole range of other properties designed for families and more conventional business travelers - stay at them if you don't like loud music (in the lobby) or the fact that the hotel plays up this "nightclub" atmosphere. Like other W's, the hotel is very nicely done. Bliss products in the bathrooms and an attentive staff. I've stayed in both the standard and the corner rooms - the corner rooms are great with a bigger bathroom and a soaking tub. During my recent stay I had several interactions with the staff and they were very positive. The thing I like about the W is that it is close enough to everything in downtown without being too close to the other convention hotels. It is a bit of an oasis from the typical big property. Given the proximity to the freeway, you can be in Coronado in 10 minutes and Mexico in 15. The food is excellent and Beach is a great bar (although it gets a bit crowded Friday and Saturday nights). Recommended for the right person.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would definitely go there again”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the W Hotel last week. The property manages to be chic and sophisticated without coming across as overly contrived. They do this with lighting, furnishings, music, and probably a bunch of other design elements. The staff was amazing â€“ very friendly and helpful, by treating you as they would as a peer â€“ not obsequious or overtly deferential, just helpful and respectful. Although the Wâ€™s market is the business traveler who is interested in a non-cookie cutter stay, the staff was also excellent with kids. (The W would also be a good hotel for a romantic getaway.) I also appreciated the amenities â€“ 3 versions of soap, plus shampoo, conditioner, and lotion, all of which were very nice. The pool is cute. Certainly not large. But fun in a W way. There are about 5 treadmills and a few other cardio options in the workout area. The bar (named â€œBeachâ€� and located on a rooftop with heated sand) seemed nice, but we did not check it out. Parking is valet-only. Downsides: - No in-room coffee. I was actually pretty shocked by this, since it seems to be a prevalent amenity across all hotel/motel classes. - The shower drained very slowly, resulting in standing in an inch or more of water. I didnâ€™t request it to be fixed, though â€“ Iâ€™m guessing that they would have taken care of it that day. - The toilet paper holder is situated in an awkward location, and the toilet paper roll tends to come off of the holder. - There are many bail bond locations in the surrounding 2 blocks or so. A couple of blocks beyond that are several lockups. - Itâ€™s about a 10-15 minute walk to the convention center. Slightly less for Gaslamp Quarter. Overall, Iâ€™d highly recommend a stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: juliechloe
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were told the guests from the prior night had not left, and they were unable to give us a room. We were directed to a hotel around the corner, where they had booked us a room. This sister hotel was under construction, and we were jostled awake by what sounded like jackhammers above us at 7 am. We called the W, where they refused to refund our money for the next 2 nights, leaving us at the loud hotel until around lunch, when the W was kind enough to actually find us a room (after my calling repeatedly and throwing a fit). Needless to say, it was not a relaxing weekend getaway. Turns out the room at the W was cute, but small. The staff is surly at best. The concierge will ignore you if you are not a cute, young girl. So not worth the money. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bar with a Hotel Attached”
Reviews.Author: amandarenee
Reviews.Content: It seems like the main focus of this hotel is operating bars and hosting weddings. Operating the hotel seems like an after thought. Things started out well, the first night was fine. The second night the room parties began. First party an in-room bridal party bash, which inspired us to change rooms. We were given keys to a new room, only to find it occupied. We talked to a staff member and he informed us we had the wrong room # even though the key worked. We were then taken to the "correct" room number which was also occupied. We then took our bags downstairs and waited for our room. We were upgraded to a much nicer room and felt better about the whole incident (temporarily). At approximately 10pm the two rooms adjacent to us hosted a party with probably 50-60 people. It was beyond loud with the 2 doors alternating slamming and a group of people congregating in front of our door. We called the front desk and they said they would send someone to quiet them down. That lasted for 5 minutes at that point at 11:30pm we packed our bags and moved to another hotel. We are not cranky people, we enjoy having fun. How about if the hotel books all the parties and wedding parties on one floor as opposed to having them taking over the entire hotel? We would not stay at this W again. It was quiter in the W in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: smakowski
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel in downtown San Diego. Great service, fabulous rooms, even with a fun rooftop beach bar (sand and all). It was youthful luxury at its best. It is the place to see the young beauties of the city. The fashion scene is part of the experience here, often hosting fashion shows. This is both a warning and encouragement. If you plan to stay here with the hopes to have a quiet night's sleep, ask if there is a fashion show with a runway, or some similar the night of your stay. It can be noisy those nights, with parties lasting much of the night. The consierge assured me that they would have quieted the guests had they been notified. Overall, this was a fabulous hotel. The restaurants were great, although somewhat overpriced. If you are in town for a conference, this hotel is worth considering: a little bit off the normal conference route, but easy walk/access to anything and everything downtown and unique with unbeatable service.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place!”
Reviews.Author: purpleravioli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W San Diego for 2 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. This place is fun. They cleared out the lobby on Saturday night and brought in a DJ. My husband and I watched from the balcony. The Beach bar was also fun. The only problem was they served drinks in plastic cups a la spring break. It draws an extremely young crowd so I guess this doesn't bother them. The beds are fabulously comfortable. I do wish they had coffee makers in the rooms. I ordered a Belgian waffle from room service for breakfast and it arrived cold so that was a bummer. The hotel is really in a great location downtown within walking distance of Gaslamp and Little Italy. The walks are a bit spooky since it it very dark and there are an alarming number of homeless people sleeping on the streets. But there were lots of people out walking so we felt pretty safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JabaGee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel for 3 nights. We were in San diego for a mix of business and vacation. We were looking forward to a 'W' stay, & were not disappointed. Overall, we loved this hotel! It is beautiful, with a great design aesthetic. The rooms are great, even if on the small side. Loved the bed (so comfy!), the flat-screen TV, the window seats, windows that open, the bathroom design & Bliss products. Just about everything about the room was great. The lobby is beautiful and is like an oasis when you enter. The outside beach bar was great for hanging out. Groovy lounge music is played throughout the hotel - nice touch. The gym is great, because it is essentially outside - had a lovely workout. The pool area was nice, but very small. They could use more staff visits to the pool to clean up towels etc. The clientele is not one to pick up after themselves, so the seating often appeared taken after the guests had left. Overall, the hotel is quite spotless and smells great. We found the staff pleasant and helpful overall. We realize no hotel stay is perfect. We did have a couple of annoyances, which echo complaints of previous reviews, but these are pretty minor details. One front desk guy appeared to be trying to humor us, but was really quite unprofessional. He had a heck of a time trying to expedite a room change, despite his assurance that changing to King room would be no problem. He seemed to think that we would enjoy chatting with him repeatedly to get this done. In the end, after several hours, he was totally ineffective & we called the 'whatever, whenever' desk who switched us immediately. The other annoyance was waking up to loud partyers next door at 1AM. This happened on our last night only. We called the front desk & they sent security up within a few minutes. It took awhile for them to settle. This, of course, can & does happen at all hotels & requires a bit of luck. The last annoyance comes from street noise, which is no worse than any other downtown hotel in San Diego. Would recommend the higher the floor, the better re: noise. One other note: Enterprise rental cars will drop off and pick up their cars at no extra charge from this hotel - very convenient. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel & we would definitely be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterTravels
Reviews.Content: Unlike some prior reviews, I had an excellent few days at the W San Diego. The hotel is more for young singles/ yuppies (20s-30s), as the hotel lounge and bars are a big hang out with the yonger crowd, epecially during the weekends. The room was smaller than I expected, but the beds were excellent and the room/bathroom was otherwise great. The hotel overall is a very cool modern design. The beach bar was pretty cool as a roof top bar. Breakfast was pretty good, but service was slow. The pool was nice, but very small. Overall, no big complaints. I had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “W should stand for Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmb20
Reviews.Content: What was supposed to be a nice relaxing getaway to San Diego for the night turned into a disaster and every single thing that went wrong was due to the W. This was by far one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. As a frequent traveler, I take hotel stays very seriously and I have high expectations, especially for 4 and 5 star hotels which charge over $300/night. We should have known what we were in for when we arrived at the valet and there was nobody there. Finally after driving in circles around the property we spotted someone and flagged him down. Once inside the hotel, we thought it was decent, your typical hipster hotel ala the Standard or Viceroy hotels in LA. Since I have stayed at the W before in other cities I assumed we would have a pleasant stay. Wow was I wrong. We were told the rooms were not ready and we should sit in the "living room" and have a drink (it was after 3 oclock - check in time). We complied and waited for almost an hour. I finally had to go say something to the girl at the desk. She could care less as she just said "well sorry" and giggled. I was appalled. They didn't even TRY to offer us a cocktail or something to appease us. Finally a very rude man came up and handed us a key without an apology for the wait. Not even a word spoken other than "here." He didn't even have the decency to show us to the elevator. When we got in our room it reeked of smoke and the bedding was severly stained. We had a lovely view of a bum haven and noticed that the valet parks the cars in an uncovered, unsecured lot across the street.....for $26! The cocktail waitress told us that the in-house restaurant Rice and the rooftop bar Beach were the hot spots in the city and we should make plans to spend the evening in the hotel, so we did. We made reservations for 8:15 at Rice and set out for a walk around town (the only time during this trip without complaints....we were far away from the W). We came back to the hotel in hopes of getting ready for the evening. The shower was freezing cold. No hot water. We got ready and went to Rice. We were promptly seated though we had already order drinks in the lounge. We informed the hostess that we had ordered drinks so that she could alert the cocktail waitress. She never did and it took the poor waitress 20 minutes to locate us. We waited about 40 minutes from the time we were seated and never were approached by a waiter. I finally had to flag one down to REQUEST service. He was very apologetic and passed the blame onto the hostess. The food was so-so. Certainly nothing to rave about and most definitely nothing worth waiting 45 minutes for a waiter to serve us. After dinner we went up to the Beach bar. It was definitely NOT a hot scene. More remniscent of a high school kegger. We decided to call it a night. The next morning our bill was slipped under the door. Somehow on the bill was both our dinner charge and another charge for $133 from Rice. We had to call and haggle it out with the concierge. What a wake up call! We decided at that point to call our trip short and get out of there as soon as possible. Of course the valet took forever to retrieve our car...and we drove away from the W as fast as possible. I can say wholeheartedly that I will never stay at this hotel again and would never recommend it to friends. You'd probably have better luck at the Motel 6. I am so disappointed, I'd probably boycott the entire chain of W hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: avon_eagle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Diego this week for a conference. I booked the conference late and was unable to get a hotel closer to the convention center, and had a choice of the W, the U.S.Grant, or the Wyndham Emerald Plaza (now Westin SD). Since I had Starwood rewards, I chose the W for its sophistication and trendiness. I was very pleased with the whole experience. The doorstaff were helpful with directions or hailing a cab. The front desk was cheerful when checking me in - even though I was an hour early, I was able to get into my room without any hassle or wait. The Whatever/Whenever concierge was great for dinner suggestions, even if it was just getting us a pizza delivered from the nearby Little Italy neighborhood. When the bar didn't have my partner's brand of cigarettes, they sent a doorman three blocks to the 7-11 to get them for her. Our room was clean and well-supplied every day. I would have liked to have a comfy chair, but there was a huge window seat that worked OK. Bed was luxurious, desk was huge, and there were plenty of hangers in the closet (one of my usual pet peeves). There was a chalkboard to leave messages or just draw on - it said Welcome to San Diego my first day, then changed to have a nice day, and have a great weekend - a nice touch. One safety caveat - downtown San Diego seemed very safe for the most part, especially in the Gaslamp District and near the stadium. The immediate area around the W was also safe, but about two to three blocks east on B and C Street is the city jail/courthouse, with 24 hour bail bondsmen offices and some unsavory characters hanging around, including some homeless sleeping on the sidewalk. While we were not approached by anyone, we did step pretty quickly for the last couple blocks back from the Gaslamp Quarter. When I mentioned it to the doorman, he gave us a safer walking route to the Gaslamp area for the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: holatamara
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for a conference visit. Only a 10 minute walk to the Manchester Hyatt, Gaslamp district, maritime museum & harbor village. The good... The room was spotless and well appointed. I especially enjoyed the Bliss products provided. - The hotel has many lounge areas, including a beach inspired outdoor bar/lounge. A pool area and great gym. - The music was soothing and not the raging electro/techno some other W establishments pound on the speakers. The not so good... - The view was not great, I was facing south into a parking lot. - The concierge gave us an extra piece of luggage we discovered while at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't know the W, Read this review”
Reviews.Author: metsisme
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: My review is based on comparing this hotel to others in it's price/star range. First and foremost, it's important that you know what you're getting when you book a stay at a W hotel. This is not the Hyatt Regency. If you are looking for quiet, dimly lit oak bars, antique looking room furnishings or for anything conservative, you should look elsewhere. The W is all about being trendy from the lobby bar to the rooms to the staff. You're going to get bright, vibrant colors (in the San Diego W, it's a blue and yellow color scheme). If you have a problem with techno music, rock music or rap music, look elsewhere. If seeing people consume alcohol is an issue for you, look elsewhere. The W caters to a mostly hip, upscale crowd, business travelers and the like. Hotel: Many have said they had trouble with parking here but I had no issues. Hotel is all valet (maybe it wasn't in the past). You drive up, you get out, you hand the guy your keys, he hands you a ticket and you're done. Easy. Took me 30 seconds from driving up to having my bags out of the car and on my way. Decour is ultra-modern. Bright colors. Trendy lounge/bar on the first floor that shares space with the lobby. On weekend nights it will be crowded with well dressed hipsters drinking martinis. Gym and small pool on the 2nd floor. A few free weights but mostly cardio machines. The tredmills, bikes and elipticals all had in-console TVs and radios (and some of them even worked). Staff: If the cool college kids who live down the street bother you, so will the staff. I found them all nice and very helpful. When I called down for my car it never took more than 15 minutes for it to arrive. Room service was fast and polite. After being on the road for business for nearly two months straight, I didn't feel like leaving the room one night and the room servince menu didn't have what I wanted, so I called Whatever/Whenever and had them go pick me up some Thai food from a place a few blocks away. Had my food in 40 minutes (shorter than the room service wait on a Friday night) for a couple of extra bucks. Room: Great. A little small but that's typical with W rooms. Well decorated in bright blues and yellows. 36" flat panel TV. DVD player in room if you brought movies with you or you can check them out from the hotel library. Excellent toiletries. Cant beat the lemon/sage body wash and lotion. Restaraunt/Bar: Three, three, three bars! Lounge bar is attached to the lobby and has a few stools and lots of couch/lounge space with games like chess, checkers, etc. This place is pretty popular and expensive. Magnet bar is down the hall and worth checking out. Beach bar is up from the pool on the 2nd floor past the pool and has a sand floor, fire pit, hanging chairs, and palm trees. It is usually packed in good weather. Was little chilly during my stay and I found the beach bar to have the funnest people and best bartenders in the hotel. Other: The W is not cheap. I travel for work, so I don't care because it all gets expensed. You are going to get hit up for everything here. Bottle of Voss water? Paying. Parking? 25 bucks a night. Internet access? 12 bucks a day. Pack of M&Ms from the mini-bar? 4 bucks. Be smart. Clean everything out of the mini-bar, stack it on top, and fill it with your own snacks and drinks. When you leave, put their stuff back in. Problem solved.
