Reviews.Title: “A+ experience, hip youthful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The room we had was a deluxe suite and it was tastefully decorated and had great views. The hotel is situated in downtown San Diego and parking is a bit difficult. But that was the only drawback. If you want a classy, hip hotel, this one is it. Would definately recommend for young, upscale adults. There is a bar in the lobby that is very popular with the locals (again, think upscale youthful yuppies, post-modern hipsters). But if you stay in the hotel, you skip the line for the bar and get free entrance. There is nothing bad to say about this place. Great view, beautiful room, clean. Pleasant stay. Classy. A+ experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Beach Bar -- Sand, cocktails, music and a fire pit!”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: (The W Hotel's rooftop bar) I went here with my uncle and his date after dinner back in early 2002. We arrived fairly early, and we were able to get prime seating directly in front of their fire pit. The drinks were pricey but strong. The sand was a nice touch, and the background music was decent. As the night progressed, the place became crowded, seemingly beyond capacity. People practically fought for seating near the fire pit as the temperature dropped. I'd recommend this as a great place for after-dinner cocktails, but if crowds aren't your thing, then avoid the Beach Bar for late weekend evenings. Cons: Noisy, crowded, cold if you're not near the fire pit. Overall user rating: Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Weh.”
Reviews.Author: HlGHFlVE
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego was nice enough but certainly not a four-star hotel. The overall problem was the desperate trendiness of the establishment. The hotel is relatively new, yet the decor is already looking dated. Though my room was clean, the lucite dresser/desk was chipped in places, and the custom shower curtain hanging mechanism (or whatever) was also worn. Some of the staff was helpful, whereas others couldn't be bothered, as when I tried to figure out how to connect to the wireless Internet in the lobby. Also, I understand exorbitant prices for cute in-room tchotchkes like teddy bears, candy and hats, but charging for an "intimacy kit," which included condoms, seems ridiculously irresponsible. And the W certainly could afford to offer free Internet in its rooms. I've stayed in Best Westerns that offer that amenity free of charge. Come on. The worst part of the stay, for me, was the hotel's clientele, a mixture of Eurotrash, buisinessmen, and Americans with a little extra money. Ew. If you're going to San Diego and you have money to spend on a hotel room, stay somewhere closer to the harbor or water in a place far less eager to be fashionable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Olivia99
Reviews.Content: I was very much looking forward to staying there for work as I had heard such great things about the W. Also, it was $320 a night, which gave me high expectations. At first glance, it definitely lives up to the hype. A cool, modern scene when you walk in, great looking rooms, a posh restaurant downstairs. But then you start noticing other things. You're paying a lot per room, but absolutely nothing is included in that. They charge you for Internet access, water, snacks, even a first-aid kit. I don't expect everything to be given away, but to me when you're at a posh hotel, they should provide some things free of charge. It's just not classy to nickel and dime you for everything. I also found the service atrocious. My Internet connection wasn't working with their system and someone on the phone just kept telling me, "go to Turbonet, go to Turbonet" even though that wasn't useful and didn't work. The hair dryers in our rooms were horrible, literally the lowest end, smallest hair dryer you could imagine. What really killed me though was going to the restaurant, Rice, for breakfast. It was a lovely place and the service was fantastic. But my bill for a bowl of oatmeal, a beautiful plate of fruit and an orange juice was $30. That's really over the top and unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Sand bar on the roof - trendy, modern, big place!”
Reviews.Author: reniz154
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego, and I love this hotel. It's very, very modern, has a zen-like atmosphere, has 3 bars to hang out in, and one on the roof is a sand bar - ladies, take off your heels! The rooms are very modern and comfortable - but not big, with EVERY possible service you may want (for a fee, of course). 24 hr room service - I needed contact lenz solution and a contacts case at 3 am - it was in my room 10 minutes later. At night this is one of local favorite hangouts, to have drinks or dinner in. The restaurant - Rice - is trendy, with california fusion cusine. A little on the pricey side, but good food. There are 2 bars downstairs with different music. Drinks are a little on the expensive side - but that's like anywhere in San Diego. This hotel is about a $5-6 cab ride away from the center of Downtown. So, if your looking to stay within walking distance of 4th and 5th streets - which is where the main night life and restaurants are - this may be a little further then you want to be. Consider Solimar hotel, or Mariott downtown, both are of the same calliber and value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, I'd stay again, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Londoner-Chelsey
Reviews.Content: The W in San Diego is a well-decorated, well-kept, clean and very hip (using the term loosely) hotel in downtown San Diego. It is on an excellent location near restaurants, the san diego conference center and the sant fe depot. I stayed on business two weeks ago, and I would like to make a couple of points. During the third night of my stay there was no hot water coming in any of the top floor rooms. After repeatedly calling the front desk I was met with the the Whatever/Whenever attitude, ''My shower is not working!", "Whatever" and "When are you going to fix it?", "Whenever". Well to be fair it wasn't that bad, but there were no solutions offered either, apart from the anticipated we-are-doing-everything-we-can-type-of-attitude-but-hey-maybe- it-is-not-enough. Overall, I believe this is unacceptable for a four star hotel. Although the situation is justifiable, since things tend to go wrong sometimes, the incident overall really crashed the nice impression I had about the hotel. For that amount of money I really felt that they should try harder, and if that is not enough (or up to your standards) even harder to make your wish their first priority. In general, though, a very beautiful and comfortable hotel (I loved the bed), if not too pricey and undoubtedly too pretentious for my taste. A Londoner...

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hotel W...”
Reviews.Author: JudyColo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for 3 nights for business and can't rave or rant about the place. It's typical Hotel W - looks very hip and trendy, attracts a hip and trendy crowd at night but is a mediocre hotel at heart. The room size was good (much better than the Ws I stay at in NY) and there was an area to work as well as a cushioned window seat. The bathroom was also a decent size, with a powerful showerhead. Other positives included- comfy bed, bliss toiletries, location (my business was downtown), good restaurant. Negatives - unbelieveably complicated thermostats that reset themselves in the middle of the night and can't be controlled manually by anyone with less than a PhD in electronics, not enough working machines in the "gym", a missed wake-up call, having to consistently wait 10-15 rings for someone to answer the whatever/whenever line. The Beach (a bar) is really cool, the food at Rice (the restaurant) was great but pricey, and the bar food was inedible (although the bartender took it off my tab without me having to ask). They were also in the process of updating the TVs to plasmas while I was there - my room hadn't received the upgrade yet but they did offer DVD movies because the TV signal was dicey. Unfortunately mine went out on election night - as I was trying to watch the election results. Although overall the W was very good, when I'm paying $370 per night, I expect the hotel to be on its "A" game. I give it more of a solid B.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Recruiting
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic. This place is funky, hip and totally the place to be if you are running with (or want to run with) the "in" crowd. Great ambiance, stellar room, and unique bars. Service was top-notch as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to folks who don't mind paying $10 for a shot of Jager and consider it standard fashion to dress to impress for simple cocktails. I don't recommend this hotel for families or those traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “bad location”
Reviews.Author: emikelaw
Reviews.Content: I love W hotels but this one I can live without. The location is next to the jail. The gaslamp is a hike away as well as anything worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “How can such a young crowd afford to stay here?”
Reviews.Author: MikaZ
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12 year old daughter and I stayed at W San Diego for the Labor Day weekend. We arrived at about 4:00 pm to a very crowded lobby. We soon discovered that everyone was waiting for their rooms to be cleaned so they could check in and occupy them! We were told there would be about a 45 minute wait....it stretched to an hour and my husband made a friendly complaint. They were very gracious at the desk and offered to reduce the room rate--we were pleased, and got our room quickly. Every staff person we came in contact with was friendly and attentive! The customer service was fantastic the entire weekend! The room was clean and nicely designed. The breakfast at Rice was very pricey but good. But the whole weekend we marveled at how young most of the other patrons were: everyone was 20s-30s and very hip (some of them tragically hip). For such a pricey hotel----how can they afford it? We couldn't have dropped that kind of money when we were in our 20s (we are in our 40s now). This is not a place for kids. The lobby and reception area becomes a nightclub in the evenings and the atmosphere is not for famlilies. If we were younger and looking for a place to party and then crash upstairs, this would have been great for us.

Reviews.Title: “The W lives up to expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: rodneeeeo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at a W Hotel and I have enjoyed both experiences. For this trip, we were there celebrating our friend's 32nd birthday and it was unbelievable. The W San Diego is conveniently located and within walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter. For first time visitors to the W, be prepared for a "unique" hotel experience. The lobby does become a club at night where you can get your groove on. There's also a rooftop bar which is a cool place to hangout and people watch. I don't recommend this place for families or older travelers. This hotel caters to young adults, party-goers, and hipsters. If you want a typical hotel experience, then the W is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate a 30th birthday...”
Reviews.Author: Caroline814
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 30th birthday with 12 friends at the W hotel this month. The hotel was perfect for the occasion! There are suites, and king rooms which we all tried - and were all very nice and welcoming. All the beds are heavenly, and so comfortable! The Bliss products are great. You also can't beat the room service - which my friends and I appreciated at 3AM in the morning. Concierge, the front desk, and the "Whatever Whenever" staff where all VERY professional, helpful, and nice. I am from Southern California, and have traveled afar. I would definitely stay here again. We had an excellent dinner at the Gaslamp Quarter (Mr. Tiki), and then came back to the W hotel - where they convert the first two floors into practically a club! It was totally happening - and so much fun. The drinks - very good, and the DJ played fun dance music. You can't beat this if you're staying at the hotel - because it's free. Other clubs (don't go to "The Stingery" where they tried to charge us $1200!!!) - charge entrance fees - and the W provides the same entertainment for guests, and friends. The W knows exactly what they're doing. The hotel prices were very reasonable - nothing outrageous. They know how to bring back clientele. I tried the gym the next morning, and it was small, but I still got a great workout. The hotel overall is highly recommended - and if you get a chance to experience it, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “only if you are single 20something”
Reviews.Author: DadOfTwins
Reviews.Content: Unless you are a single 20-something who wants to: 1) take a cab to the hotel (you will not find parking or a valet or a sign for valet parking/passenger drop-off) 2) hear 24 hr techno music in the lobby and in the elevators 3) hang out with young and hip employees at the front desk who think they are at a nightclub vs working at a hotel 4) and don't care about professionalism Don't even try to stay at this hotel. If you want to stay at an upscale chain hotel, try the Westin at Horton Plaza (also owned by Starwood), Marriott at the Convention Center or the Manchester Hyatt. We had the exact same experience as a previous reviewer who was - to say the least - challenged to figure out the parking situation and was annoyed by the loud techno music. And, like the previous couple, my wife and I, tried to explain the surprise and the frustration we had with parking but the extremely young and amateurish general manager listened to us (with a smile) and told us that this was the first time anyone brought up a similar complaint (the "kids" who worked at the valet told us that every other customer complains about not seeing the sign (there is none) or finding parking). And the "general manager" absolutely did nothing. In fact one of the bellboys figured out that he had to step in to save the situation (I was about to cancel the reservation and leave) and started talking to us reasonably. Anyway, I think if this hotel is managed right, i.e. like a upscale hotel instead of a 24 hr. nightclub, it will satisfy a wider range of guest profiles. I will definitely right a complaint letter to Starwood who needs to completely overhaul the management at this property.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely awesome W”
Reviews.Author: Saba61
Reviews.Content: Spent most last weekend (Saturday and Sunday nights) at the W Hotel in San Diego. The hotel is gorgeous, the decor is more vibrant then the other W's i've stayed at, similar but different. The thing that made this location extra special was the incredible attention to detail by the staff, they were all friendly but not intrusive, helpful but not annoying. The lobby area is great for hanging out and relaxing, the roof deck bar and lounge was a fabulously mellow way to finish off the weekend on Sunday night. Only complaint would be that the fitness centre is lame, 2 of the 4 treadmills were not functioning and the pool is big enough to cool off in but is not nearly large enough for any real swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but rather have stayed at the Westin...SPG”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 30th through July 2nd (Independence weekend) using our SPG points. Usually staying at the Westin Horton San Diego, we thought o give the W a try. Upon arrival at the hotel around 11:30pm, there was no sign entry for check in, we did find underground parking (for valet only) what we couldnâ€™t find was the valet entrance. After circling the hotel 4 times, we finally pulled up to the entrance for the club. (From reading the reviews, I knew ahead of time the lounge turns in to a club) However, I did NOT know you need to check in going through the same way. We asked the attendant where are we suppose to Valet to check in, and to our surprise â€œright hereâ€�. We brought our two puppies along (pet friendly hotel) they were shaking to the deafening sound of the music. While I check in my boyfriend (holding puppies) waited by the entrance where the benches were. The receptionist and I were yelling to each other because we couldnâ€™t hear over the music. (Bad experience checking in) Never had to yell that loud just to get someone the hear me. Our room was located on the 12 floor with a peek a boo ocean view. Do NOT order in room breakfast!! I warned you! I would have enjoyed a breakfast at Dennyâ€™s 100x more. Bad: -Checking in after 9:00pm is HELL -Food [----]â€“ yes, even RICE -Was is $26.00/per night valet? (If you can find it!) Good: -Pet friendly -Friendly staff We would probably will not stay and any W hotel, most likely sticking to the Westin. Now, people do say that W is for more of the 20-35 age range. And the Westin is for more for 35+. Well, Iâ€™m 25, my boyfriend is 27.. If you are deciding between the W or the Westin using SPG points (or not) I would defiantly recommend the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic W”
Reviews.Author: Chiron58
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently visited San Diego for a carshow and stayed at this great hotel. The concierges, Robbie in particular, were more than helpful in everything we asked. We got directions, advice and into the clubs with no problems. The front desk staff was very helpful checking in and out. The room service was pretty quick for a 3 A.M. Saturday meal. The room was beautiful, very clean, modern and quiet. Everything I could have asked for without the ruffly chintz in so many hotels. Location was also prime, very close to the Gaslamp district. I also want to commend the valet service on taking care of my precious car. They also were excellent.I did not see too many children there and for that I was glad. Seemed to have a urban professional feel. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiev
Reviews.Content: Just left the W San Diego and wanted to report that I had a great time. The hotel is stunning from the time you step in. Staff was great, upon checkin we were informed that our room was not ready. They offered us drink vouchers while we waited. (A great bonus if you asked me). Was offered a great room on the 12th floor, with sweeping views of the city. Yes the location is not next to the gaslamp district, but not isolated. The Wyndham is a block away and so is the American Plaza trolley station (which is closer to Old Town). It was a quick walk to the gaslamp district, 5-10 mins max. The gym was niced and had enough machines for my limited use. Beach bar is fun, but only for a drink or two. Rice looked trendy, but never had a chance to dine there. Yes there is a courthouse, a few blocks away, but I felt completely safe the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W San Diego over the June 3 weekend for the Rock 'N Roll marathon. I had a cool corner room on the 16th floor with a city view. The room was large and comfortably laid out. The bed was fantastic --- much better than Sheraton's version of the Starwood bed. Desk area was large and had no troubles with the high speed internet connection. I took a long nap in the chaise with an extremely soft blanket. The bathroom was also spacious with a great soaking tub (perfect both pre and post race) and some nice bath salts. I loved the glass shower looking out over the city and the bath amenities by Bliss were very nice, in particular, the lemon-sage shea butter. The room was extremely quiet, in fact, I would have thought I was the only person on the 16th floor. The robe and slippers were also very soft and there were plenty of towels. Having stayed at other branches of the W, I really enjoyed the light and airiness of the decor and loved having a wall of floor to ceiling windows and the wooden blinds. Very comfortable! Service from valet, check in and room service was always friendly and prompt. Everyone made a point of greeting me and inquiring about my race, my stay, etc... Room service was prompt --- the food was presented nicely and was good but not excellent --- just what I would expect from room service --- although I found the menu to be a little limited. I did eat at Rice one morning for breakfast and my food was very good and very plentiful plus the service was appropriately friendly. I did not take time to enjoy the lobby (the Living Room), the bar (Magnet) or the outdoor space (Beach). I did peek in at the pool which is laughably small --- more like a plunge pool than anything else. The gym (Sweat) seemed well equipped as well. I did stop by Beach (with the warm sand floor) on Sunday evening after the race but did not stay as I didn't feel particularly comfortable alone but would definitely return with my spouse. Perhaps, the trendiness has died down, but I never experienced any overwhelming crowds. The location, for me, was ideal. Easy in/easy out for the airport and for the other locations I visited during my long weekend. I did not find the neighborhood to be unsafe or unsavory. It is a very short walk to the Horton Plaza, to the trolley stations and to the waterfront. For what it is worth, I did spend some time with friends who were staying at the Sheraton Marina and found that location, while convenient, was far from relaxing. I was much happier with my hotel selection. My one regret was on the morning of my check out as I truly was disappointed to be leaving and returning home to Boston. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Night of my Life”
Reviews.Author: ljginla
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I came down to this hotel for one night, from Los Angeles, for my birthday. We checked in early, got a massage, took a nap and headed out the Petco Park. Throughout the game we were so excited to come back and go to bed-the nap was just heaven-the feather top bed was so comfy. To our dismay, a 2 a.m. people from the bar started to pour into the room next to us. They were continuing to party in their rooms from 2-4:30 am. We called down to management for security to get up there 3 times. The guests were smoking cigarettes (on the non-smoking floor re requested) which then seeped into our room. Finally, at 4:30 am we switched room just to 'sleep' only to be awoken by screaming children in the pool at 8:30 am. Upon going back to our original room to get a little bit more sleep, there was a yelping dog barking on our floor, since the W allows pets. Needless to say it was terrible, non-relaxing birthday and an unbearable sleepless night. The Management was inadequate, told us that the hotel was 'full' even though mysteriously a room became available at 4:30 for us to switch in to. It was our first time staying at a W and most definitely our last.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I am a corporate client of this hotel, and place numerous guests throughout the year, so I decided I needed to try it. It could not have been any better. The rooms were beautiful, spacious and yes, trendy, which The W Hotel is know for. The Staff were great, accomodating, and the whatever/whenever way of life at The W is probably what really pushes them above the other hotels in the area. I have traveled to numerous locations around the world, and have stayed at numerous 4 and 5 star hotels, but this has got to be one of the best. Their sand bar is beautiful and a lot of fun, their restaurant is tasty and the bar is a great place to go and unwind. If you are looking to party though, don't go to the lobby bar, it isn't that kind of place. Being an ex-hotelier myself, I am a bit of a hotel snob, but all in all, this hotel is top notch, the service is top notch and the food is even more top notch. I could not find one bad thing to say about this hotel, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: omarsidd
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent 5 nights at the W San Diego this past December. We've both stayed in a lot of hotels, and I've stayed in 3 different W's. This was by far my favorite of those 3 W hotels and one of my most favorite hotels in general. I feel many of the negative reviews here are off-base, I'll explain further at the end of this review. First off, W hotels are modern-chic hotels with tasteful decorations, large lobby areas, luxurious rooms with extra comfortable bedding, and signature bars/restaurants. The San Diego location is no exception. The oversized multi-story lobby area is shared with a small bar and has lots of comfortable seating, and during the day projectors play different soothing scenes on the wall above the bar. The hotel is centrally situated a few blocks from the restaurant-filled "Gaslamp district" in one direction, a few blocks from the waterfront in another, and about 12 blocks from the highway in a third direction. Besides the Gaslamp area and the restaurants in the hotel, there are several small eateries in the area immediately around the hotel. The colors and decor of W San Diego are marine-themed and the bed and bedding were as comfortable as every other W I've been in. Luxurious fluffy down pillows, comforters, etc. A very nice bathroom, electronics, and furniture completed the effect. A small chalk board is a cute touch, and their loungey theme CD playing in the room when we walked in was also very nice. The multiple bars and lounges in the hotel are popular; we arrived on a Saturday night and the lobby lounge was full of beautiful lounge-goers drinking expensive cocktails. We felt underdressed and dirty in the travel garb we had been wearing for the last 8 hours but quickly showered and changed and joined the beautiful people for dinner and drinks ourselves. Service was impeccable. Very fast check-in, nice staff, polite and helpful valets and bartenders. The airy fitness center has an opening to the outside overlooking the pool and is available 24 hours. The latency of the in-room internet connection was very good as was its speed. Now, to address the complaints that make for the see-saw rating on this hotel. I feel some people don't bother to read what W is about before staying here, and expect red-suited bellhops and obsequious doormen for this price range. However, this hotel is catering to the clientele that doesn't want all of that, and instead wants fashionable, chic, modern, efficient, and beautiful. W hotels including this one are NOT old-style hotels with fawning staff and floral bedspreads. For that sort of ambience, look elsewhere. If "hip" is something you want to replace, rather than be, this isn't the hotel for you. A number of people have complained about lack of food in the immediate vicinity; these people apparently didn't go outside the hotel. There were at least 5 eateries within 1.5 blocks of the hotel, including Thai, and two deli/coffee-shops. The north end of the Gaslamp district is maybe a 10 minute walk away if you move slowly. The hotel's area is choice: not so close to the action as to be noisy, but close enough to get there quickly. All of the staff we dealt with were helpful, efficient, and pleasant. Absolutely no complaints from our stay. Minor quibbles with the hotel: - Really expensive valet parking ($35 a day or so), but it does give you in and out as often as you want. All the major downtown hotels in S.D. charge like this, so this isn't W's fault. There's cheaper self-park nearby, IF you plan to come and go only once a day. - Expensive food and drink. Not at all unexpected in a mainline hotel, and the drinks were normally priced for a lounge environment so not a quibble as much as an observation. - Restaurant food was good but uneven, some dishes were stand-out, others were pretty but uninspired. Not surprising in trendy restaurants, but be prepared. Breakfast was very substantial and very good. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother!”
Reviews.Author: Strangey
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while very nice-looking, has serious attitude problems. The service was poor and the staff were dismissive. Having stayed at 3 other hotels in the previous 8 days (for a lot less $) I was atonished how the W did not stack up. On a positive note the beds were gorgeous, the bathroom and bath products top rate and the location was convenient. It is a shame that the service offered here does not match the looks!

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Time at a Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego exceeded our expectations. The W is not for the old at heart: the decorations, the party going on at the lobby at the wee hours of the night, and the entire "motif" make this hotel one for the "in" crowd and that suited us just fine. The bed was heavenly indeed, and the toiletries and amenities do not disappoint. This is a five star hotel for the up-and-coming who do not want to pay Ritz Carlton rates. Luckily for us, we booked this through a pretty hip hotel booking website called Tablet Hotels who have a tight selection of sophisticated hotels that will make you feel young as long as you have just as high expectations about where you sleep as where you dream about sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to the holiday”
Reviews.Author: Michael024
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas 2005 at the end of a tour which started in San Francisco and ended in San Diego having travelled via Las Vegas and Palm Springs. The hotel was our Christmas treat and well worth the wait. The hotel and rooms were exactly what we expected and we had a great reception from all the staff. There was a bathroom problem in one of our rooms on the first night which was handled well (if ineptly at one point) but the result was a change of room without fuss and with a complimentary bottle of fizz, chilled strawberries and a great hand written note of apology (not to mention several complimentaries for the rest of the stay). There is nothing wrong with the location (but we are English so are used to walking) and there are trams practically outside the door: we even sent our rental car back a day early. Then to cap it all there was a complimentary black limo to take us to the airport. We would recommend to anyone provided they remain young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Service was so-so, but I still loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: kalloua
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W from Sunday, December 4 until Wednesday, December 7. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. Before I left I got e-mails both from the spa and the concierge asking if I needed anything, which I appreciated. The service at the hotel was just so-so. Check in was perfect. I didn't have to wait and the man at the front desk was great at highlighting the hotel amenities and verifying my personal preferences. However, other service was spotty. My second night I got a couple drinks in the Living Room while doing work and I practically had to get up and grab the waitress to come over. She also snatched my menu off the table, without asking, which bothered me since I had not closed out my bill and wanted another drink. VERY different from experiences I have had at Four Seasons' Bristol Lounge in Boston where the servers are excellent at making genuine small talk and meeting your every wish. There our waiter consistantly brought us an array of munchies as well as chocolate covered strawberries on the house. Nothing of the sort happened at the W. I also go no newspaper the second two days of my trip, which bothered me since the man at the front desk confirmed my newspaper preferences my first day. The survice was okay at rice. The waiter was prompt and made good recommendations, but there was nothing special about it. I guess that is my consensus. The service was good, but not excellent. However, I still had a great time because service isn't the be all and end all of vacations for me. Most importantly I wanted to enjoy the premise and especially my room which I did. The beds were heavenly, the ample desk space was perfect for a business traveller, and the atmosphere overall was pleasant. I also loved the Bliss products!! Everytime they were replenished daily I snatched them up to take them home!! My room was on the 7th floor at the end of the hallway and was very quiet. There was a bit of noise from one neighbor on my second night, but it wasn't any louder than what I would expect at the hotel. The thing that suprised me most about the hotel was that there was no hot tub! I was really looking forward to a relaxing soak after a long day of work. The pool however was great! There was no one in it when I went and it was suprisingly warm. I found the location to be fine. Is it surrouned by haute shops and flashy restaurants, no. But I wouldn't say it's in a bad neighborhood either. I'm a 20-something petite female and felt perfectly comfortable walking to the harbor and the Gaslight District. In fact I found a lot of shopping and restaurants close by. If you're used to city living or city traveling I don't think you'll find the short walks a problem. I also wasn't surprised by the price of the food, etc. When you stay at a hotel in this range I think it's to be expected. For example, the $9 Voss water is priced comparably in the restaurants I've been to in Boston (it's $5.50 a bottle at rice). It's more expensive to begin with than Evian or other brands. Room service is expensive wherever you go. I also found the food in rice to be appropriately priced. My Swordfish was just okay, but my organic mixed greens salad with manchego, dried strawberries, and pistachos was delish! Overall I would recommend this hotel to those who are more interested in comfort and style than over-the-top service.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy....that's about all”
Reviews.Author: garvine
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the middle of the business district is really close to nothing. Yes, it's VERY trendy, almost too much and quite expensive for what you get. This is the classic case of not paying attention to form following function. The staff seems attentive enough but obviously have been hired for their appearances. The lobby or as they call it the "LIving Room" (Please!) is turned into a club at night and is very noisy. The food is OK but the presentation is over the top pretentious. The $300 a night rooms come with only a shower ( one would certainly expect a tub for $300) which is badly designed as most of the water sprays out into the room. Watch out for the in room amenities like mini bar etc. as they are OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive. I got thirsty in the middle of the night and had to pay $9.00 for a regular size bottle of water (It was from Norway so I guess those Norwegians are getting rich on water). The sound proofing in the rooms is terrible. I could clearly hear conversations in the adjoining room and hallways. Getting a good nights sleep was difficult. If you are young, yuppie and don't care about money, this is the place for you. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonW
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the W San Diego. It was truly unlike any other hotel stay I'd ever experienced. It's one thing to stay in a nice hotel with an aiming-to-please concierge and staff, but if you couple that with some incredible nightlife at the hotel on top of the wonderful decor in the rooms, then, well, you've got a happening place. Such is the W in San Diego. One quick caveat to the previous reviewers who characterized the area as "dead" after working hours--this is not the case at all. The Gaslamp district is just six blocks away, which is either a ten to fifteen minute walk or a $4 cab ride. It's not like you're having to drive to La Jolla (twelve miles north) to find something to do. Sometimes it seems that people expect several restaurants, bars & shops within one block of a hotel. A tad bit unreasonable, eh? Also unreasonable: the previous reviewer who said that the exterior of the hotel was "blah." First of all, who cares? And second of all, it was not "blah." How many other hotels have a fifteen-story waterfall projected on the side of the building? At any rate, the hotel staff was amazing. With the exception of a phantom $23 minibar purchase (which was taken care of immediately) and a slight miscommunication with the hotel lining us up a ride to the airport, everything else was spot on. Do keep in mind that I'm part of the younger crowd, and that is what the W is angling for with their business plan. The interior is very modern and sleek, as are the rooms. The focal point of the rooms is a room-length desk (odd, but it works). The beds are extremely comfortable--down-filled pillowtop mattresses, fluffy pillows, soft sheets, the works. The most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in, bar none. The W Hotel also has a "Whatever, Whenever" service (just push the red button on the phone) that will pretty much get you "whatever, whenever." Need a shaving kit at 4:00 a.m.? No problem. Want room service at any hour of the day or night? No problem. Need a reservation at a local restaurant, or need help in finding one? No problem. Need tickets to a local show or concert? No problem. The concierge guys (especially Chuck, who did an excellent job in securing us reservations), will go out of their way to find you what you need. One final thing to remember is that the hotel, on Friday & Saturday nights, essentially turns into a nightclub. The lobby, known as the "Living Room," turns into a dance club complete with DJ (there's a bar at one end, opposite the front door). It was kind of odd on Friday night to watch people trying to check in amid the chaos of the dance club atmosphere. If you are a hotel "resident," they will give you a wristband so that you don't have to stand in line to get up to the second-floor rooftop Beach bar. Beach is outside and is complete with sand and a copper fire pit and private cabanas. We spent a lot of time up there, just hanging out. We did not get around to checking out the restaurant Rice or the other bar in the hotel, Magnet. All in all, it was a great trip, and I'd definitely stay at the W San Diego again. Just keep in mind that it skews towards the younger crowd, although even though the lobby may be a raging dance club, you wouldn't know it in the rooms--completely silent. Overall, it's a good place to stay for the price and it is convenient to downtown and the area attractions. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Check your final bill!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My opinion of this hotel is mixed... Positives- -Hotel interior so awesome...little seating alcoves scattered about. Exterior blah. -Enjoyed the room decor, especially the window seat -Bliss products in the bathroom! Awesome! -House car took us to Petco park for free -Had the pool all to ourselves...very relaxing afternoon, although its a tiny tiny pool! -We got complementary bottles of the pricey water in our cupholders when valet parking returned our car! SCORE!!!! Negatives- -Location is remote...felt really wary walking back from the gaslamp district on empty streets -Staff clueless or corporate gougers. Told me that there was no convenience store in the vicinity upon check in... there is a 7-11 right down the block selling the expensive Voss water at a considerable discount! -Good thing the lighting is dim...the fixtures and draperies at the hotel have seen better days, and the lack of illumination obscures this. -And last but not least- check the final bill sent to your address. I was charged a considerable sum for minibar usage incorrectly attributed to me. Called the accounting department, and they credited me. Apparently its a common mistake, the minibar inventory controls are in the process of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Me Like a Movie Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the second I made the reservation for my girlfriend's birthday, I was treated like a movie star. The stay was much better than I anticipated... The place is obviously beautiful, the staff was amazing, and the clubs and restaurant are top notch. Definitely a must see experience....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at a few W's and must say this was by far the best! The stay from the moment we arrived to the moment we left was flawless. The staff are truly amazing - friendly, helpful and always were willing to go out of their way to help us. The rooms were really great. Spotlessly clean, comfortable and great decor. All in all, worth the extra few bucks over the other options we looked at in town (usual suspects like Marriott and Hilton). The bars and restaurants were wonderful. Food, service, the lot! We went to the J bar at the Solamar Hotel one night and we had to leave it was so dead and no atmosphere. When we got back to the W it was lively and we had a great evening. Very highly recommend this hotel for a great time at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this area is completely dead after business hours so having the w's bars and restaurants is the only thing to do. the rooms were bigger than other w's i've stayed in and of course the beach bar is a great evening to enjoy the weather. if you can't stay closer to the beach/water, this is the next best alternative.

Reviews.Title: “hip and trendy”
Reviews.Author: vaca7423
Reviews.Content: being a platinum member of starwood, they upgraded up to a "cool corner suite" it was amazing! the night club is really hip and cool, a must go. the restaurant food is awsome especially the carpaccio and the ahi! if you can stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious Beyond Compare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been around the world a time or two, stayed at many four and five star hotels and resorts. The W Hotel in San Diego is, by far, one of the worst I've experienced in terms of service, atmosphere & curb appeal. First, the outside of the hotel, in the middle of a not so great location, is terrible. Ugly stucco colors on the high-rise portion which is attached to an older brick warehouse structure that houses the restaurant and snobby beach bar. The hotel is surrounded by nothing but low-rise office structures, parking lots and boarded up houses. Second, the beach bar, which is touted as a "roof top" bar is very misleading. It's on the third floor of the warehouse building, not the roof of the hotel - it offers no views what so ever, of dowtown, the ocean or neighborhood - nothing. And, the crowd that patronizes the bars, restaurant and living room in San Diego have a very over-inflated sense of self. Rude, katty, obnoxious, wanna-be twenty something girls with their fake sunglasses, fake purses and fake breasts throwing tantrums, chatting loudly on cell phones & playing the "look at her, he said/she said" gossip game. The crowd tends to be very clique-ish with many of the nicer, more friendly and social hanging out in the downstairs magnet bar (these are usually people waiting to be seated for dinner at the Rice restaurant.) Finally, the service was horrific, and something I find untolerable for a place I'm paying $250 a night to stay at. All the in room materials marketing their "Whatever Whenever" service was ironic to me. I called to reserve a table at Rice for three people and they were unable to accommodate me - question, shouldn't guests shelling at out money at the hotel be given preferential treatment when dining at the hotel's own restaurant? Not here. We instead ate at Region which was a phenomenal restaurant up in Hillcrest, about a $6.00 cab ride. Bartenders were unattentive, apparently concerned more with scoring phone numbers & dates than tips from their customers. The sand up at beach bar was a nice touch until you get upstairs to your room and find that it has followed you - it's messy and gets all over the floor, in the shower and in the sheets on the bed. Not very comfortable to sleep in. On a final note, the guest services people have been well trained, but not in guest accommodation. They're robots spouting the pre-determined corporate responses when dealing with customer inquiries & concerns. This didn't make my stay enjoyable, it only infuriated me more and hence, we checked out two days early and stayed at a new B&B up the street in Bankers Hill. The nicest staff member at the W we encountered was the valet who was remembered with a generous tip! Note to the travel savvy: spend your money elsewhere (as this place isn't cheap) - somewhere it will be appreciated and rewawrded with great guest service and a fun & inviting atmosphere. W San Diego was very disappointing. W Los Angeles and W Seattle are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: trinaunz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W with my husband and four-year-old son. No one, guest or staff, gave us a sideways glace for having a child there, and for such an upscale hotel, that was welcome. I found the hotel, rooms and bar very chic, but comfortable. The cabanas near the pool were a fabulous place to lounge, very fun experience. The rooms were quiet, elegant and comfortable. And you can't beat the proximity to the Gaslamp District. We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast - it was great, the service was prompt and courteous. We lucked out and got a great rate - so sign up for their specials by e-mail. So many of the hotels in San Diego are tired and in desperate need of rennovation (this is about our 20th stay in the area), but the W is an exception. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Not So Great Location”
Reviews.Author: toddnath
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the San Diego W as a change of pace from more of the resort-style properties I usually visit when in town. Anyone who is accustomed to the W 'theme' from their other properties will find much of the same here: Sleek, modern, and loungy. The rooms, while small, are adequate and the service is friendly and attentive. At 8pm on a Saturday night the concierge got us an 8:30 reservation at a very popular restaurant in the Gaslamp district. And when we needed more towels they were at our door within 5 minutes. The problem with this hotel is its location. While it's only a short cab ride to the bustling Gas Lamp district it feels so much further due to its bland civic center setting. The rooms generally have views of the hi-rises across the street and no views of the water. Even the Beach - the 3rd floor outdoor sandy lounge- had no quality views whatsoever. I may be nitpicking but when I travel to a resort oriented city, I want to feel like I'm outside of my normal urban routine. This hotel, while nice, could simply be in any downtown area of any city. Stay here if you must, but stay elsewhere if you want to truly get away.

Reviews.Title: “Service and quality beyond comparison -- more than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: voyageur415
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a business trip and had the pleasure of staying at the W San Diego for one night. My "Wonderful" room was the perfect place to return to: calm, luxurious dÃ©cor, loads of great snacks in the room, nice bath accessories, and the *most* comfortable bed in the world. All of the staff -- from the front desk, to the bartenders, to the Whatever/Whenever assistants -- were attentive without being intrusive; knowledgeable without being stuffy, and all really seemed to enjoy working there. Unlike some other luxury hotels, at the W I never felt unwelcome or out-of-place. Both the lobby bar and the second-floor beach bar were very open and welcoming, and the restaurant, Rice, served a fabulous breakfast. Here's to hoping I'm in San Diego (or any other city graced by a W) more often -- the W will definitely see me there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not the best W”
Reviews.Author: tbowne
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this W 3 times and have had a great experience. A few years ago I did have a problem with my reservation and I got the run around for 2 days and my problem was never resolved. My last stay was just last week. We have a good time at the beach bar and at the tiny pool. The staff was very courteous and when our drinks took to long, the waitress apologized and comped them. The hotel location is not ideal but not bad if you don't mind taking a $3 cab. The reviews complaining about costs are obviously from cheap travelers. I was not surprised by valet charges or the cost of a drink. If you want to self park or get a cheap drink, stay at Hilton. The hotel rooms are small but very nicely appointed with great beds and linens and towels. I could do without all the junk they sell in the room. Who needs flip-flops and hats in the mini bar, you can buiy that at Horton Plaza. The Bliss bath products are a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The W is a wonderful hotel with great staff. The pool area is small and not what I expected. Very modern decor and everything was so clean. The hotel had every amenitie you could ever want. We forgot hair spray and room service brought some up at no extra charge. The living room was a great place to have a drink. We drove from up the coast about 2 hours back in the beginning of April 2005 for a concert. While the hotel room was nice, it was just modern looking ikea furniture. Nothing to write home about but the staff was nice and our stay was pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone except for the price, $325 a night plus $20 a day for parking. If your visiting San Diego and the gas lamp district and can afford such a heafty price, go for it. If not, I'd stay somewhere else. Very Very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about our stay because of the wide range of reviews we read. Either people loved the hotel or hated it. Well....we agree with the people who loved it. The hotel staff were ALL courteous, friendly and greeted us at the front door and on the phone. Our two double bed room seemed small because of the large desk area. Having a DVD player and CD player was convenient. We could have used a few more drawers but there was extra storage under the TV area. I even wiped out all the drawers and found not a spot of dirt on the white towel! The window seat was a little high, but was very comfortable. The down comforter and featherbed were great. There was no problem with privacy in the bathroom (which we had read in a couple of reviews). The sliding frosted glass-panel door gave the bathroom a roomier and modern feel. (There was no lock.) We had to wait for check-in but they were considerate, offering us drinks while we waited and even brought our keys directly to us. Only drawback was the valet parking at $26/night, with our car parked in the public lot across the street. We should have underground parking at that price... The hotel is trendy and modern design. Our teenage boys enjoyed the decor so much, they kept on taking pictures to show their friends. It is only 5 blocks from Horton Plaza, with not much in-between. The Rice Restaurant was expensive but done well. This hotel is geared for the younger, hipper crowd but made our family welcome, too. If you like older, stuffy, formal accommodations, you will not be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and fun”
Reviews.Author: Pullman1
Reviews.Content: A chic, slightly hard-edged hotel in a quiet, revitalized area of offices and residences within walking distance of the harbor and downtown. Though relatively small, my room was well equipped, with a great bed, a wonderful shower, good electronics, and many stylish touches. The only downside was the lack of a comfortable reading chair. The "beach" bar, a lively outdoor sandy space with an open fire, is a hoot; but the "pool" is just for dipping, not for swimming. Room service breakfast was fast and accurate. Dinner in the hotel's restaurant was excellent -- creative food really well prepared and presented -- though some in my party thought there weren't enough choices. As in most W hotels, your fellow guests are a major part of the show. Beautiful, stylish young people alternating with aging People in Black working hard to be "with it." The noise level in the public rooms is high, but the bedrooms have perfect sound-proofing. Overall, I really enjoyed this place. Paid a lot for the experience, and loved almost every moment. But I would not recommend it to people who want traditional comforts. Go for the adventure!

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego Earns An A Rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the recently posted positive reviews of the W San Diego. This is a stylish, fun, relaxing hotel...and every staff member was super friendly and accommodating. We (my wife and I) flew in on a Friday in July from Colorado. In two hours, we exchanged a torrid, sun-baked, 90-degree day on the Front Range for cold drinks, low 70s, a sea breeze, and a couple of top-notch appetizers at the rooftop Beach bar. Outstanding! The lobby living room is comfortable, dramatic, and a great place to hang with a latte and a laptop. Okay, we've stayed in larger rooms but who really needs the extra space? W beds are the best, the window seat was just right for reading, and the shower ranks top-three of all the hotels we've enjoyed around the world. We'll go back, without question. We'll also know to discount--or at least question--bitter, puzzling, one-star reviews posted by others on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews of this hotel, my husband and I were a little wary when we booked a room here -- one of the only rooms in town because of a convention. But in no unequivocal terms, we LOVED this hotel. Two caveats: 1) Don't bring the kids, and 2) Don't stay here if you want to lounge by a pool all weekend (the pool is about the size of a postage stamp). But, if you want a stylish, hip, fun getaway -- my husband & I were celebrating our 10th anniversary without the kids -- run, don't walk, to this hotel. I'm baffled by the comments about rude staff on this website -- we were treated like royalty by the front desk personnel, concierge (who recommended an excellent seafood restaurant downtown called Oceanaire), bartenders and other staff. Also, the guests here were extremely friendly; everyone at this hotel was here to have a good time, and we talked to a load of people at the hotel lobby bar (a great place to come back to for a nightcap, though not a quiet one). The rooms were smallish but very nice & different from your average upper-range hotel, with the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in in any hotel anywhere. The rooms were pretty modern, which we found refreshing. If you're looking for a B&B or Marriott-type atmosphere, skip this place. But if you're looking for a stylish hotel, lively atmosphere, and excellent and fun staff & clientele, I highly recommend this hotel. Can't wait to stay at another W!

Reviews.Title: “W is a nice place . . .”
Reviews.Author: deftonesmo
Reviews.Content: Pros: great customer service . . . super comfy beds . . . call the front desk and they bring shampoo, etc. up super fast . . . great bars . . . Cons: Pool is ridiculously tiny . . . $26 a day for valet parking . . . some attitutude from bartender . . . not walking distance to gaslamp/petco park . . .small rooms . . . If you like swanky stuff anda ren't afraid to pay $200+ to get it, this is place for you . . . I felt pampered and appreciated, but it comes at a price . . .

Reviews.Title: “This is 'W???!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a horrid little place. The most rude and ostentatious of staffs. Front bar bartender: ordered drink as I like it; made it the way he wanted it -- undrinkable. Not a smile; not a hello: nada. Beach bar waitress: rude and actually offensive; snatched my martini glass from me, never asked me if I'd like another drink -- just a "have to have that glass, sir." Restaurant bar: thought we'd finally hit the right spot; pleasant bartender, good martini. Returned for a second round (of 5 by the way), and told there were no more martini glasses, but he could put it in a plastic cup. Actually suggested I drink a $12 Grey Goose martini out of a plastic cup. This is a "W" hotel? -- never again anywhere, anytime!

Reviews.Title: “W - Nice Hotel in a Questionable Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Diego W is a delightful retreat from its immediate neighborhood - homeless, courthouse, bail bonds, you get the drift! Clearly, you want to avoid being around the neighborhood during the wee hours. Upon arrival to the lobby, the visitor is greeted to an eclectic atmosphere and some friendly staff people. Make a trip to "The Beach" - located on the second floor of the W; a sandy beach with a full bar (attractive hostess) with a firepit and cabanas awaits you. My colleagues and I enjoyed a wonderful night cap up there!! The rooms are chic, but I was disappointed with the internet connection (T-line had problems AND disconnected several times)!! The restaurant was overpriced and tasteless - I would have prefered a greasy spoon based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “not as hoped”
Reviews.Author: HMS007
Reviews.Content: paid 280 for standard room for three nights. Had been impressed with W hotels in LA, Chicago and NYC. THis one is very disappointing. Service was marginal as we had requested a microwave prior to arriving and when it was not there at time of arrival, had to talk to FOUR different people before the amenity was set up. Room also small considering the money paid. The second story SANDBAR was pretty good but other than that, the location of the hotel was further away from most of the GAslamp restaurants than the marriot or the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego - A Pefect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DENTraveler01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. I stayed in a Cool Corner room - very spacious. The bathroom was especially great with a rainfall shower head. The bed, as in all W Hotels was terrific. I have stayed in many W Hotels and I could not disagree more with some of the posts regarding this hotel. It is first class, with nice sized rooms and amenities. The beach bar on the second floor and the hotel pool are both great. Great crowds and people watching. There's alot going on at this hotel! I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, noisy floor”
Reviews.Author: stillmars321
Reviews.Content: As usual with any W Hotel I've visited, the whole place was trendy, modern and model-type service. But we were woken up at 2 a.m. from the DJ music and party atmosphere from the 1st floor lobby/bar area. We had to pack up and move in the middle of the night to a higher floor... very inconvenient. If you're looking for a good night sleep, ask for a higher floor. If you like the party, stay up all night downstairs. The area was dead around the hotel, nothing to do on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “This is one Hotel that we would be very happy to NEVER check out of.”
Reviews.Author: Michael&Jon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the W this past weekend and we had a blast. The service was great from the moment we drove up. The Wheels staff got our luggage and the leash to our Doberman and whisked us into the hotel and the porsche into the garage. Once inside the music was going and the drinks were being poured that we had to run up to our room, change and run back down and join the party. The decor of the hotel was very stylish and our room was fun and very comfortable. We did each day set out to do different things in SD, but we found ourselves wanting to go back to the W for drinks, a game a chess in the living room bar or a swim in the pool. The beach bar staff was also ecellent,..esp. one black haired girl that was particular great. If you like a fun, stylish, party- style hotel, then the W Hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, hated the service”
Reviews.Author: BelleM77
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Let me start off with the good...my husband and I loved the decor of the hotel, we loved our room (Kool Korner) and bathroom and we didn't mind the nightclub in the lobby. We had no trouble getting from outside to the elevators and we had no problem with the noise or the people. The only thing we didn't love about the hotel is the service. We arrived at 3:30 (30 mins. after check-in) and were told out room wasn't ready. The woman at the front counter checked our luggage (one piece) and asked for our cell phone number. She said would call us when our room was ready. In the meantime, she said we could a drink at the bar and our room would be ready shortly. We ended paying for our own drinks and after an hour of waiting for our room (we wouldn't have went up and checked on the room earlier but we were trying not to get worked up over it) my husband finally checked on it. The same girl was working at the counter and said our room was ready. She didn't apologize for not calling nor did she apologize us waiting so long for the room. She did tell us though that our luggage would be sent up to our room. We got into our room (loved it!) and then proceeded to wait another hour for our luggage to come up. We ended up calling the front desk trying to locate our luggage. The gentleman that answered the phone apologized profusely and said he would send it right up. We waited another hour and my husband finally had to go downstairs and get our luggage himself. Since the front desk manager wasn't around (go figure) some other supervisor apologized and said he would have front desk manager credit us $50. It turns out, our luggage was in the closet next to the front desk and sitting right there in the front for anyone who opened the closet doors. Before we left, we filled out our comment card and took the review online. You would think after taking both of those surveys, someone would have contacted us and apologized again but no. I finally ended up emailing Starwood about a month later complaining about the service. I did get a call a few days later and the employee and I played phone tag for a few weeks. The one thing that upset me was that whenever I left him a voicemail, it took him 3, sometimes 7, days to get back to me. When my last voice mail was never answered, I emailed Starwood again. This time the gentleman I was playing phone tag with emailed me and actually had the gall to tell me there was some confusion as to who called who last. He did apologize again and said that he would credit our SPG account 10,000 pts. which is good for one night free. I know, some of you are probably wondering why we waited around for an hour each time something was going wrong. The reason why we waited is because we do not like to be the people breathing down the employee's necks (even when we pay $350/night) and we really do not normally complain about anything. We are pretty mellow, go with the flow people. I guess we learned our lesson. I think what also made me frustrated with everything is that this was the only trip my husband and I could afford after buying our first house last summer. And look how it turned out! I do also have to say that we were given a 4pm check-out but that was before everything started happening and I specifically asked for it. I would have to say that if the girl we encountered at the front desk took care of us better, we probably would not have been as upset as we were. I wouldn't recommend that W San Diego to anyone due to the service. I would however, stay in another W in a different city.

Reviews.Title: “'W' for 'W'aste of Money”
Reviews.Author: RaiderEd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most overrated property I have ever stayed at - either personal or travel. I stayed with my wife on our anniversary and found nothing to like about this property. The staff was all terribly pretentious. If you weren't sporting Armani or Gucci, you were at the back of the line. In addition, being heterosexual made us feel like second-class citizens here! The room was a joke, it looked more like a children's day care center. The toilet stopped working after the first flush (but thankfully was fixed rather quickly). Location is not great for San Diego as it is basically close to nothing unless you want to hike several blocks. To top it off, they have no parking other than valet ($$) and all they do is drive your car accross the street and park it in an Ace public parking lot. Avoid this place at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Love it or hate it!”
Reviews.Author: Civillit1
Reviews.Content: First, I have read nearly every review that comes before this and still felt compelled to chime in. This hotel is hip, young and stylish. When your phone says "Wheels" for Valet and they answer the phone "Welcome to Wonderland" you know this isn't your ordinary hotel. If you want standard chain hotel flair this isn't where you will find it. The hotel's elevator's are lit by 4 dim halogen spots, the elevator lobby has videos of serenity images throughout and the only way to distinguish between a hip guest and the concierge is the small metal "W" pinned on his collar. Is it expensive? Yes. You are in San Diego in the heart of downtown. Breakfast is expensive and drinks cost more than a 6 pack of Keystone at your local grocery store. Is it pretentious? No. For the most part, the staff are hip people who want to please and make this a unique experience. If you want the Four Seasons, it isn't. EVERYTHING screams "hip" so loudly that it almost becomes overbearing. Is it spacious? I can't speak to every room. We had a beautiful room on the 18th floor. UPGRADE to the Kool Korner Room. It was huge, nicely appointed and beautiful. We loved the linens and towels so much, we are buying a complete set for the house. Is it worth the price? Depends on you. If you are hip...yes. If you are looking for cool and trendy and funky...yes. If you want different and a unique hotel experience...yes. If you are looking for a quiet, out of the way Residence Inn...no. Never. Not in a million years. PETS: The W has a policy regarding pets. It is a VERY generous policy. They encourage you to bring your animals with you and charge you accordingly. But, this W is in the middle of downtown with VERY FEW places to walk the dog. While it is friendly and accomodating, you literally have to walk past 10 homeless and sleeping individuals to get to the nearest grass area which just happens to be in front of the downtown jail/court house. I loved the hotel and would stay again. I just wouldn't bring the dog.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other W's around the country and this one is below average. The rooms are cramped. Work space is worthless. Bathrooms unremarkable. Worst of all the lobby is a bar. That's cool for young, single 20-somethings, but a pain in the neck for any guest that is trying to get to their room. Service is good, but wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I am surprised this is through Starwood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our teenage son just got back from the W hotel in San Diego and I was trying to find the on-line information to send to the relatives(saying cross this one off your list of hotels to stay in) when I saw this site and had to add a comment. I can't even begin to say how disappointed we were when we walked into our room. The first comment I made to my family was "this is just a glorified motel six". This was a very small,small room. The chair was a plastic roll around kids room chair. There was a blackboard above the plastic partical board desk. The decor was kids room blue and white. My husband said that it looked like a room done at the IKEA for small children. We had room service for breakfast and for eggs,bacon,toast,coffee for 2, One milk 3 yogurts and 4 donuts...the bill was 115.00 US dollars with the tax. That is outrageous. There were no prices on the order tag (that is hung on the door) that we ordered from. If we had known the prices ahead of time we would have waited and gone to a cafe and gotten breakfast,lunch and dinner for that price. We recently stayed in the St. Regis hotel in Monarch Bay and the rooms where alot nicer and room service prices about half the price as the W. Just our opinion.. do not waste your good time unless staying in a Suite. Maybe ask to see your room before commiting to a stay.

Reviews.Title: “liked the music”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W San Diego in the beginning of September and it was our third or fourth stay there. The hotel is really comfortable, the floors have a boutique feeling in that there are not too many rooms on each floor. We like to be able to watch DVDs if we feel like it, or to go have a drink at the hip Beach bar on the roof. The lobby is a pleasure to walk through - the music is cool electonica, lounge type that sets a nice mood. Maybe that is why the staff are all relaxed and happy. If you want to go to the beach you have to rent a car anyway, so the location is not a disadvantage in that sense.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone, but I enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller143
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is a trendy venue for San Diego's hip crowd, but when you are on the 11th floor as I was, that didn't affect my stay at all. The lobby is a hive of activity and is well designed to be more than just a place to check-in. The "whatever, whenever" concierge service was excellent - I got some good advice on restaurants, car hire etc and found the team to be really helpful. It is true you do have to walk past people standing in line to get into the hotel on weekend nights, but part of the charm is that YOU can walk straight past them and in! The room was a typical W room - fairly small but very well equipped. The location was fine for walking to the Gaslamp Quarter (10 mins only), and taxis were always available when needed. My only problem was the breakfast - too expensive and it arrived nearly cold, but when I pointed this out it was dealt with speedily with lots of apologies. So, Yes I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too pretentious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels and have seen a lot. This is the first time I am staying at a W. Well, I have to say this is a bit too pretentious to my taste. Furthermore, the room is tiny, compared to other Starwood hotels such as the Westin, which, by the way, I would definitely perfer. I guess the idea is that it is supposed to be a hip, modern, or whatever environment and that's pretty much what you are paying for. I am afraid that's pretty much it.

Reviews.Title: “stylish comfort at a price”
Reviews.Author: Flipje
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous few nights at the W in late Sept 2004. Absolutely delightful service. Very attentive and friendly staff. Nicely designed room; my first time at a W, so impressive to see something out of the ordinary compared with major chain hotels. Room was fine size-wise, but that's a European perspective. Super comfy bed. Spotlessly clean. Very popular bar, also for non-residents. The hotel does have a "clubbÃ¿" feel, certainly at the weekends, with quite loud music - which I could hear in the background even on the fifteenth floor. If you don't like a lively atmosphere, then this is unlikely to be your hotel. The style does come at a price. Room service v.expensive, but speedily delivered, with style and taste! Didn't have a car, so no problem with parking. They let me 'park' my (clean and dry!) bike in the room for security. The same week I also stayed at the Westin, and have to say I prefered it for location - right next to a mall, and for its reasonable size pool (the W's is very small).

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected...doubt that i would return”
Reviews.Author: yiannis93101
Reviews.Content: some friends spoke highly of their stays at san diegos W hotel, plus i read a lot of the hype when the hotel 1st opened a year or so ago. i was anxious to visit my self. to say it is ultra hip and chic--THE place to be and be sean...i don't think so. our room was ready at 12noon when we arrived by train from santa barbara. that surprised me as i expected a long wait for a room given what so many of the other reader have posted. being a sheraton platinum member in SPG it would have been nice to be given an upgrade or special ammenity but none were to be had. i did get an extra 500 starwood points but nothing more. some other starwood hotels i stayed in gave free cocktails, fruit/cheese plate, some little welcome ditty, but nothing was to be had here. the room was small to say the least but well stocked---with items we'd never use. one annoying thing was the lack of drapes..the louvered blinds were pretty but they didn't keep the light out...for an afternoon siesta, or in the evening when the hotels decorative lights blast thru the blinds. the bathroom does offer a lack of privacy, but what's worse is the shower curtain...or lack there of. the 3/4 glass enclosure in the shower stall is ultra-modern but 1 minute in the shower and the floor is soaked! spend some money and get a full enclosure for goodness sake! the bar scence i won't even get into. it's like a frat party going on in the lobby and sandbar. i resent the fact of $7 drinks in a plastic cup. i thought this was a hotel, not a night club. please, please, make it into one! i've stayed at other W's and none were like this. now i must admit i'm in the travel industry and was extended a very special, reasonable rate. i cannot in my wildest dreams imagine why anyone would pay the lead in rate of $259.00 for the pleasure (?) of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with the horrible reviews. I wish I would have known about the party scene. This is more of a nightclub than a relaxing hotel. The location is even worse. It is in the middle of the business district and not near any beach. The food and drinks are extremely overpriced and marginal, unless you don't mind paying $10 per drink in a plastic cup! The staff (very rude) did not care that we were hotel guests (for 5 nights) we still had to wait in line with all the outsiders to get into the bar, unless we were on their "VIP" list or had a wristband on. The lines and crowds outside the hotel were obnoxious. You can't even hangout in the lobby-it is also roped off & used as a nightclub. They will not allow you to enter the pool and fitness area after 8pm on weekends due to access for VIPs to the beach bar. I wish I would have checked out the same day and left to Coronado! This hotel is overpriced & overrated...I can go on and on!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the W”
Reviews.Author: JimDay
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night visit at this Hotel. We entered the lobby which we found out later is a club and experienced very LOUD music. The Concierge greeted us wearing flip flops. We arrived in our room and it was truly "bare bones" and was the most uncomfortable room we have stayed in and we have stayed in a lot of them over the years. There were two things good in the entire experience....the down pillows on the bed were great and the staff was very helpful. Don't even think of having breakfast in the hotel unless you want food that is inferior to McDonald's. The room had one chair which was plastic with casters and was very uncomfortable. They did have a cushion on a raised window seat with pillows. We will never go there again or to any other W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last weekend a friend and I decided to go to the W to experience the inside/outside bar. When we got there about 9:00 the line was about 50 people long. We finally entered the downstairs bar at 1030!!! Totall Unsat.. To make matters worse, the downstairs bar is not conducive to large crowds. In fact, a majority of the people (about 80%) were packed like sardines waiting to get to the upstairs bar. Finally we were upstairs at 12:25! Now we spent a total of 3 hours in two separate lines. I think the W could profit more by people buying drinks not waiting in lines. Too add insult to injury, the barstaff and doormen were very rude. This is not a customer service oriented bar and I can assure that I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Hip & Chic”
Reviews.Author: LisaV-06
Reviews.Content: Very funky, hip & young. Loved the decor & the staff was exceptionally pleasant & professional. They were always onhand to answer any questions, provide directions and direct us to restaurants/attractions. We loved the window seat, the very comfortable bed & the "boutique hotel" feel. A couple of BIG problems though....the rooms are not very big (but comfortable) & the bathroom offers NO privacy what-so-ever & there's a $26/day valet charge. You can come & go as often as you like but the added parking fee seems a little much. Overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “serene and romantic corner rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: pay the extra $$ and get a corner "wonderful" room. you will get a beautifully serene extra large room with fantastic views and a huge bathroom with separate shower and tub. fabulous shower head, by-the-way! when my partner and i arrived, our room was not quite ready, so they gave us two free drinks, and we sipped them under an unbrella on the sandbar you've probably heard about. as you enter the room, a cd is playing to welcome you, which you get to keep (free of charge, yes, i said "free" for you continental breakfast junkies). i had pre-arranged for a boquet of wildflowers to be waiting in the room for my partner, and there they were. and all i had to do was type that request in when i made the reservation. of course, the cost was added to my bill, but you don't get gorgeous wildflowers for "free." and someone in a previous post mentioned mirrors in the room to make the rooms "look bigger" . . . maybe that's the case in the smaller rooms, but in the corner room, the mirrors are strategically placed in the room and bathroom for . . . let's just say for "other" reasons. trust me. :) if you come to the W, be prepared to pay lots of $$ for everything, but if you let that go--that's what vacations are for after all--you'll love your stay. it goes without saying that the bed was dreamy! and while the crowd downstairs is hopping and trendy, your corner room will be a serene and romantic getaway just for you and your lover. :) enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “I Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like nothing I've stayed at before. Be sure to get the cool corner room for $70 more. Much more space than the regular rooms. Well worth it. Oh yeah, be sure not to get the minibar, they slap on a bar charge that's as much as the room. I live in San Diego and staying here was like a vacation away from home. Would I stay here again? Most definately! Don't forget to grab your CD on your way out.

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what is wrong with the people who posted negative reviews.. My fiancee and I stayed at the W last weekend and it was great!! The concierce was great, the room was great and the food was great.. I don't know what the regular rooms are like but anyone who has stayed at a W knows that you should always get a Kool Korner King. The room was spotless..Huge bathroom and a great bed.. It is very close to the Gaslamp and all of the major attractions. They also have a complimentary town car service that is available to hotel guests for use in the downtown area. Yes it is expensive, but you get what you pay for. The lobby "living room" is a great place to hang out and have a drink after a long day of walking around.

Reviews.Title: “All flash and no substance?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and doubt I will do it again. First, the positives: the location is great; the place is very stylish; the staff is eager to please; the bars (both lobby and the "beach") are usually busy with a youngish good-looking crowd; great beds; DVD and CD players in rooms. The Negatives: Tiny rooms, small "valet only" parking lot; bad heating/cooling system; staff can be annoyingly cloying; tiny, open-air gym; tiny pool; ridiculously expensive. If you have been to a W Hotel before you know the formula; I will not belabor the point. Suffice it to say that when the main consideration is style, other things suffer. The parking situation is terrible. There is not enough room for all the cars when the place gets busy, and the "valet only" nature means that you cannot just go down to your car to recieve an item; you must have the valet go get your car for you because you are not allowed in the lot. There are no overnight lots that I could find in the immediate vicinity, so this is a pain. There is plenty of staff, perhaps too many, and they are so in your face with their pleasantness and eagerness that it is a little over the top in my opinion; my girlfriend and I were constantly rolling our eyes at their false attempts at camraderie. Undoubtedly, some people like this treatment - to each his own. The rooms, unless you pay big bucks for a corner King, are New York sized (read: tiny). Ditto the pool and the gym. Also, the gym is completely open to the elements: when it is cold or rainy or windy (yes, these things happen in SD!), so are you. The CD player in my room was not up to snuff like the one at W Seattle, but I love the DVD player in every room. As for the heat and air-con unit: this thing was rattling all night even though we had it off. And we could hear everything the people in a neighboring room said through the shared ducting system. Yikes. My main issue with this place is the price. The rooms are costly, and so is every little thing there. My continental breakfast was nearly $30 when all was said and done.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: angel_28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary there last June. From the moment we arrived, the Valet knew we were there for a special occasion when he asked for my name. The same for the person at the front desk. We were shown our room and were surprised to see a bottle of chapagne (Moet & Chandon, not the cheap stuff) with a card from Whatever/Whenever. All through the weekend we were congratulated. You do get what you pay for.

HotelInfo.Name: W San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 421 West B Street, San Diego, CA 92101
